2507 if (window->frame)
2508 window->saved_rect.x += window->frame->rect.x;
2509 }
2510 if (!window->maximized_vertically)
2511 {
2512 window->saved_rect.y = window->rect.y;
2513 window->saved_rect.height = window->rect.height;
2514 if (window->frame)
2515 window->saved_rect.y += window->frame->rect.y;
2516 }
2517 }
2518}
2519
2520/**
2521 * Save the user_rect regardless of whether the window is maximized or
2522 * fullscreen. See save_user_window_placement() for most uses.
2523 *
2524 * \param window Store current position of this window for future reference
2525 */
2526static void
2527force_save_user_window_placement (MetaWindow *window)
2528{
2529 meta_window_get_client_root_coords (window, &window->user_rect);
2530}
2531
2532/**
2533 * Save the user_rect, but only if the window is neither maximized nor
2534 * fullscreen, otherwise the window may snap back to those dimensions
2535 * (bug #461927).
2536 *
2537 * \param window Store current position of this window for future reference
2538 */
2539static void
2540save_user_window_placement (MetaWindow *window)
2541{
2542 if (!(META_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED (window)((window)->maximized_horizontally && (window)->
maximized_vertically) || META_WINDOW_SIDE_TILED (window)((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)) || window->fullscreen))
2543 {
2544 MetaRectangle user_rect;
2545
2546 meta_window_get_client_root_coords (window, &user_rect);
2547
2548 if (!window->maximized_horizontally)
2549 {
2550 window->user_rect.x = user_rect.x;
2551 window->user_rect.width = user_rect.width;
2552 }
2553 if (!window->maximized_vertically)
2554 {
2555 window->user_rect.y = user_rect.y;
2556 window->user_rect.height = user_rect.height;
2557 }
2558 }
2559}
2560
2561void
2562meta_window_maximize_internal (MetaWindow *window,
2563 MetaMaximizeFlags directions,
2564 MetaRectangle *saved_rect)
2565{
2566 /* At least one of the two directions ought to be set */
2567 gboolean maximize_horizontally, maximize_vertically;
2568 maximize_horizontally = directions & META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL;
2569 maximize_vertically = directions & META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL;
2570 g_assert (maximize_horizontally || maximize_vertically)do { if (maximize_horizontally || maximize_vertically) ; else
g_assertion_message_expr ("marco", "core/window.c", 2570, ((
const char*) (__func__)), "maximize_horizontally || maximize_vertically"
); } while (0);
2571
2572 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
2573 "Maximizing %s%s\n",
2574 window->desc,
2575 maximize_horizontally && maximize_vertically ? "" :
2576 maximize_horizontally ? " horizontally" :
2577 maximize_vertically ? " vertically" : "BUGGGGG");
2578
2579 if (saved_rect != NULL((void*)0))
2580 window->saved_rect = *saved_rect;
2581 else
2582 meta_window_save_rect (window);
2583
2584 if (maximize_horizontally && maximize_vertically)
2585 window->saved_maximize = TRUE(!(0));
2586
2587 window->maximized_horizontally =
2588 window->maximized_horizontally || maximize_horizontally;
2589 window->maximized_vertically =
2590 window->maximized_vertically || maximize_vertically;
2591
2592 /* Fix for #336850: If the frame shape isn't reapplied, it is
2593 * possible that the frame will retains its rounded corners. That
2594 * happens if the client's size when maximized equals the unmaximized
2595 * size.
2596 */
2597 if (window->frame)
2598 window->frame->need_reapply_frame_shape = TRUE(!(0));
2599
2600 recalc_window_features (window);
2601 set_allowed_actions_hint (window);
2602 set_net_wm_state (window);
2603}
2604
2605void
2606meta_window_maximize (MetaWindow *window,
2607 MetaMaximizeFlags directions)
2608{
2609 MetaRectangle *saved_rect = NULL((void*)0);
2610 /* At least one of the two directions ought to be set */
2611 gboolean maximize_horizontally, maximize_vertically;
2612 maximize_horizontally = directions & META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL;
2613 maximize_vertically = directions & META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL;
2614 g_assert (maximize_horizontally || maximize_vertically)do { if (maximize_horizontally || maximize_vertically) ; else
g_assertion_message_expr ("marco", "core/window.c", 2614, ((
const char*) (__func__)), "maximize_horizontally || maximize_vertically"
); } while (0);
2615
2616 /* Only do something if the window isn't already maximized in the
2617 * given direction(s).
2618 */
2619 if ((maximize_horizontally && !window->maximized_horizontally) ||
2620 (maximize_vertically && !window->maximized_vertically))
2621 {
2622 if (window->shaded && maximize_vertically)
2623 {
2624 /* Shading sucks anyway; I'm not adding a timestamp argument
2625 * to this function just for this niche usage & corner case.
2626 */
2627 guint32 timestamp =
2628 meta_display_get_current_time_roundtrip (window->display);
2629 meta_window_unshade (window, timestamp);
2630 }
2631
2632 /* if the window hasn't been placed yet, we'll maximize it then
2633 */
2634 if (!window->placed)
2635 {
2636 window->maximize_horizontally_after_placement = window->maximize_horizontally_after_placement || maximize_horizontally;
2637 window->maximize_vertically_after_placement = window->maximize_vertically_after_placement || maximize_vertically;
2638 return;
2639 }
2640
2641 if (window->tile_mode != META_TILE_NONE)
2642 {
2643 saved_rect = &window->saved_rect;
2644
2645 window->maximized_vertically = FALSE(0);
2646 window->tile_mode = META_TILE_NONE;
2647 }
2648
2649 meta_window_maximize_internal (window,
2650 directions,
2651 saved_rect);
2652
2653 /* move_resize with new maximization constraints
2654 */
2655 meta_window_queue(window, META_QUEUE_MOVE_RESIZE);
2656
2657 meta_compositor_maximize_window (window->display->compositor, window);
2658 }
2659}
2660
2661static void
2662unmaximize_window_before_freeing (MetaWindow *window)
2663{
2664 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
2665 "Unmaximizing %s just before freeing\n",
2666 window->desc);
2667
2668 window->maximized_horizontally = FALSE(0);
2669 window->maximized_vertically = FALSE(0);
2670
2671 if (window->withdrawn) /* See bug #137185 */
2672 {
2673 window->rect = window->saved_rect;
2674 set_net_wm_state (window);
2675 }
2676 else if (window->screen->closing) /* See bug #358042 */
2677 {
2678 /* Do NOT update net_wm_state: this screen is closing,
2679 * it likely will be managed by another window manager
2680 * that will need the current _NET_WM_STATE atoms.
2681 * Moreover, it will need to know the unmaximized geometry,
2682 * therefore move_resize the window to saved_rect here
2683 * before closing it. */
2684 meta_window_move_resize (window,
2685 FALSE(0),
2686 window->saved_rect.x,
2687 window->saved_rect.y,
2688 window->saved_rect.width,
2689 window->saved_rect.height);
2690 }
2691}
2692
2693void
2694meta_window_tile (MetaWindow *window)
2695{
2696 /* Don't do anything if no tiling is requested */
2697 if (window->tile_mode == META_TILE_NONE)
2698 return;
2699
2700 if (window->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT ||
2701 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)
2702 {
2703 MetaRectangle *saved_rect = NULL((void*)0);
2704 saved_rect = &window->saved_rect;
2705 meta_window_maximize_internal (window, META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL, saved_rect);
2706 }
2707 else if (window->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT ||
2708 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT ||
2709 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT ||
2710 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_LEFT)
2711 {
2712 MetaRectangle *saved_rect = NULL((void*)0);
2713 saved_rect = &window->saved_rect;
2714 meta_window_maximize_internal (window, META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL, saved_rect);
2715 }
2716 else
2717 meta_window_save_rect (window);
2718
2719 window->tiled = TRUE(!(0));
2720 /* move_resize with new tiling constraints
2721 */
2722 meta_window_queue (window, META_QUEUE_MOVE_RESIZE);
2723
2724 set_allowed_actions_hint (window);
2725}
2726
2727void
2728meta_window_untile (MetaWindow *window)
2729{
2730 window->tiled = FALSE(0);
2731
2732 meta_window_unmaximize (window, META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL | META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL);
2733}
2734
2735static gboolean
2736meta_window_can_tile_maximized (MetaWindow *window)
2737{
2738 return window->has_maximize_func;
2739}
2740
2741gboolean
2742meta_window_can_tile (MetaWindow *window)
2743{
2744 const MetaXineramaScreenInfo *monitor;
2745 MetaRectangle tile_area;
2746
2747 /*if (!META_WINDOW_ALLOWS_RESIZE (window))*/
2748 if (!meta_window_can_tile_maximized (window) || window->shaded)
2749 return FALSE(0);
2750
2751 monitor = meta_screen_get_current_xinerama (window->screen);
2752 meta_window_get_work_area_for_xinerama (window, monitor->number, &tile_area);
2753
2754 tile_area.width /= 2;
2755
2756 if (window->frame)
2757 {
2758 MetaFrameBorders borders;
2759
2760 meta_frame_calc_borders (window->frame, &borders);
2761
2762 tile_area.width -= (borders.visible.left + borders.visible.right);
2763 tile_area.height -= (borders.visible.top + borders.visible.bottom);
2764 }
2765
2766 return tile_area.width >= window->size_hints.min_width &&
2767 tile_area.height >= window->size_hints.min_height;
2768}
2769
2770void
2771meta_window_unmaximize (MetaWindow *window,
2772 MetaMaximizeFlags directions)
2773{
2774 /* At least one of the two directions ought to be set */
2775 gboolean unmaximize_horizontally, unmaximize_vertically;
2776
2777 unmaximize_horizontally = directions & META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL;
2778 unmaximize_vertically = directions & META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL;
2779 g_assert (unmaximize_horizontally || unmaximize_vertically)do { if (unmaximize_horizontally || unmaximize_vertically) ; else
g_assertion_message_expr ("marco", "core/window.c", 2779, ((
const char*) (__func__)), "unmaximize_horizontally || unmaximize_vertically"
); } while (0);
2780
2781 if (unmaximize_horizontally && unmaximize_vertically)
2782 window->saved_maximize = FALSE(0);
2783
2784 window->tile_mode = META_TILE_NONE;
2785 window->tiled = FALSE(0);
2786
2787 /* Only do something if the window is already maximized in the
2788 * given direction(s).
2789 */
2790 if ((unmaximize_horizontally && window->maximized_horizontally) ||
2791 (unmaximize_vertically && window->maximized_vertically))
2792 {
2793 MetaRectangle target_rect;
2794
2795 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
2796 "Unmaximizing %s%s\n",
2797 window->desc,
2798 unmaximize_horizontally && unmaximize_vertically ? "" :
2799 unmaximize_horizontally ? " horizontally" :
2800 unmaximize_vertically ? " vertically" : "BUGGGGG");
2801
2802 window->maximized_horizontally =
2803 window->maximized_horizontally && !unmaximize_horizontally;
2804 window->maximized_vertically =
2805 window->maximized_vertically && !unmaximize_vertically;
2806
2807 /* Unmaximize to the saved_rect position in the direction(s)
2808 * being unmaximized.
2809 */
2810 meta_window_get_client_root_coords (window, &target_rect);
2811 if (unmaximize_horizontally)
2812 {
2813 target_rect.x = window->saved_rect.x;
2814 target_rect.width = window->saved_rect.width;
2815 }
2816 if (unmaximize_vertically)
2817 {
2818 target_rect.y = window->saved_rect.y;
2819 target_rect.height = window->saved_rect.height;
2820 }
2821
2822 /* Window's size hints may have changed while maximized, making
2823 * saved_rect invalid. #329152
2824 */
2825 ensure_size_hints_satisfied (&target_rect, &window->size_hints);
2826
2827 meta_window_move_resize (window,
2828 FALSE(0),
2829 target_rect.x,
2830 target_rect.y,
2831 target_rect.width,
2832 target_rect.height);
2833
2834 /* Make sure user_rect is current.
2835 */
2836 force_save_user_window_placement (window);
2837
2838 /* When we unmaximize, if we're doing a mouse move also we could
2839 * get the window suddenly jumping to the upper left corner of
2840 * the workspace, since that's where it was when the grab op
2841 * started. So we need to update the grab state. We have to do
2842 * it after the actual operation, as the window may have been moved
2843 * by constraints.
2844 */
2845 if (meta_grab_op_is_moving (window->display->grab_op) &&
2846 window->display->grab_window == window)
2847 {
2848 window->display->grab_anchor_window_pos = window->user_rect;
2849 }
2850
2851 if (window->display->grab_wireframe_active)
2852 {
2853 window->display->grab_wireframe_rect = target_rect;
2854 }
2855
2856 recalc_window_features (window);
2857 set_allowed_actions_hint (window);
2858 set_net_wm_state (window);
2859
2860 meta_compositor_unmaximize_window (window->display->compositor, window);
2861 }
2862}
2863
2864void
2865meta_window_move_to_monitor(MetaWindow *window,
2866 const MetaXineramaScreenInfo *from_monitor,
2867 const MetaXineramaScreenInfo *to_monitor)
2868{
2869 MetaRectangle target_rect;
2870
2871 if(META_WINDOW_TILED (window)(((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)) || ((window)->
tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT || (window
)->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT || (window)->tile_mode
== META_TILE_TOP_LEFT))))
2872 {
2873 window->tile_monitor_number = to_monitor->number;
2874
2875 /* Transform user_rect and saved_rect to the other monitor */
2876 meta_window_transform_to_monitor(&window->saved_rect,
2877 &from_monitor->rect,
2878 &to_monitor->rect);
2879 meta_window_transform_to_monitor(&window->user_rect,
2880 &from_monitor->rect,
2881 &to_monitor->rect);
2882
2883 meta_window_tile(window);
2884 return;
2885 }
2886
2887 /* Normally, just transform the window itself */
2888 meta_window_get_client_root_coords(window, &target_rect);
2889
2890 meta_window_transform_to_monitor(&target_rect,
2891 &from_monitor->rect,
2892 &to_monitor->rect);
2893
2894 meta_window_move_resize(window, TRUE(!(0)),
2895 target_rect.x,
2896 target_rect.y,
2897 target_rect.width,
2898 target_rect.height);
2899}
2900
2901static void meta_window_transform_to_monitor(MetaRectangle *target_rect,
2902 const MetaRectangle *from_monitor,
2903 const MetaRectangle *to_monitor)
2904{
2905 double horizontal_ratio;
2906 double vertical_ratio;
2907
2908 horizontal_ratio = (double)to_monitor->width / from_monitor->width;
2909 vertical_ratio = (double)to_monitor->height / from_monitor->height;
2910
2911 target_rect->x -= from_monitor->x;
2912 target_rect->y -= from_monitor->y;
2913
2914 target_rect->width = (int) (horizontal_ratio * (double) target_rect->width);
2915 target_rect->height = (int) (vertical_ratio * (double) target_rect->height);
2916 target_rect->x = (int) (horizontal_ratio * (double) target_rect->x);
2917 target_rect->y = (int) (vertical_ratio * (double) target_rect->y);
2918
2919 target_rect->x += to_monitor->x;
2920 target_rect->y += to_monitor->y;
2921
2922}
2923
2924void
2925meta_window_make_above (MetaWindow *window)
2926{
2927 window->wm_state_above = TRUE(!(0));
2928 meta_window_update_layer (window);
2929 meta_window_raise (window);
2930 set_net_wm_state (window);
2931}
2932
2933void
2934meta_window_unmake_above (MetaWindow *window)
2935{
2936 window->wm_state_above = FALSE(0);
2937 meta_window_raise (window);
2938 meta_window_update_layer (window);
2939 set_net_wm_state (window);
2940}
2941
2942void
2943meta_window_make_fullscreen_internal (MetaWindow *window)
2944{
2945 if (!window->fullscreen)
2946 {
2947 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
2948 "Fullscreening %s\n", window->desc);
2949
2950 if (window->shaded)
2951 {
2952 /* Shading sucks anyway; I'm not adding a timestamp argument
2953 * to this function just for this niche usage & corner case.
2954 */
2955 guint32 timestamp =
2956 meta_display_get_current_time_roundtrip (window->display);
2957 meta_window_unshade (window, timestamp);
2958 }
2959
2960 meta_window_save_rect (window);
2961
2962 window->fullscreen = TRUE(!(0));
2963 window->tile_resized = FALSE(0);
2964 window->force_save_user_rect = FALSE(0);
2965
2966 meta_stack_freeze (window->screen->stack);
2967 meta_window_update_layer (window);
2968
2969 meta_window_raise (window);
2970 meta_stack_thaw (window->screen->stack);
2971
2972 recalc_window_features (window);
2973 set_allowed_actions_hint (window);
2974 set_net_wm_state (window);
2975 }
2976}
2977
2978void
2979meta_window_make_fullscreen (MetaWindow *window)
2980{
2981 if (!window->fullscreen)
2982 {
2983 meta_window_make_fullscreen_internal (window);
2984 /* move_resize with new constraints
2985 */
2986 meta_window_queue(window, META_QUEUE_MOVE_RESIZE);
2987 }
2988}
2989
2990void
2991meta_window_unmake_fullscreen (MetaWindow *window)
2992{
2993 if (window->fullscreen)
2994 {
2995 MetaRectangle target_rect;
2996
2997 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
2998 "Unfullscreening %s\n", window->desc);
2999
3000 window->fullscreen = FALSE(0);
3001
3002 if(!META_WINDOW_TILED (window)(((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)) || ((window)->
tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT || (window
)->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT || (window)->tile_mode
== META_TILE_TOP_LEFT))))
3003 target_rect = window->saved_rect;
3004 else
3005 meta_window_get_current_tile_area(window, &target_rect);
3006
3007 /* Window's size hints may have changed while maximized, making
3008 * saved_rect invalid. #329152
3009 */
3010 ensure_size_hints_satisfied (&target_rect, &window->size_hints);
3011
3012 /* Need to update window->has_resize_func before we move_resize()
3013 */
3014 recalc_window_features (window);
3015 set_net_wm_state (window);
3016
3017 meta_window_move_resize (window,
3018 FALSE(0),
3019 target_rect.x,
3020 target_rect.y,
3021 target_rect.width,
3022 target_rect.height);
3023
3024 /* Make sure user_rect is current.
3025 */
3026 force_save_user_window_placement (window);
3027
3028 meta_window_update_layer (window);
3029 }
3030}
3031
3032void
3033meta_window_update_fullscreen_monitors (MetaWindow *window,
3034 unsigned long top,
3035 unsigned long bottom,
3036 unsigned long left,
3037 unsigned long right)
3038{
3039 if ((int)top < window->screen->n_xinerama_infos &&
3040 (int)bottom < window->screen->n_xinerama_infos &&
3041 (int)left < window->screen->n_xinerama_infos &&
3042 (int)right < window->screen->n_xinerama_infos)
3043 {
3044 window->fullscreen_monitors[0] = top;
3045 window->fullscreen_monitors[1] = bottom;
3046 window->fullscreen_monitors[2] = left;
3047 window->fullscreen_monitors[3] = right;
3048 }
3049 else
3050 {
3051 window->fullscreen_monitors[0] = -1;
3052 }
3053
3054 if (window->fullscreen)
3055 {
3056 meta_window_queue(window, META_QUEUE_MOVE_RESIZE);
3057 }
3058}
3059
3060void
3061meta_window_shade (MetaWindow *window,
3062 guint32 timestamp)
3063{
3064 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
3065 "Shading %s\n", window->desc);
3066 if (!window->shaded)
3067 {
3068 window->shaded = TRUE(!(0));
3069
3070 meta_window_queue(window, META_QUEUE_MOVE_RESIZE | META_QUEUE_CALC_SHOWING);
3071
3072 set_allowed_actions_hint (window);
3073
3074 /* After queuing the calc showing, since _focus flushes it,
3075 * and we need to focus the frame
3076 */
3077 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
3078 "Re-focusing window %s after shading it\n",
3079 window->desc);
3080 meta_window_focus (window, timestamp);
3081
3082 set_net_wm_state (window);
3083 }
3084}
3085
3086void
3087meta_window_unshade (MetaWindow *window,
3088 guint32 timestamp)
3089{
3090 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
3091 "Unshading %s\n", window->desc);
3092 if (window->shaded)
3093 {
3094 window->shaded = FALSE(0);
3095 meta_window_queue(window, META_QUEUE_MOVE_RESIZE | META_QUEUE_CALC_SHOWING);
3096
3097 set_allowed_actions_hint (window);
3098
3099 /* focus the window */
3100 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
3101 "Focusing window %s after unshading it\n",
3102 window->desc);
3103 meta_window_focus (window, timestamp);
3104
3105 set_net_wm_state (window);
3106 }
3107}
3108
3109static gboolean
3110unminimize_func (MetaWindow *window,
3111 void *data)
3112{
3113 meta_window_unminimize (window);
3114 return TRUE(!(0));
3115}
3116
3117static void
3118unminimize_window_and_all_transient_parents (MetaWindow *window)
3119{
3120 meta_window_unminimize (window);
3121 meta_window_foreach_ancestor (window, unminimize_func, NULL((void*)0));
3122}
3123
3124static void
3125window_activate (MetaWindow *window,
3126 guint32 timestamp,
3127 MetaClientType source_indication,
3128 MetaWorkspace *workspace)
3129{
3130 gboolean can_ignore_outdated_timestamps;
3131 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
3132 "_NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW message sent for %s at time %u "
3133 "by client type %u.\n",
3134 window->desc, timestamp, source_indication);
3135
3136 /* Older EWMH spec didn't specify a timestamp; we decide to honor these only
3137 * if the app specifies that it is a pager.
3138 *
3139 * Update: Unconditionally honor 0 timestamps for now; we'll fight
3140 * that battle later. Just remove the "FALSE &&" in order to only
3141 * honor 0 timestamps for pagers.
3142 */
3143 can_ignore_outdated_timestamps =
3144 (timestamp != 0 || (FALSE(0) && source_indication != META_CLIENT_TYPE_PAGER));
3145 if (XSERVER_TIME_IS_BEFORE (timestamp, window->display->last_user_time)( (timestamp) == 0 || (( (( (timestamp) < (window->display
->last_user_time) ) && ( (window->display->last_user_time
) - (timestamp) < ((guint32)-1)/2 )) || (( (timestamp) >
(window->display->last_user_time) ) && ( (timestamp
) - (window->display->last_user_time) > ((guint32)-1
)/2 )) ) && (window->display->last_user_time) !=
0) ) &&
3146 can_ignore_outdated_timestamps)
3147 {
3148 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
3149 "last_user_time (%u) is more recent; ignoring "
3150 " _NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW message.\n",
3151 window->display->last_user_time);
3152 meta_window_set_demands_attention(window);
3153 return;
3154 }
3155
3156 /* For those stupid pagers, get a valid timestamp and show a warning */
3157 if (timestamp == 0)
3158 {
3159 meta_warning ("meta_window_activate called by a pager with a 0 timestamp; "
3160 "the pager needs to be fixed.\n");
3161 timestamp = meta_display_get_current_time_roundtrip (window->display);
3162 }
3163
3164 meta_window_set_user_time (window, timestamp);
3165
3166 /* disable show desktop mode unless we're a desktop component */
3167 maybe_leave_show_desktop_mode (window);
3168
3169 /* Get window on current or given workspace */
3170 if (workspace == NULL((void*)0))
3171 workspace = window->screen->active_workspace;
3172
3173 /* For non-transient windows, we just set up a pulsing indicator,
3174 rather than move windows or workspaces.
3175 See http://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=482354 */
3176 if (window->xtransient_for == None0L &&
3177 !meta_window_located_on_workspace (window, workspace))
3178 {
3179 meta_window_set_demands_attention (window);
3180 /* We've marked it as demanding, don't need to do anything else. */
3181 return;
3182 }
3183 else if (window->xtransient_for != None0L)
3184 {
3185 /* Move transients to current workspace - preference dialogs should appear over
3186 the source window. */
3187 meta_window_change_workspace (window, workspace);
3188 }
3189
3190 if (window->shaded)
3191 meta_window_unshade (window, timestamp);
3192
3193 unminimize_window_and_all_transient_parents (window);
3194
3195 if (meta_prefs_get_raise_on_click () ||
3196 source_indication == META_CLIENT_TYPE_PAGER)
3197 meta_window_raise (window);
3198
3199 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
3200 "Focusing window %s due to activation\n",
3201 window->desc);
3202 meta_window_focus (window, timestamp);
3203}
3204
3205/* This function exists since most of the functionality in window_activate
3206 * is useful for Marco, but Marco shouldn't need to specify a client
3207 * type for itself. ;-)
3208 */
3209void
3210meta_window_activate (MetaWindow *window,
3211 guint32 timestamp)
3212{
3213 /* We're not really a pager, but the behavior we want is the same as if
3214 * we were such. If we change the pager behavior later, we could revisit
3215 * this and just add extra flags to window_activate.
3216 */
3217 window_activate (window, timestamp, META_CLIENT_TYPE_PAGER, NULL((void*)0));
3218}
3219
3220void
3221meta_window_activate_with_workspace (MetaWindow *window,
3222 guint32 timestamp,
3223 MetaWorkspace *workspace)
3224{
3225 /* We're not really a pager, but the behavior we want is the same as if
3226 * we were such. If we change the pager behavior later, we could revisit
3227 * this and just add extra flags to window_activate.
3228 */
3229 window_activate (window, timestamp, META_CLIENT_TYPE_APPLICATION, workspace);
3230}
3231
3232/* Manually fix all the weirdness explained in the big comment at the
3233 * beginning of meta_window_move_resize_internal() giving positions
3234 * expected by meta_window_constrain (i.e. positions & sizes of the
3235 * internal or client window).
3236 */
3237static void
3238adjust_for_gravity (MetaWindow *window,
3239 MetaFrameBorders *borders,
3240 gboolean coords_assume_border,
3241 int gravity,
3242 MetaRectangle *rect)
3243{
3244 int ref_x, ref_y;
3245 int bw;
3246 int child_x, child_y;
3247 int frame_width, frame_height;
3248
3249 if (coords_assume_border)
3250 bw = window->border_width;
3251 else
3252 bw = 0;
3253
3254 if (borders)
3255 {
3256 child_x = borders->visible.left;
3257 child_y = borders->visible.top;
3258 frame_width = child_x + rect->width + borders->visible.right;
3259 frame_height = child_y + rect->height + borders->visible.bottom;
3260 }
3261 else
3262 {
3263 child_x = 0;
3264 child_y = 0;
3265 frame_width = rect->width;
3266 frame_height = rect->height;
3267 }
3268
3269 /* We're computing position to pass to window_move, which is
3270 * the position of the client window (StaticGravity basically)
3271 *
3272 * (see WM spec description of gravity computation, but note that
3273 * their formulas assume we're honoring the border width, rather
3274 * than compensating for having turned it off)
3275 */
3276 switch (gravity)
3277 {
3278 case NorthWestGravity1:
3279 ref_x = rect->x;
3280 ref_y = rect->y;
3281 break;
3282 case NorthGravity2:
3283 ref_x = rect->x + rect->width / 2 + bw;
3284 ref_y = rect->y;
3285 break;
3286 case NorthEastGravity3:
3287 ref_x = rect->x + rect->width + bw * 2;
3288 ref_y = rect->y;
3289 break;
3290 case WestGravity4:
3291 ref_x = rect->x;
3292 ref_y = rect->y + rect->height / 2 + bw;
3293 break;
3294 case CenterGravity5:
3295 ref_x = rect->x + rect->width / 2 + bw;
3296 ref_y = rect->y + rect->height / 2 + bw;
3297 break;
3298 case EastGravity6:
3299 ref_x = rect->x + rect->width + bw * 2;
3300 ref_y = rect->y + rect->height / 2 + bw;
3301 break;
3302 case SouthWestGravity7:
3303 ref_x = rect->x;
3304 ref_y = rect->y + rect->height + bw * 2;
3305 break;
3306 case SouthGravity8:
3307 ref_x = rect->x + rect->width / 2 + bw;
3308 ref_y = rect->y + rect->height + bw * 2;
3309 break;
3310 case SouthEastGravity9:
3311 ref_x = rect->x + rect->width + bw * 2;
3312 ref_y = rect->y + rect->height + bw * 2;
3313 break;
3314 case StaticGravity10:
3315 default:
3316 ref_x = rect->x;
3317 ref_y = rect->y;
3318 break;
3319 }
3320
3321 switch (gravity)
3322 {
3323 case NorthWestGravity1:
3324 rect->x = ref_x + child_x;
3325 rect->y = ref_y + child_y;
3326 break;
3327 case NorthGravity2:
3328 rect->x = ref_x - frame_width / 2 + child_x;
3329 rect->y = ref_y + child_y;
3330 break;
3331 case NorthEastGravity3:
3332 rect->x = ref_x - frame_width + child_x;
3333 rect->y = ref_y + child_y;
3334 break;
3335 case WestGravity4:
3336 rect->x = ref_x + child_x;
3337 rect->y = ref_y - frame_height / 2 + child_y;
3338 break;
3339 case CenterGravity5:
3340 rect->x = ref_x - frame_width / 2 + child_x;
3341 rect->y = ref_y - frame_height / 2 + child_y;
3342 break;
3343 case EastGravity6:
3344 rect->x = ref_x - frame_width + child_x;
3345 rect->y = ref_y - frame_height / 2 + child_y;
3346 break;
3347 case SouthWestGravity7:
3348 rect->x = ref_x + child_x;
3349 rect->y = ref_y - frame_height + child_y;
3350 break;
3351 case SouthGravity8:
3352 rect->x = ref_x - frame_width / 2 + child_x;
3353 rect->y = ref_y - frame_height + child_y;
3354 break;
3355 case SouthEastGravity9:
3356 rect->x = ref_x - frame_width + child_x;
3357 rect->y = ref_y - frame_height + child_y;
3358 break;
3359 case StaticGravity10:
3360 default:
3361 rect->x = ref_x;
3362 rect->y = ref_y;
3363 break;
3364 }
3365}
3366
3367static gboolean
3368static_gravity_works (MetaDisplay *display)
3369{
3370 return display->static_gravity_works;
3371}
3372
3373#ifdef HAVE_XSYNC
3374static void
3375send_sync_request (MetaWindow *window)
3376{
3377 XSyncValue value;
3378 XClientMessageEvent ev;
3379
3380 window->sync_request_serial++;
3381
3382 XSyncIntToValue (&value, window->sync_request_serial);
3383
3384 ev.type = ClientMessage33;
3385 ev.window = window->xwindow;
3386 ev.message_type = window->display->atom_WM_PROTOCOLS;
3387 ev.format = 32;
3388 ev.data.l[0] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_SYNC_REQUEST;
3389 /* FIXME: meta_display_get_current_time() is bad, but since calls
3390 * come from meta_window_move_resize_internal (which in turn come
3391 * from all over), I'm not sure what we can do to fix it. Do we
3392 * want to use _roundtrip, though?
3393 */
3394 ev.data.l[1] = meta_display_get_current_time (window->display);
3395 ev.data.l[2] = XSyncValueLow32 (value);
3396 ev.data.l[3] = XSyncValueHigh32 (value);
3397 ev.data.l[4] = 0;
3398
3399 /* We don't need to trap errors here as we are already
3400 * inside an error_trap_push()/pop() pair.
3401 */
3402 XSendEvent (window->display->xdisplay,
3403 window->xwindow, False0, 0, (XEvent*) &ev);
3404
3405 window->sync_request_time = g_get_real_time ();
3406}
3407#endif
3408
3409static gboolean
3410move_attached_dialog (MetaWindow *window,
3411 void *data)
3412{
3413 MetaWindow *parent = meta_window_get_transient_for (window);
3414
3415 if (window->type == META_WINDOW_MODAL_DIALOG && parent && parent != window)
3416 /* It ignores x,y for such a dialog */
3417 meta_window_move (window, FALSE(0), 0, 0);
3418
3419 return FALSE(0);
3420}
3421
3422static void
3423meta_window_move_resize_internal (MetaWindow *window,
3424 MetaMoveResizeFlags flags,
3425 int gravity,
3426 int root_x_nw,
3427 int root_y_nw,
3428 int w,
3429 int h)
3430{
3431 /* meta_window_move_resize_internal gets called with very different
3432 * meanings for root_x_nw and root_y_nw. w & h are always the area
3433 * of the inner or client window (i.e. excluding the frame) and
3434 * gravity is the relevant gravity associated with the request (note
3435 * that gravity is ignored for move-only operations unless its
3436 * e.g. a configure request). The location is different for
3437 * different cases because of how this function gets called; note
3438 * that in all cases what we want to find out is the upper left
3439 * corner of the position of the inner window:
3440 *
3441 * Case | Called from (flags; gravity)
3442 * -----+-----------------------------------------------
3443 * 1 | A resize only ConfigureRequest
3444 * 1 | meta_window_resize
3445 * 1 | meta_window_resize_with_gravity
3446 * 2 | New window
3447 * 2 | Session restore
3448 * 2 | A not-resize-only ConfigureRequest/net_moveresize_window request
3449 * 3 | meta_window_move
3450 * 3 | meta_window_move_resize
3451 *
3452 * For each of the cases, root_x_nw and root_y_nw must be treated as follows:
3453 *
3454 * (1) They should be entirely ignored; instead the previous position
3455 * and size of the window should be resized according to the given
3456 * gravity in order to determine the new position of the window.
3457 * (2) Needs to be fixed up by adjust_for_gravity() as these
3458 * coordinates are relative to some corner or side of the outer
3459 * window (except for the case of StaticGravity) and we want to
3460 * know the location of the upper left corner of the inner window.
3461 * (3) These values are already the desired positon of the NW corner
3462 * of the inner window
3463 */
3464 XWindowChanges values;
3465 unsigned int mask;
3466 gboolean need_configure_notify;
3467 MetaFrameBorders borders;
3468 gboolean need_move_client = FALSE(0);
3469 gboolean need_move_frame = FALSE(0);
3470 gboolean need_resize_client = FALSE(0);
3471 gboolean need_resize_frame = FALSE(0);
3472 int size_dx;
3473 int size_dy;
3474 gboolean frame_shape_changed = FALSE(0);
3475 gboolean is_configure_request;
3476 gboolean do_gravity_adjust;
3477 gboolean is_user_action;
3478 gboolean configure_frame_first;
3479 gboolean use_static_gravity;
3480 gboolean have_window_frame;
3481 /* used for the configure request, but may not be final
3482 * destination due to StaticGravity etc.
3483 */
3484 int client_move_x;
3485 int client_move_y;
3486 MetaRectangle new_rect;
3487 MetaRectangle old_rect;
3488
3489 if (window->frame)
3490 have_window_frame = TRUE(!(0));
3491 else
3492 have_window_frame = FALSE(0);
3493
3494 is_configure_request = (flags & META_IS_CONFIGURE_REQUEST) != 0;
3495 do_gravity_adjust = (flags & META_DO_GRAVITY_ADJUST) != 0;
3496 is_user_action = (flags & META_IS_USER_ACTION) != 0;
3497
3498 /* The action has to be a move or a resize or both... */
3499 g_assert (flags & (META_IS_MOVE_ACTION | META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION))do { if (flags & (META_IS_MOVE_ACTION | META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION
)) ; else g_assertion_message_expr ("marco", "core/window.c",
3499, ((const char*) (__func__)), "flags & (META_IS_MOVE_ACTION | META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION)"
); } while (0);
3500
3501 /* We don't need it in the idle queue anymore. */
3502 meta_window_unqueue (window, META_QUEUE_MOVE_RESIZE);
3503
3504 meta_window_get_client_root_coords (window, &old_rect);
3505
3506 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY,
3507 "Move/resize %s to %d,%d %dx%d%s%s from %d,%d %dx%d\n",
3508 window->desc, root_x_nw, root_y_nw, w, h,
3509 is_configure_request ? " (configure request)" : "",
3510 is_user_action ? " (user move/resize)" : "",
3511 old_rect.x, old_rect.y, old_rect.width, old_rect.height);
3512
3513 if (have_window_frame)
3514 meta_frame_calc_borders (window->frame, &borders);
3515
3516 new_rect.x = root_x_nw;
3517 new_rect.y = root_y_nw;
3518 new_rect.width = w;
3519 new_rect.height = h;
3520
3521 /* If this is a resize only, the position should be ignored and
3522 * instead obtained by resizing the old rectangle according to the
3523 * relevant gravity.
3524 */
3525 if ((flags & (META_IS_MOVE_ACTION | META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION)) ==
3526 META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION)
3527 {
3528 meta_rectangle_resize_with_gravity (&old_rect,
3529 &new_rect,
3530 gravity,
3531 new_rect.width,
3532 new_rect.height);
3533
3534 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY,
3535 "Compensated for gravity in resize action; new pos %d,%d\n",
3536 new_rect.x, new_rect.y);
3537 }
3538 else if (is_configure_request || do_gravity_adjust)
3539 {
3540 adjust_for_gravity (window,
3541 have_window_frame ? &borders : NULL((void*)0),
3542 /* configure request coords assume
3543 * the border width existed
3544 */
3545 is_configure_request,
3546 gravity,
3547 &new_rect);
3548
3549 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY,
3550 "Compensated for configure_request/do_gravity_adjust needing "
3551 "weird positioning; new pos %d,%d\n",
3552 new_rect.x, new_rect.y);
3553 }
3554
3555 meta_window_constrain (window,
3556 have_window_frame ? &borders : NULL((void*)0),
3557 flags,
3558 gravity,
3559 &old_rect,
3560 &new_rect);
3561
3562 w = new_rect.width;
3563 h = new_rect.height;
3564 root_x_nw = new_rect.x;
3565 root_y_nw = new_rect.y;
3566
3567 if (w != window->rect.width ||
3568 h != window->rect.height)
3569 need_resize_client = TRUE(!(0));
3570
3571 window->rect.width = w;
3572 window->rect.height = h;
3573
3574 if (have_window_frame)
3575 {
3576 int frame_size_dx, frame_size_dy, new_w, new_h;
3577
3578 new_w = window->rect.width + borders.total.left + borders.total.right;
3579
3580 if (window->shaded)
3581 new_h = borders.total.top;
3582 else
3583 new_h = window->rect.height + borders.total.top + borders.total.bottom;
3584
3585 frame_size_dx = new_w - window->frame->rect.width;
3586 frame_size_dy = new_h - window->frame->rect.height;
3587
3588 need_resize_frame = (frame_size_dx != 0 || frame_size_dy != 0);
3589
3590 window->frame->rect.width = new_w;
3591 window->frame->rect.height = new_h;
3592
3593 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY,
3594 "Calculated frame size %dx%d\n",
3595 window->frame->rect.width,
3596 window->frame->rect.height);
3597 }
3598
3599 /* For nice effect, when growing the window we want to move/resize
3600 * the frame first, when shrinking the window we want to move/resize
3601 * the client first. If we grow one way and shrink the other,
3602 * see which way we're moving "more"
3603 *
3604 * Mail from Owen subject "Suggestion: Gravity and resizing from the left"
3605 * http://mail.gnome.org/archives/wm-spec-list/1999-November/msg00088.html
3606 *
3607 * An annoying fact you need to know in this code is that StaticGravity
3608 * does nothing if you _only_ resize or _only_ move the frame;
3609 * it must move _and_ resize, otherwise you get NorthWestGravity
3610 * behavior. The move and resize must actually occur, it is not
3611 * enough to set CWX | CWWidth but pass in the current size/pos.
3612 */
3613
3614 if (have_window_frame)
3615 {
3616 int new_x, new_y;
3617 int frame_pos_dx, frame_pos_dy;
3618
3619 /* Compute new frame coords */
3620 new_x = root_x_nw - borders.total.left;
3621 new_y = root_y_nw - borders.total.top;
3622
3623 frame_pos_dx = new_x - window->frame->rect.x;
3624 frame_pos_dy = new_y - window->frame->rect.y;
3625
3626 need_move_frame = (frame_pos_dx != 0 || frame_pos_dy != 0);
3627
3628 window->frame->rect.x = new_x;
3629 window->frame->rect.y = new_y;
3630
3631 /* If frame will both move and resize, then StaticGravity
3632 * on the child window will kick in and implicitly move
3633 * the child with respect to the frame. The implicit
3634 * move will keep the child in the same place with
3635 * respect to the root window. If frame only moves
3636 * or only resizes, then the child will just move along
3637 * with the frame.
3638 */
3639
3640 /* window->rect.x, window->rect.y are relative to frame,
3641 * remember they are the server coords
3642 */
3643
3644 new_x = borders.total.left;
3645 new_y = borders.total.top;
3646
3647 if (need_resize_frame && need_move_frame &&
3648 static_gravity_works (window->display))
3649 {
3650 /* static gravity kicks in because frame
3651 * is both moved and resized
3652 */
3653 /* when we move the frame by frame_pos_dx, frame_pos_dy the
3654 * client will implicitly move relative to frame by the
3655 * inverse delta.
3656 *
3657 * When moving client then frame, we move the client by the
3658 * frame delta, to be canceled out by the implicit move by
3659 * the inverse frame delta, resulting in a client at new_x,
3660 * new_y.
3661 *
3662 * When moving frame then client, we move the client
3663 * by the same delta as the frame, because the client
3664 * was "left behind" by the frame - resulting in a client
3665 * at new_x, new_y.
3666 *
3667 * In both cases we need to move the client window
3668 * in all cases where we had to move the frame window.
3669 */
3670
3671 client_move_x = new_x + frame_pos_dx;
3672 client_move_y = new_y + frame_pos_dy;
3673
3674 if (need_move_frame)
3675 need_move_client = TRUE(!(0));
3676
3677 use_static_gravity = TRUE(!(0));
3678 }
3679 else
3680 {
3681 client_move_x = new_x;
3682 client_move_y = new_y;
3683
3684 if (client_move_x != window->rect.x ||
3685 client_move_y != window->rect.y)
3686 need_move_client = TRUE(!(0));
3687
3688 use_static_gravity = FALSE(0);
3689 }
3690
3691 /* This is the final target position, but not necessarily what
3692 * we pass to XConfigureWindow, due to StaticGravity implicit
3693 * movement.
3694 */
3695 window->rect.x = new_x;
3696 window->rect.y = new_y;
3697 }
3698 else
3699 {
3700 if (root_x_nw != window->rect.x ||
3701 root_y_nw != window->rect.y)
3702 need_move_client = TRUE(!(0));
3703
3704 window->rect.x = root_x_nw;
3705 window->rect.y = root_y_nw;
3706
3707 client_move_x = window->rect.x;
3708 client_move_y = window->rect.y;
3709
3710 use_static_gravity = FALSE(0);
3711 }
3712
3713 /* If frame extents have changed, fill in other frame fields and
3714 change frame's extents property. */
3715 if (have_window_frame &&
3716 (window->frame->child_x != borders.total.left ||
3717 window->frame->child_y != borders.total.top ||
3718 window->frame->right_width != borders.total.right ||
3719 window->frame->bottom_height != borders.total.bottom))
3720 {
3721 window->frame->child_x = borders.total.left;
3722 window->frame->child_y = borders.total.top;
3723 window->frame->right_width = borders.total.right;
3724 window->frame->bottom_height = borders.total.bottom;
3725
3726 update_net_frame_extents (window);
3727 }
3728
3729 /* See ICCCM 4.1.5 for when to send ConfigureNotify */
3730
3731 need_configure_notify = FALSE(0);
3732
3733 /* If this is a configure request and we change nothing, then we
3734 * must send configure notify.
3735 */
3736 if (is_configure_request &&
3737 !(need_move_client || need_move_frame ||
3738 need_resize_client || need_resize_frame ||
3739 window->border_width != 0))
3740 need_configure_notify = TRUE(!(0));
3741
3742 /* We must send configure notify if we move but don't resize, since
3743 * the client window may not get a real event
3744 */
3745 if ((need_move_client || need_move_frame) &&
3746 !(need_resize_client || need_resize_frame))
3747 need_configure_notify = TRUE(!(0));
3748
3749 /* MapRequest events with a PPosition or UPosition hint with a frame
3750 * are moved by marco without resizing; send a configure notify
3751 * in such cases. See #322840. (Note that window->constructing is
3752 * only true iff this call is due to a MapRequest, and when
3753 * PPosition/UPosition hints aren't set, marco seems to send a
3754 * ConfigureNotify anyway due to the above code.)
3755 */
3756 if (window->constructing && have_window_frame &&
3757 ((window->size_hints.flags & PPosition(1L << 2)) ||
3758 (window->size_hints.flags & USPosition(1L << 0))))
3759 need_configure_notify = TRUE(!(0));
3760
3761 /* The rest of this function syncs our new size/pos with X as
3762 * efficiently as possible
3763 */
3764
3765 /* configure frame first if we grow more than we shrink
3766 */
3767 size_dx = w - window->rect.width;
3768 size_dy = h - window->rect.height;
3769
3770 configure_frame_first = (size_dx + size_dy >= 0);
3771
3772 if (use_static_gravity)
3773 meta_window_set_gravity (window, StaticGravity10);
3774
3775 if (configure_frame_first && have_window_frame)
3776 frame_shape_changed = meta_frame_sync_to_window (window->frame,
3777 gravity,
3778 need_move_frame,
3779 need_resize_frame);
3780
3781 values.border_width = 0;
3782 values.x = client_move_x;
3783 values.y = client_move_y;
3784 values.width = window->rect.width;
3785 values.height = window->rect.height;
3786
3787 mask = 0;
3788 if (is_configure_request && window->border_width != 0)
3789 mask |= CWBorderWidth(1<<4); /* must force to 0 */
3790 if (need_move_client)
3791 mask |= (CWX(1<<0) | CWY(1<<1));
3792 if (need_resize_client)
3793 mask |= (CWWidth(1<<2) | CWHeight(1<<3));
3794
3795 if (mask != 0)
3796 {
3797 {
3798 int newx, newy;
3799 meta_window_get_position (window, &newx, &newy);
3800 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY,
3801 "Syncing new client geometry %d,%d %dx%d, border: %s pos: %s size: %s\n",
3802 newx, newy,
3803 window->rect.width, window->rect.height,
3804 mask & CWBorderWidth(1<<4) ? "true" : "false",
3805 need_move_client ? "true" : "false",
3806 need_resize_client ? "true" : "false");
3807 }
3808
3809 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
3810
3811#ifdef HAVE_XSYNC
3812 if (window->sync_request_counter != None0L &&
3813 window->display->grab_sync_request_alarm != None0L &&
3814 window->sync_request_time == 0)
3815 {
3816 /* turn off updating */
3817 if (window->display->compositor)
3818 meta_compositor_set_updates (window->display->compositor, window, FALSE(0));
3819
3820 send_sync_request (window);
3821 }
3822#endif
3823
3824 XConfigureWindow (window->display->xdisplay,
3825 window->xwindow,
3826 mask,
3827 &values);
3828
3829 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, FALSE(0));
3830 }
3831
3832 if (!configure_frame_first && have_window_frame)
3833 frame_shape_changed = meta_frame_sync_to_window (window->frame,
3834 gravity,
3835 need_move_frame,
3836 need_resize_frame);
3837
3838 /* Put gravity back to be nice to lesser window managers */
3839 if (use_static_gravity)
3840 meta_window_set_gravity (window, NorthWestGravity1);
3841
3842 if (need_configure_notify)
3843 send_configure_notify (window);
3844
3845 if (!window->placed && window->force_save_user_rect && !window->fullscreen)
3846 force_save_user_window_placement (window);
3847 else if (is_user_action)
3848 save_user_window_placement (window);
3849
3850 if (need_move_frame || need_resize_frame ||
3851 need_move_client || need_resize_client)
3852 {
3853 int newx, newy;
3854 meta_window_get_position (window, &newx, &newy);
3855 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY,
3856 "New size/position %d,%d %dx%d (user %d,%d %dx%d)\n",
3857 newx, newy, window->rect.width, window->rect.height,
3858 window->user_rect.x, window->user_rect.y,
3859 window->user_rect.width, window->user_rect.height);
3860 }
3861 else
3862 {
3863 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY, "Size/position not modified\n");
3864 }
3865
3866 if (window->display->grab_wireframe_active)
3867 meta_window_update_wireframe (window, root_x_nw, root_y_nw, w, h);
3868 else
3869 meta_window_refresh_resize_popup (window);
3870
3871 /* Invariants leaving this function are:
3872 * a) window->rect and frame->rect reflect the actual
3873 * server-side size/pos of window->xwindow and frame->xwindow
3874 * b) all constraints are obeyed by window->rect and frame->rect
3875 */
3876 if (frame_shape_changed && window->frame_bounds)
3877 {
3878 cairo_region_destroy (window->frame_bounds);
3879 window->frame_bounds = NULL((void*)0);
3880 }
3881
3882 if (meta_prefs_get_attach_modal_dialogs ())
3883 meta_window_foreach_transient (window, move_attached_dialog, NULL((void*)0));
3884}
3885
3886void
3887meta_window_resize (MetaWindow *window,
3888 gboolean user_op,
3889 int w,
3890 int h)
3891{
3892 int x, y;
3893 MetaMoveResizeFlags flags;
3894
3895 meta_window_get_position (window, &x, &y);
3896
3897 flags = (user_op ? META_IS_USER_ACTION : 0) | META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION;
3898 meta_window_move_resize_internal (window,
3899 flags,
3900 NorthWestGravity1,
3901 x, y, w, h);
3902}
3903
3904void
3905meta_window_move (MetaWindow *window,
3906 gboolean user_op,
3907 int root_x_nw,
3908 int root_y_nw)
3909{
3910 MetaMoveResizeFlags flags =
3911 (user_op ? META_IS_USER_ACTION : 0) | META_IS_MOVE_ACTION;
3912 meta_window_move_resize_internal (window,
3913 flags,
3914 NorthWestGravity1,
3915 root_x_nw, root_y_nw,
3916 window->rect.width,
3917 window->rect.height);
3918}
3919
3920void
3921meta_window_move_resize (MetaWindow *window,
3922 gboolean user_op,
3923 int root_x_nw,
3924 int root_y_nw,
3925 int w,
3926 int h)
3927{
3928 MetaMoveResizeFlags flags =
3929 (user_op ? META_IS_USER_ACTION : 0) |
3930 META_IS_MOVE_ACTION | META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION;
3931 meta_window_move_resize_internal (window,
3932 flags,
3933 NorthWestGravity1,
3934 root_x_nw, root_y_nw,
3935 w, h);
3936}
3937
3938void
3939meta_window_resize_with_gravity (MetaWindow *window,
3940 gboolean user_op,
3941 int w,
3942 int h,
3943 int gravity)
3944{
3945 int x, y;
3946 MetaMoveResizeFlags flags;
3947
3948 meta_window_get_position (window, &x, &y);
3949
3950 flags = (user_op ? META_IS_USER_ACTION : 0) | META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION;
3951 meta_window_move_resize_internal (window,
3952 flags,
3953 gravity,
3954 x, y, w, h);
3955}
3956
3957static void
3958meta_window_move_resize_now (MetaWindow *window)
3959{
3960 /* If constraints have changed then we want to snap back to wherever
3961 * the user had the window. We use user_rect for this reason. See
3962 * also bug 426519 comment 3.
3963 */
3964 meta_window_move_resize (window, FALSE(0),
3965 window->user_rect.x,
3966 window->user_rect.y,
3967 window->user_rect.width,
3968 window->user_rect.height);
3969}
3970
3971static gboolean
3972idle_move_resize (gpointer data)
3973{
3974 GSList *tmp;
3975 GSList *copy;
3976 guint queue_index = GPOINTER_TO_INT (data)((gint) (glong) (data));
3977
3978 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY, "Clearing the move_resize queue\n");
3979
3980 /* Work with a copy, for reentrancy. The allowed reentrancy isn't
3981 * complete; destroying a window while we're in here would result in
3982 * badness. But it's OK to queue/unqueue move_resizes.
3983 */
3984 copy = g_slist_copy (queue_pending[queue_index]);
3985 g_slist_free (queue_pending[queue_index]);
3986 queue_pending[queue_index] = NULL((void*)0);
3987 queue_idle[queue_index] = 0;
3988
3989 destroying_windows_disallowed += 1;
3990
3991 tmp = copy;
3992 while (tmp != NULL((void*)0))
3993 {
3994 MetaWindow *window;
3995
3996 window = tmp->data;
3997
3998 /* As a side effect, sets window->move_resize_queued = FALSE */
3999 meta_window_move_resize_now (window);
4000
4001 tmp = tmp->next;
4002 }
4003
4004 g_slist_free (copy);
4005
4006 destroying_windows_disallowed -= 1;
4007
4008 return FALSE(0);
4009}
4010
4011void
4012meta_window_get_position (MetaWindow *window,
4013 int *x,
4014 int *y)
4015{
4016 if (window->frame)
4017 {
4018 if (x)
4019 *x = window->frame->rect.x + window->frame->child_x;
4020 if (y)
4021 *y = window->frame->rect.y + window->frame->child_y;
4022 }
4023 else
4024 {
4025 if (x)
4026 *x = window->rect.x;
4027 if (y)
4028 *y = window->rect.y;
4029 }
4030}
4031
4032void
4033meta_window_get_client_root_coords (MetaWindow *window,
4034 MetaRectangle *rect)
4035{
4036 meta_window_get_position (window, &rect->x, &rect->y);
4037 rect->width = window->rect.width;
4038 rect->height = window->rect.height;
4039}
4040
4041void
4042meta_window_get_gravity_position (MetaWindow *window,
4043 int gravity,
4044 int *root_x,
4045 int *root_y)
4046{
4047 MetaRectangle frame_extents;
4048 int w, h;
4049 int x, y;
4050
4051 w = window->rect.width;
4052 h = window->rect.height;
4053
4054 if (gravity == StaticGravity10)
4055 {
4056 frame_extents = window->rect;
4057 if (window->frame)
4058 {
4059 frame_extents.x = window->frame->rect.x + window->frame->child_x;
4060 frame_extents.y = window->frame->rect.y + window->frame->child_y;
4061 }
4062 }
4063 else
4064 {
4065 if (window->frame == NULL((void*)0))
4066 frame_extents = window->rect;
4067 else
4068 frame_extents = window->frame->rect;
4069 }
4070
4071 x = frame_extents.x;
4072 y = frame_extents.y;
4073
4074 switch (gravity)
4075 {
4076 case NorthGravity2:
4077 case CenterGravity5:
4078 case SouthGravity8:
4079 /* Find center of frame. */
4080 x += frame_extents.width / 2;
4081 /* Center client window on that point. */
4082 x -= w / 2;
4083 break;
4084
4085 case SouthEastGravity9:
4086 case EastGravity6:
4087 case NorthEastGravity3:
4088 /* Find right edge of frame */
4089 x += frame_extents.width;
4090 /* Align left edge of client at that point. */
4091 x -= w;
4092 break;
4093 default:
4094 break;
4095 }
4096
4097 switch (gravity)
4098 {
4099 case WestGravity4:
4100 case CenterGravity5:
4101 case EastGravity6:
4102 /* Find center of frame. */
4103 y += frame_extents.height / 2;
4104 /* Center client window there. */
4105 y -= h / 2;
4106 break;
4107 case SouthWestGravity7:
4108 case SouthGravity8:
4109 case SouthEastGravity9:
4110 /* Find south edge of frame */
4111 y += frame_extents.height;
4112 /* Place bottom edge of client there */
4113 y -= h;
4114 break;
4115 default:
4116 break;
4117 }
4118
4119 if (root_x)
4120 *root_x = x;
4121 if (root_y)
4122 *root_y = y;
4123}
4124
4125void
4126meta_window_get_geometry (MetaWindow *window,
4127 int *x,
4128 int *y,
4129 int *width,
4130 int *height)
4131{
4132 meta_window_get_gravity_position (window,
4133 window->size_hints.win_gravity,
4134 x, y);
4135
4136 *width = (window->rect.width - window->size_hints.base_width) /
4137 window->size_hints.width_inc;
4138 *height = (window->rect.height - window->size_hints.base_height) /
4139 window->size_hints.height_inc;
4140}
4141
4142/**
4143 * meta_window_get_input_rect:
4144 * @window: a #MetaWindow
4145 * @rect: (out): pointer to an allocated #MetaRectangle
4146 *
4147 * Gets the rectangle that bounds @window that is responsive to mouse events.
4148 * This includes decorations - the visible portion of its border - and (if
4149 * present) any invisible area that we make make responsive to mouse clicks in
4150 * order to allow convenient border dragging.
4151 */
4152void
4153meta_window_get_input_rect (const MetaWindow *window,
4154 MetaRectangle *rect)
4155{
4156 if (window->frame)
4157 *rect = window->frame->rect;
4158 else
4159 *rect = window->rect;
4160}
4161
4162/**
4163 * meta_window_get_outer_rect:
4164 * @window: a #MetaWindow
4165 * @rect: (out): pointer to an allocated #MetaRectangle
4166 *
4167 * Gets the rectangle that bounds @window that is responsive to mouse events.
4168 * This includes only what is visible; it doesn't include any extra reactive
4169 * area we add to the edges of windows.
4170 */
4171void
4172meta_window_get_outer_rect (const MetaWindow *window,
4173 MetaRectangle *rect)
4174{
4175 if (window->frame)
4176 {
4177 MetaFrameBorders borders;
4178 *rect = window->frame->rect;
4179 meta_frame_calc_borders (window->frame, &borders);
4180
4181 rect->x += borders.invisible.left;
4182 rect->y += borders.invisible.top;
4183 rect->width -= borders.invisible.left + borders.invisible.right;
4184 rect->height -= borders.invisible.top + borders.invisible.bottom;
4185 }
4186 else
4187 {
4188 *rect = window->rect;
4189
4190 if (window->has_custom_frame_extents)
4191 {
4192 const GtkBorder *extents = &window->custom_frame_extents;
4193 rect->x += extents->left;
4194 rect->y += extents->top;
4195 rect->width -= extents->left + extents->right;
4196 rect->height -= extents->top + extents->bottom;
4197 }
4198 }
4199}
4200
4201void
4202meta_window_get_xor_rect (MetaWindow *window,
4203 const MetaRectangle *grab_wireframe_rect,
4204 MetaRectangle *xor_rect)
4205{
4206 if (window->frame)
4207 {
4208 xor_rect->x = grab_wireframe_rect->x - window->frame->child_x;
4209 xor_rect->y = grab_wireframe_rect->y - window->frame->child_y;
4210 xor_rect->width = grab_wireframe_rect->width + window->frame->child_x + window->frame->right_width;
4211
4212 if (window->shaded)
4213 xor_rect->height = window->frame->child_y;
4214 else
4215 xor_rect->height = grab_wireframe_rect->height + window->frame->child_y + window->frame->bottom_height;
4216 }
4217 else
4218 *xor_rect = *grab_wireframe_rect;
4219}
4220
4221/* Figure out the numbers that show up in the
4222 * resize popup when in reduced resources mode.
4223 */
4224static void
4225meta_window_get_wireframe_geometry (MetaWindow *window,
4226 int *width,
4227 int *height)
4228{
4229 if (!window->display->grab_wireframe_active)
4230 return;
4231
4232 if ((width == NULL((void*)0)) || (height == NULL((void*)0)))
4233 return;
4234
4235 if ((window->display->grab_window->size_hints.width_inc <= 1) ||
4236 (window->display->grab_window->size_hints.height_inc <= 1))
4237 {
4238 *width = -1;
4239 *height = -1;
4240 return;
4241 }
4242
4243 *width = window->display->grab_wireframe_rect.width -
4244 window->display->grab_window->size_hints.base_width;
4245 *width /= window->display->grab_window->size_hints.width_inc;
4246
4247 *height = window->display->grab_wireframe_rect.height -
4248 window->display->grab_window->size_hints.base_height;
4249 *height /= window->display->grab_window->size_hints.height_inc;
4250}
4251
4252/* XXX META_EFFECT_ALT_TAB, well, this and others */
4253void
4254meta_window_begin_wireframe (MetaWindow *window)
4255{
4256
4257 MetaRectangle new_xor;
4258 int display_width, display_height;
4259
4260 display_width = 0;
4261 display_height = 0;
4262
4263 meta_window_get_client_root_coords (window,
4264 &window->display->grab_wireframe_rect);
4265
4266 meta_window_get_xor_rect (window, &window->display->grab_wireframe_rect,
4267 &new_xor);
4268 meta_window_get_wireframe_geometry (window, &display_width, &display_height);
4269
4270 meta_effects_begin_wireframe (window->screen,
4271 &new_xor, display_width, display_height);
4272
4273 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_xor_rect = new_xor;
4274 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_display_width = display_width;
4275 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_display_height = display_height;
4276}
4277
4278void
4279meta_window_update_wireframe (MetaWindow *window,
4280 int x,
4281 int y,
4282 int width,
4283 int height)
4284{
4285
4286 MetaRectangle new_xor;
4287 int display_width, display_height;
4288
4289 display_width = 0;
4290 display_height = 0;
4291
4292 window->display->grab_wireframe_rect.x = x;
4293 window->display->grab_wireframe_rect.y = y;
4294 window->display->grab_wireframe_rect.width = width;
4295 window->display->grab_wireframe_rect.height = height;
4296
4297 meta_window_get_xor_rect (window, &window->display->grab_wireframe_rect,
4298 &new_xor);
4299 meta_window_get_wireframe_geometry (window, &display_width, &display_height);
4300
4301 meta_effects_update_wireframe (window->screen,
4302 &window->display->grab_wireframe_last_xor_rect,
4303 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_display_width,
4304 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_display_height,
4305 &new_xor, display_width, display_height);
4306
4307 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_xor_rect = new_xor;
4308 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_display_width = display_width;
4309 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_display_height = display_height;
4310}
4311
4312void
4313meta_window_end_wireframe (MetaWindow *window)
4314{
4315 meta_effects_end_wireframe (window->display->grab_window->screen,
4316 &window->display->grab_wireframe_last_xor_rect,
4317 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_display_width,
4318 window->display->grab_wireframe_last_display_height);
4319}
4320
4321const char*
4322meta_window_get_startup_id (MetaWindow *window)
4323{
4324 if (window->startup_id == NULL((void*)0))
4325 {
4326 MetaGroup *group;
4327
4328 group = meta_window_get_group (window);
4329
4330 if (group != NULL((void*)0))
4331 return meta_group_get_startup_id (group);
4332 }
4333
4334 return window->startup_id;
4335}
4336
4337static MetaWindow*
4338get_modal_transient (MetaWindow *window)
4339{
4340 GSList *windows;
4341 GSList *tmp;
4342 MetaWindow *modal_transient;
4343
4344 /* A window can't be the transient of itself, but this is just for
4345 * convenience in the loop below; we manually fix things up at the
4346 * end if no real modal transient was found.
4347 */
4348 modal_transient = window;
4349
4350 windows = meta_display_list_windows (window->display);
4351 tmp = windows;
4352 while (tmp != NULL((void*)0))
4353 {
4354 MetaWindow *transient = tmp->data;
4355
4356 if (transient->xtransient_for == modal_transient->xwindow &&
4357 transient->wm_state_modal)
4358 {
4359 modal_transient = transient;
4360 tmp = windows;
4361 continue;
4362 }
4363
4364 tmp = tmp->next;
4365 }
4366
4367 g_slist_free (windows);
4368
4369 if (window == modal_transient)
4370 modal_transient = NULL((void*)0);
4371
4372 return modal_transient;
4373}
4374
4375/* XXX META_EFFECT_FOCUS */
4376void
4377meta_window_focus (MetaWindow *window,
4378 guint32 timestamp)
4379{
4380 MetaWindow *modal_transient;
4381
4382 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
4383 "Setting input focus to window %s, input: %d take_focus: %d\n",
4384 window->desc, window->input, window->take_focus);
4385
4386 if (window->display->grab_window &&
4387 window->display->grab_window->all_keys_grabbed)
4388 {
4389 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
4390 "Current focus window %s has global keygrab, not focusing window %s after all\n",
4391 window->display->grab_window->desc, window->desc);
4392 return;
4393 }
4394
4395 modal_transient = get_modal_transient (window);
4396 if (modal_transient != NULL((void*)0) &&
4397 !modal_transient->unmanaging)
4398 {
4399 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
4400 "%s has %s as a modal transient, so focusing it instead.\n",
4401 window->desc, modal_transient->desc);
4402 if (!modal_transient->on_all_workspaces &&
4403 modal_transient->workspace != window->screen->active_workspace)
4404 meta_window_change_workspace (modal_transient,
4405 window->screen->active_workspace);
4406 window = modal_transient;
4407 }
4408
4409 meta_window_flush_calc_showing (window);
4410
4411 if (!window->mapped && !window->shaded)
4412 {
4413 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
4414 "Window %s is not showing, not focusing after all\n",
4415 window->desc);
4416 return;
4417 }
4418
4419 /* For output-only or shaded windows, focus the frame.
4420 * This seems to result in the client window getting key events
4421 * though, so I don't know if it's icccm-compliant.
4422 *
4423 * Still, we have to do this or keynav breaks for these windows.
4424 */
4425 if (window->frame &&
4426 (window->shaded ||
4427 !(window->input || window->take_focus)))
4428 {
4429 if (window->frame)
4430 {
4431 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
4432 "Focusing frame of %s\n", window->desc);
4433 meta_display_set_input_focus_window (window->display,
4434 window,
4435 TRUE(!(0)),
4436 timestamp);
4437 }
4438 }
4439 else
4440 {
4441 if (window->input)
4442 {
4443 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
4444 "Setting input focus on %s since input = true\n",
4445 window->desc);
4446 meta_display_set_input_focus_window (window->display,
4447 window,
4448 FALSE(0),
4449 timestamp);
4450 }
4451
4452 if (window->take_focus)
4453 {
4454 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
4455 "Sending WM_TAKE_FOCUS to %s since take_focus = true\n",
4456 window->desc);
4457 meta_window_send_icccm_message (window,
4458 window->display->atom_WM_TAKE_FOCUS,
4459 timestamp);
4460 window->display->expected_focus_window = window;
4461 }
4462 }
4463
4464 if (window->wm_state_demands_attention)
4465 meta_window_unset_demands_attention(window);
4466
4467 meta_effect_run_focus(window, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
4468}
4469
4470static void
4471meta_window_change_workspace_without_transients (MetaWindow *window,
4472 MetaWorkspace *workspace)
4473{
4474 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Changing window %s to workspace %d\n",
4475 window->desc, meta_workspace_index (workspace));
4476
4477 /* unstick if stuck. meta_window_unstick would call
4478 * meta_window_change_workspace recursively if the window
4479 * is not in the active workspace.
4480 */
4481 if (window->on_all_workspaces)
4482 meta_window_unstick (window);
4483
4484 /* See if we're already on this space. If not, make sure we are */
4485 if (window->workspace != workspace)
4486 {
4487 meta_workspace_remove_window (window->workspace, window);
4488 meta_workspace_add_window (workspace, window);
4489 }
4490}
4491
4492static gboolean
4493change_workspace_foreach (MetaWindow *window,
4494 void *data)
4495{
4496 meta_window_change_workspace_without_transients (window, data);
4497 return TRUE(!(0));
4498}
4499
4500void
4501meta_window_change_workspace (MetaWindow *window,
4502 MetaWorkspace *workspace)
4503{
4504 meta_window_change_workspace_without_transients (window, workspace);
4505
4506 meta_window_foreach_transient (window, change_workspace_foreach,
4507 workspace);
4508 meta_window_foreach_ancestor (window, change_workspace_foreach,
4509 workspace);
4510}
4511
4512static void
4513window_stick_impl (MetaWindow *window)
4514{
4515 GList *tmp;
4516 MetaWorkspace *workspace;
4517
4518 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Sticking window %s current on_all_workspaces = %d\n",
4519 window->desc, window->on_all_workspaces);
4520
4521 if (window->on_all_workspaces)
4522 return;
4523
4524 /* We don't change window->workspaces, because we revert
4525 * to that original workspace list if on_all_workspaces is
4526 * toggled back off.
4527 */
4528 window->on_all_workspaces = TRUE(!(0));
4529
4530 /* We do, however, change the MRU lists of all the workspaces
4531 */
4532 tmp = window->screen->workspaces;
4533 while (tmp)
4534 {
4535 workspace = (MetaWorkspace *) tmp->data;
4536 if (!g_list_find (workspace->mru_list, window))
4537 workspace->mru_list = g_list_prepend (workspace->mru_list, window);
4538
4539 tmp = tmp->next;
4540 }
4541
4542 meta_window_set_current_workspace_hint (window);
4543
4544 meta_window_queue(window, META_QUEUE_CALC_SHOWING);
4545}
4546
4547static void
4548window_unstick_impl (MetaWindow *window)
4549{
4550 GList *tmp;
4551 MetaWorkspace *workspace;
4552
4553 if (!window->on_all_workspaces)
4554 return;
4555
4556 /* Revert to window->workspaces */
4557
4558 window->on_all_workspaces = FALSE(0);
4559
4560 /* Remove window from MRU lists that it doesn't belong in */
4561 tmp = window->screen->workspaces;
4562 while (tmp)
4563 {
4564 workspace = (MetaWorkspace *) tmp->data;
4565 if (window->workspace != workspace)
4566 workspace->mru_list = g_list_remove (workspace->mru_list, window);
4567 tmp = tmp->next;
4568 }
4569
4570 /* We change ourselves to the active workspace, since otherwise you'd get
4571 * a weird window-vaporization effect. Once we have UI for being
4572 * on more than one workspace this should probably be add_workspace
4573 * not change_workspace.
4574 */
4575 if (window->screen->active_workspace != window->workspace)
4576 meta_window_change_workspace (window, window->screen->active_workspace);
4577
4578 meta_window_set_current_workspace_hint (window);
4579
4580 meta_window_queue(window, META_QUEUE_CALC_SHOWING);
4581}
4582
4583static gboolean
4584stick_foreach_func (MetaWindow *window,
4585 void *data)
4586{
4587 gboolean stick;
4588
4589 stick = *(gboolean*)data;
4590 if (stick)
4591 window_stick_impl (window);
4592 else
4593 window_unstick_impl (window);
4594 return TRUE(!(0));
4595}
4596
4597void
4598meta_window_stick (MetaWindow *window)
4599{
4600 gboolean stick = TRUE(!(0));
4601 window_stick_impl (window);
4602 meta_window_foreach_transient (window,
4603 stick_foreach_func,
4604 &stick);
4605}
4606
4607void
4608meta_window_unstick (MetaWindow *window)
4609{
4610 gboolean stick = FALSE(0);
4611 window_unstick_impl (window);
4612 meta_window_foreach_transient (window,
4613 stick_foreach_func,
4614 &stick);
4615}
4616
4617unsigned long
4618meta_window_get_net_wm_desktop (MetaWindow *window)
4619{
4620 if (window->on_all_workspaces)
4621 return 0xFFFFFFFF;
4622 else
4623 return meta_workspace_index (window->workspace);
4624}
4625
4626static void
4627update_net_frame_extents (MetaWindow *window)
4628{
4629 unsigned long data[4] = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
4630
4631 if (window->frame)
4632 {
4633 MetaFrameBorders borders;
4634
4635 meta_frame_calc_borders (window->frame, &borders);
4636 /* Left */
4637 data[0] = borders.visible.left;
4638 /* Right */
4639 data[1] = borders.visible.right;
4640 /* Top */
4641 data[2] = borders.visible.top;
4642 /* Bottom */
4643 data[3] = borders.visible.bottom;
4644 }
4645
4646 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY,
4647 "Setting _NET_FRAME_EXTENTS on managed window 0x%lx "
4648 "to left = %lu, right = %lu, top = %lu, bottom = %lu\n",
4649 window->xwindow, data[0], data[1], data[2], data[3]);
4650
4651 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
4652 XChangeProperty (window->display->xdisplay, window->xwindow,
4653 window->display->atom__NET_FRAME_EXTENTS,
4654 XA_CARDINAL((Atom) 6),
4655 32, PropModeReplace0, (guchar*) data, 4);
4656 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, FALSE(0));
4657}
4658
4659void
4660meta_window_set_current_workspace_hint (MetaWindow *window)
4661{
4662 /* FIXME if on more than one workspace, we claim to be "sticky",
4663 * the WM spec doesn't say what to do here.
4664 */
4665 unsigned long data[1];
4666
4667 if (window->workspace == NULL((void*)0))
4668 {
4669 /* this happens when unmanaging windows */
4670 return;
4671 }
4672
4673 data[0] = meta_window_get_net_wm_desktop (window);
4674
4675 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Setting _NET_WM_DESKTOP of %s to %lu\n",
4676 window->desc, data[0]);
4677
4678 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
4679 XChangeProperty (window->display->xdisplay, window->xwindow,
4680 window->display->atom__NET_WM_DESKTOP,
4681 XA_CARDINAL((Atom) 6),
4682 32, PropModeReplace0, (guchar*) data, 1);
4683 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, FALSE(0));
4684}
4685
4686static gboolean
4687find_root_ancestor (MetaWindow *window,
4688 void *data)
4689{
4690 MetaWindow **ancestor = data;
4691
4692 /* Overwrite the previously "most-root" ancestor with the new one found */
4693 *ancestor = window;
4694
4695 /* We want this to continue until meta_window_foreach_ancestor quits because
4696 * there are no more valid ancestors.
4697 */
4698 return TRUE(!(0));
4699}
4700
4701MetaWindow *
4702meta_window_find_root_ancestor (MetaWindow *window)
4703{
4704 MetaWindow *ancestor;
4705 ancestor = window;
4706 meta_window_foreach_ancestor (window, find_root_ancestor, &ancestor);
4707 return ancestor;
4708}
4709
4710void
4711meta_window_raise (MetaWindow *window)
4712{
4713 MetaWindow *ancestor;
4714 ancestor = meta_window_find_root_ancestor (window);
4715
4716 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
4717 "Raising window %s, ancestor of %s\n",
4718 ancestor->desc, window->desc);
4719
4720 /* Raise the ancestor of the window (if the window has no ancestor,
4721 * then ancestor will be set to the window itself); do this because
4722 * it's weird to see windows from other apps stacked between a child
4723 * and parent window of the currently active app. The stacking
4724 * constraints in stack.c then magically take care of raising all
4725 * the child windows appropriately.
4726 */
4727 if (window->screen->stack == ancestor->screen->stack)
4728 meta_stack_raise (window->screen->stack, ancestor);
4729 else
4730 {
4731 meta_warning (
4732 "Either stacks aren't per screen or some window has a weird "
4733 "transient_for hint; window->screen->stack != "
4734 "ancestor->screen->stack. window = %s, ancestor = %s.\n",
4735 window->desc, ancestor->desc);
4736 /* We could raise the window here, but don't want to do that twice and
4737 * so we let the case below handle that.
4738 */
4739 }
4740
4741 /* Okay, so stacking constraints misses one case: If a window has
4742 * two children and we want to raise one of those children, then
4743 * raising the ancestor isn't enough; we need to also raise the
4744 * correct child. See bug 307875.
4745 */
4746 if (window != ancestor)
4747 meta_stack_raise (window->screen->stack, window);
4748}
4749
4750void
4751meta_window_lower (MetaWindow *window)
4752{
4753 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
4754 "Lowering window %s\n", window->desc);
4755
4756 meta_stack_lower (window->screen->stack, window);
4757}
4758
4759void
4760meta_window_send_icccm_message (MetaWindow *window,
4761 Atom atom,
4762 guint32 timestamp)
4763{
4764 /* This comment and code are from twm, copyright
4765 * Open Group, Evans & Sutherland, etc.
4766 */
4767
4768 /*
4769 * ICCCM Client Messages - Section 4.2.8 of the ICCCM dictates that all
4770 * client messages will have the following form:
4771 *
4772 * event type ClientMessage
4773 * message type _XA_WM_PROTOCOLS
4774 * window tmp->w
4775 * format 32
4776 * data[0] message atom
4777 * data[1] time stamp
4778 */
4779
4780 XClientMessageEvent ev;
4781
4782 ev.type = ClientMessage33;
4783 ev.window = window->xwindow;
4784 ev.message_type = window->display->atom_WM_PROTOCOLS;
4785 ev.format = 32;
4786 ev.data.l[0] = atom;
4787 ev.data.l[1] = timestamp;
4788
4789 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
4790 XSendEvent (window->display->xdisplay,
4791 window->xwindow, False0, 0, (XEvent*) &ev);
4792 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, FALSE(0));
4793}
4794
4795void
4796meta_window_move_resize_request (MetaWindow *window,
4797 guint value_mask,
4798 int gravity,
4799 int new_x,
4800 int new_y,
4801 int new_width,
4802 int new_height)
4803{
4804 int x, y, width, height;
4805 gboolean allow_position_change;
4806 gboolean in_grab_op;
4807 MetaMoveResizeFlags flags;
4808
4809 /* We ignore configure requests while the user is moving/resizing
4810 * the window, since these represent the app sucking and fighting
4811 * the user, most likely due to a bug in the app (e.g. pfaedit
4812 * seemed to do this)
4813 *
4814 * Still have to do the ConfigureNotify and all, but pretend the
4815 * app asked for the current size/position instead of the new one.
4816 */
4817 in_grab_op = FALSE(0);
4818 if (window->display->grab_op != META_GRAB_OP_NONE &&
4819 window == window->display->grab_window)
4820 {
4821 switch (window->display->grab_op)
4822 {
4823 case META_GRAB_OP_MOVING:
4824 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SE:
4825 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_S:
4826 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SW:
4827 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_N:
4828 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NE:
4829 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NW:
4830 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_W:
4831 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_E:
4832 in_grab_op = TRUE(!(0));
4833 break;
4834 default:
4835 break;
4836 }
4837 }
4838
4839 /* it's essential to use only the explicitly-set fields,
4840 * and otherwise use our current up-to-date position.
4841 *
4842 * Otherwise you get spurious position changes when the app changes
4843 * size, for example, if window->rect is not in sync with the
4844 * server-side position in effect when the configure request was
4845 * generated.
4846 */
4847 meta_window_get_gravity_position (window,
4848 gravity,
4849 &x, &y);
4850
4851 allow_position_change = FALSE(0);
4852
4853 if (meta_prefs_get_disable_workarounds ())
4854 {
4855 if (window->type == META_WINDOW_DIALOG ||
4856 window->type == META_WINDOW_MODAL_DIALOG ||
4857 window->type == META_WINDOW_SPLASHSCREEN)
4858 ; /* No position change for these */
4859 else if ((window->size_hints.flags & PPosition(1L << 2)) ||
4860 /* USPosition is just stale if window is placed;
4861 * no --geometry involved here.
4862 */
4863 ((window->size_hints.flags & USPosition(1L << 0)) &&
4864 !window->placed))
4865 allow_position_change = TRUE(!(0));
4866 }
4867 else
4868 {
4869 allow_position_change = TRUE(!(0));
4870 }
4871
4872 if (in_grab_op)
4873 allow_position_change = FALSE(0);
4874
4875 if (allow_position_change)
4876 {
4877 if (value_mask & CWX(1<<0))
4878 x = new_x;
4879 if (value_mask & CWY(1<<1))
4880 y = new_y;
4881 if (value_mask & (CWX(1<<0) | CWY(1<<1)))
4882 {
4883 /* Once manually positioned, windows shouldn't be placed
4884 * by the window manager.
4885 */
4886 window->placed = TRUE(!(0));
4887 }
4888 }
4889 else
4890 {
4891 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY,
4892 "Not allowing position change for window %s PPosition 0x%lx USPosition 0x%lx type %u\n",
4893 window->desc, window->size_hints.flags & PPosition(1L << 2),
4894 window->size_hints.flags & USPosition(1L << 0),
4895 window->type);
4896 }
4897
4898 width = window->rect.width;
4899 height = window->rect.height;
4900 if (!in_grab_op)
4901 {
4902 if (value_mask & CWWidth(1<<2))
4903 width = new_width;
4904
4905 if (value_mask & CWHeight(1<<3))
4906 height = new_height;
4907 }
4908
4909 /* ICCCM 4.1.5 */
4910
4911 /* We're ignoring the value_mask here, since sizes
4912 * not in the mask will be the current window geometry.
4913 */
4914 window->size_hints.x = x;
4915 window->size_hints.y = y;
4916 window->size_hints.width = width;
4917 window->size_hints.height = height;
4918
4919 /* NOTE: We consider ConfigureRequests to be "user" actions in one
4920 * way, but not in another. Explanation of the two cases are in the
4921 * next two big comments.
4922 */
4923
4924 /* The constraints code allows user actions to move windows
4925 * offscreen, etc., and configure request actions would often send
4926 * windows offscreen when users don't want it if not constrained
4927 * (e.g. hitting a dropdown triangle in a fileselector to show more
4928 * options, which makes the window bigger). Thus we do not set
4929 * META_IS_USER_ACTION in flags to the
4930 * meta_window_move_resize_internal() call.
4931 */
4932 flags = META_IS_CONFIGURE_REQUEST;
4933 if (value_mask & (CWX(1<<0) | CWY(1<<1)))
4934 flags |= META_IS_MOVE_ACTION;
4935 if (value_mask & (CWWidth(1<<2) | CWHeight(1<<3)))
4936 flags |= META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION;
4937
4938 if (flags & (META_IS_MOVE_ACTION | META_IS_RESIZE_ACTION))
4939 {
4940 const MetaXineramaScreenInfo *xinerama_info;
4941 MetaRectangle rect;
4942
4943 rect.x = x;
4944 rect.y = y;
4945 rect.width = width;
4946 rect.height = height;
4947
4948 xinerama_info = meta_screen_get_xinerama_for_rect (window->screen, &rect);
4949
4950 /* Workaround braindead legacy apps that don't know how to
4951 * fullscreen themselves properly - don't get fooled by
4952 * windows which are client decorated; that's not the same
4953 * as fullscreen, even if there are no struts making the
4954 * workarea smaller than the monitor.
4955 */
4956 if (meta_prefs_get_force_fullscreen() &&
4957 (window->decorated || !meta_window_is_client_decorated (window)) &&
4958 meta_rectangle_equal (&rect, &xinerama_info->rect) &&
4959 window->has_fullscreen_func &&
4960 !window->fullscreen)
4961 {
4962 g_warning ("Treating resize request of legacy application %s as a "
4963 "fullscreen request", window->desc);
4964 meta_window_make_fullscreen_internal (window);
4965 }
4966 meta_window_move_resize_internal (window,
4967 flags,
4968 gravity,
4969 x,
4970 y,
4971 width,
4972 height);
4973
4974 }
4975
4976 /* window->user_rect exists to allow "snapping-back" the window if a
4977 * new strut is set (causing the window to move) and then the strut
4978 * is later removed without the user moving the window in the
4979 * interim. We'd like to "snap-back" to the position specified by
4980 * ConfigureRequest events (at least the constrained version of the
4981 * ConfigureRequest, since that is guaranteed to be onscreen) so we
4982 * set user_rect here.
4983 *
4984 * See also bug 426519.
4985 */
4986 save_user_window_placement (window);
4987}
4988
4989gboolean
4990meta_window_configure_request (MetaWindow *window,
4991 XEvent *event)
4992{
4993 /* Note that x, y is the corner of the window border,
4994 * and width, height is the size of the window inside
4995 * its border, but that we always deny border requests
4996 * and give windows a border of 0. But we save the
4997 * requested border here.
4998 */
4999 if (event->xconfigurerequest.value_mask & CWBorderWidth(1<<4))
5000 window->border_width = event->xconfigurerequest.border_width;
5001
5002 meta_window_move_resize_request(window,
5003 event->xconfigurerequest.value_mask,
5004 window->size_hints.win_gravity,
5005 event->xconfigurerequest.x,
5006 event->xconfigurerequest.y,
5007 event->xconfigurerequest.width,
5008 event->xconfigurerequest.height);
5009
5010 /* Handle stacking. We only handle raises/lowers, mostly because
5011 * stack.c really can't deal with anything else. I guess we'll fix
5012 * that if a client turns up that really requires it. Only a very
5013 * few clients even require the raise/lower (and in fact all client
5014 * attempts to deal with stacking order are essentially broken,
5015 * since they have no idea what other clients are involved or how
5016 * the stack looks).
5017 *
5018 * I'm pretty sure no interesting client uses TopIf, BottomIf, or
5019 * Opposite anyway, so the only possible missing thing is
5020 * Above/Below with a sibling set. For now we just pretend there's
5021 * never a sibling set and always do the full raise/lower instead of
5022 * the raise-just-above/below-sibling.
5023 */
5024 if (event->xconfigurerequest.value_mask & CWStackMode(1<<6))
5025 {
5026 MetaWindow *active_window;
5027 active_window = window->display->expected_focus_window;
5028 if (meta_prefs_get_disable_workarounds ())
5029 {
5030 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_STACK,
5031 "%s sent an xconfigure stacking request; this is "
5032 "broken behavior and the request is being ignored.\n",
