5033 window->desc);
5034 }
5035 else if (active_window &&
5036 !meta_window_same_application (window, active_window) &&
5037 !meta_window_same_client (window, active_window) &&
5038 XSERVER_TIME_IS_BEFORE (window->net_wm_user_time,( (window->net_wm_user_time) == 0 || (( (( (window->net_wm_user_time
) < (active_window->net_wm_user_time) ) && ( (active_window
->net_wm_user_time) - (window->net_wm_user_time) < (
(guint32)-1)/2 )) || (( (window->net_wm_user_time) > (active_window
->net_wm_user_time) ) && ( (window->net_wm_user_time
) - (active_window->net_wm_user_time) > ((guint32)-1)/2
)) ) && (active_window->net_wm_user_time) != 0) )
5039 active_window->net_wm_user_time)( (window->net_wm_user_time) == 0 || (( (( (window->net_wm_user_time
) < (active_window->net_wm_user_time) ) && ( (active_window
->net_wm_user_time) - (window->net_wm_user_time) < (
(guint32)-1)/2 )) || (( (window->net_wm_user_time) > (active_window
->net_wm_user_time) ) && ( (window->net_wm_user_time
) - (active_window->net_wm_user_time) > ((guint32)-1)/2
)) ) && (active_window->net_wm_user_time) != 0) ))
5040 {
5041 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_STACK,
5042 "Ignoring xconfigure stacking request from %s (with "
5043 "user_time %u); currently active application is %s (with "
5044 "user_time %u).\n",
5045 window->desc,
5046 window->net_wm_user_time,
5047 active_window->desc,
5048 active_window->net_wm_user_time);
5049 if (event->xconfigurerequest.detail == Above0)
5050 meta_window_set_demands_attention(window);
5051 }
5052 else
5053 {
5054 switch (event->xconfigurerequest.detail)
5055 {
5056 case Above0:
5057 meta_window_raise (window);
5058 break;
5059 case Below1:
5060 meta_window_lower (window);
5061 break;
5062 case TopIf2:
5063 case BottomIf3:
5064 case Opposite4:
5065 break;
5066 }
5067 }
5068 }
5069
5070 return TRUE(!(0));
5071}
5072
5073gboolean
5074meta_window_property_notify (MetaWindow *window,
5075 XEvent *event)
5076{
5077 return process_property_notify (window, &event->xproperty);
5078}
5079
5080#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_TOPLEFT0 0
5081#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_TOP1 1
5082#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_TOPRIGHT2 2
5083#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_RIGHT3 3
5084#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_BOTTOMRIGHT4 4
5085#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_BOTTOM5 5
5086#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_BOTTOMLEFT6 6
5087#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_LEFT7 7
5088#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_MOVE8 8
5089#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_KEYBOARD9 9
5090#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_MOVE_KEYBOARD10 10
5091#define _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_CANCEL11 11
5092
5093gboolean
5094meta_window_client_message (MetaWindow *window,
5095 XEvent *event)
5096{
5097 MetaDisplay *display;
5098
5099 display = window->display;
5100
5101 if (event->xclient.message_type ==
5102 display->atom__NET_CLOSE_WINDOW)
5103 {
5104 guint32 timestamp;
5105
5106 if (event->xclient.data.l[0] != 0)
5107 timestamp = event->xclient.data.l[0];
5108 else
5109 {
5110 meta_warning ("Receiving a NET_CLOSE_WINDOW message for %s without "
5111 "a timestamp! This means some buggy (outdated) "
5112 "application is on the loose!\n",
5113 window->desc);
5114 timestamp = meta_display_get_current_time (window->display);
5115 }
5116
5117 meta_window_delete (window, timestamp);
5118
5119 return TRUE(!(0));
5120 }
5121 else if (event->xclient.message_type ==
5122 display->atom__NET_WM_DESKTOP)
5123 {
5124 int space;
5125 MetaWorkspace *workspace;
5126
5127 space = event->xclient.data.l[0];
5128
5129 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Request to move %s to workspace %d\n",
5130 window->desc, space);
5131
5132 workspace =
5133 meta_screen_get_workspace_by_index (window->screen,
5134 space);
5135
5136 if (workspace)
5137 {
5138 if (window->on_all_workspaces)
5139 meta_window_unstick (window);
5140 meta_window_change_workspace (window, workspace);
5141 }
5142 else if (space == (int) 0xFFFFFFFF)
5143 {
5144 meta_window_stick (window);
5145 }
5146 else
5147 {
5148 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("No such workspace %d for screen\n", space);
5149 }
5150
5151 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Window %s now on_all_workspaces = %d\n",
5152 window->desc, window->on_all_workspaces);
5153
5154 return TRUE(!(0));
5155 }
5156 else if (event->xclient.message_type ==
5157 display->atom__NET_WM_STATE)
5158 {
5159 gulong action;
5160 Atom first;
5161 Atom second;
5162
5163 action = event->xclient.data.l[0];
5164 first = event->xclient.data.l[1];
5165 second = event->xclient.data.l[2];
5166
5167 if (meta_is_verbose ())
5168 {
5169 char *str1;
5170 char *str2;
5171
5172 meta_error_trap_push (display);
5173 str1 = XGetAtomName (display->xdisplay, first);
5174 if (meta_error_trap_pop_with_return (display, TRUE(!(0))) != Success0)
5175 str1 = NULL((void*)0);
5176
5177 meta_error_trap_push (display);
5178 str2 = XGetAtomName (display->xdisplay, second);
5179 if (meta_error_trap_pop_with_return (display, TRUE(!(0))) != Success0)
5180 str2 = NULL((void*)0);
5181
5182 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Request to change _NET_WM_STATE action %lu atom1: %s atom2: %s\n",
5183 action,
5184 str1 ? str1 : "(unknown)",
5185 str2 ? str2 : "(unknown)");
5186
5187 meta_XFree (str1)do { if ((str1)) XFree ((str1)); } while (0);
5188 meta_XFree (str2)do { if ((str2)) XFree ((str2)); } while (0);
5189 }
5190
5191 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_SHADED ||
5192 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_SHADED)
5193 {
5194 gboolean shade;
5195 guint32 timestamp;
5196
5197 /* Stupid protocol has no timestamp; of course, shading
5198 * sucks anyway so who really cares that we're forced to do
5199 * a roundtrip here?
5200 */
5201 timestamp = meta_display_get_current_time_roundtrip (window->display);
5202
5203 shade = (action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1 ||
5204 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 && !window->shaded));
5205 if (shade && window->has_shade_func)
5206 meta_window_shade (window, timestamp);
5207 else
5208 meta_window_unshade (window, timestamp);
5209 }
5210
5211 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_FULLSCREEN ||
5212 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_FULLSCREEN)
5213 {
5214 gboolean make_fullscreen;
5215
5216 make_fullscreen = (action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1 ||
5217 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 && !window->fullscreen));
5218 if (make_fullscreen && window->has_fullscreen_func)
5219 meta_window_make_fullscreen (window);
5220 else
5221 meta_window_unmake_fullscreen (window);
5222 }
5223
5224 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_HORZ ||
5225 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_HORZ)
5226 {
5227 gboolean max;
5228
5229 max = (action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1 ||
5230 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 &&
5231 !window->maximized_horizontally));
5232 if (max && window->has_maximize_func)
5233 {
5234 if (meta_prefs_get_raise_on_click ())
5235 meta_window_raise (window);
5236 meta_window_maximize (window, META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL);
5237 }
5238 else
5239 {
5240 if (meta_prefs_get_raise_on_click ())
5241 meta_window_raise (window);
5242 meta_window_unmaximize (window, META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL);
5243 }
5244 }
5245
5246 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_VERT ||
5247 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_VERT)
5248 {
5249 gboolean max;
5250
5251 max = (action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1 ||
5252 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 &&
5253 !window->maximized_vertically));
5254 if (max && window->has_maximize_func)
5255 {
5256 if (meta_prefs_get_raise_on_click ())
5257 meta_window_raise (window);
5258 meta_window_maximize (window, META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL);
5259 }
5260 else
5261 {
5262 if (meta_prefs_get_raise_on_click ())
5263 meta_window_raise (window);
5264 meta_window_unmaximize (window, META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL);
5265 }
5266 }
5267
5268 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_MODAL ||
5269 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_MODAL)
5270 {
5271 window->wm_state_modal =
5272 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1) ||
5273 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 && !window->wm_state_modal);
5274
5275 recalc_window_type (window);
5276 meta_window_queue(window, META_QUEUE_MOVE_RESIZE);
5277 }
5278
5279 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_SKIP_PAGER ||
5280 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_SKIP_PAGER)
5281 {
5282 window->wm_state_skip_pager =
5283 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1) ||
5284 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 && !window->skip_pager);
5285
5286 recalc_window_features (window);
5287 set_net_wm_state (window);
5288 }
5289
5290 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_SKIP_TASKBAR ||
5291 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_SKIP_TASKBAR)
5292 {
5293 window->wm_state_skip_taskbar =
5294 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1) ||
5295 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 && !window->skip_taskbar);
5296
5297 recalc_window_features (window);
5298 set_net_wm_state (window);
5299 }
5300
5301 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_ABOVE ||
5302 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_ABOVE)
5303 {
5304 window->wm_state_above =
5305 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1) ||
5306 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 && !window->wm_state_above);
5307
5308 meta_window_update_layer (window);
5309 set_net_wm_state (window);
5310 }
5311
5312 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_BELOW ||
5313 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_BELOW)
5314 {
5315 window->wm_state_below =
5316 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1) ||
5317 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 && !window->wm_state_below);
5318
5319 meta_window_update_layer (window);
5320 set_net_wm_state (window);
5321 }
5322
5323 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_DEMANDS_ATTENTION ||
5324 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_DEMANDS_ATTENTION)
5325 {
5326 if ((action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1) ||
5327 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 && !window->wm_state_demands_attention))
5328 meta_window_set_demands_attention (window);
5329 else
5330 meta_window_unset_demands_attention (window);
5331 }
5332
5333 if (first == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_STICKY ||
5334 second == display->atom__NET_WM_STATE_STICKY)
5335 {
5336 if ((action == _NET_WM_STATE_ADD1) ||
5337 (action == _NET_WM_STATE_TOGGLE2 && !window->on_all_workspaces))
5338 meta_window_stick (window);
5339 else
5340 meta_window_unstick (window);
5341 }
5342
5343 return TRUE(!(0));
5344 }
5345 else if (event->xclient.message_type ==
5346 display->atom_WM_CHANGE_STATE)
5347 {
5348 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("WM_CHANGE_STATE client message, state: %ld\n",
5349 event->xclient.data.l[0]);
5350 if (event->xclient.data.l[0] == IconicState3)
5351 meta_window_minimize (window);
5352
5353 return TRUE(!(0));
5354 }
5355 else if (event->xclient.message_type ==
5356 display->atom__NET_WM_MOVERESIZE)
5357 {
5358 int x_root;
5359 int y_root;
5360 int action;
5361 MetaGrabOp op;
5362 int button;
5363 guint32 timestamp;
5364
5365 /* _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE messages are almost certainly going to come from
5366 * clients when users click on the fake "frame" that the client has,
5367 * thus we should also treat such messages as though it were a
5368 * "frame action".
5369 */
5370 gboolean const frame_action = TRUE(!(0));
5371
5372 x_root = event->xclient.data.l[0];
5373 y_root = event->xclient.data.l[1];
5374 action = event->xclient.data.l[2];
5375 button = event->xclient.data.l[3];
5376
5377 /* FIXME: What a braindead protocol; no timestamp?!? */
5378 timestamp = meta_display_get_current_time_roundtrip (display);
5379 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
5380 "Received _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE message on %s, %d,%d action = %d, button %d\n",
5381 window->desc,
5382 x_root, y_root, action, button);
5383
5384 op = META_GRAB_OP_NONE;
5385 switch (action)
5386 {
5387 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_TOPLEFT0:
5388 op = META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NW;
5389 break;
5390 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_TOP1:
5391 op = META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_N;
5392 break;
5393 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_TOPRIGHT2:
5394 op = META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NE;
5395 break;
5396 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_RIGHT3:
5397 op = META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_E;
5398 break;
5399 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_BOTTOMRIGHT4:
5400 op = META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SE;
5401 break;
5402 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_BOTTOM5:
5403 op = META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_S;
5404 break;
5405 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_BOTTOMLEFT6:
5406 op = META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SW;
5407 break;
5408 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_LEFT7:
5409 op = META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_W;
5410 break;
5411 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_MOVE8:
5412 op = META_GRAB_OP_MOVING;
5413 break;
5414 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_SIZE_KEYBOARD9:
5415 op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_UNKNOWN;
5416 break;
5417 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_MOVE_KEYBOARD10:
5418 op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_MOVING;
5419 break;
5420 case _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_CANCEL11:
5421 /* handled below */
5422 break;
5423 default:
5424 break;
5425 }
5426
5427 if (action == _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE_CANCEL11)
5428 {
5429 meta_display_end_grab_op (window->display, timestamp);
5430 }
5431 else if (op != META_GRAB_OP_NONE &&
5432 ((window->has_move_func && op == META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_MOVING) ||
5433 (window->has_resize_func && op == META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_UNKNOWN)))
5434 {
5435 meta_window_begin_grab_op (window, op, frame_action, timestamp);
5436 }
5437 else if (op != META_GRAB_OP_NONE &&
5438 ((window->has_move_func && op == META_GRAB_OP_MOVING) ||
5439 (window->has_resize_func &&
5440 (op != META_GRAB_OP_MOVING &&
5441 op != META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_MOVING))))
5442 {
5443 /*
5444 * the button SHOULD already be included in the message
5445 */
5446 if (button == 0)
5447 {
5448 int x, y, query_root_x, query_root_y;
5449 Window root, child;
5450 guint mask;
5451
5452 /* The race conditions in this _NET_WM_MOVERESIZE thing
5453 * are mind-boggling
5454 */
5455 mask = 0;
5456 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
5457 XQueryPointer (window->display->xdisplay,
5458 window->xwindow,
5459 &root, &child,
5460 &query_root_x, &query_root_y,
5461 &x, &y,
5462 &mask);
5463 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, TRUE(!(0)));
5464
5465 if (mask & Button1Mask(1<<8))
5466 button = 1;
5467 else if (mask & Button2Mask(1<<9))
5468 button = 2;
5469 else if (mask & Button3Mask(1<<10))
5470 button = 3;
5471 else
5472 button = 0;
5473 }
5474
5475 if (button != 0)
5476 {
5477 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
5478 "Beginning move/resize with button = %d\n", button);
5479 meta_display_begin_grab_op (window->display,
5480 window->screen,
5481 window,
5482 op,
5483 FALSE(0),
5484 frame_action,
5485 button, 0,
5486 timestamp,
5487 x_root,
5488 y_root);
5489 }
5490 }
5491
5492 return TRUE(!(0));
5493 }
5494 else if (event->xclient.message_type ==
5495 display->atom__NET_MOVERESIZE_WINDOW)
5496 {
5497 int gravity;
5498 guint value_mask;
5499
5500 gravity = (event->xclient.data.l[0] & 0xff);
5501 value_mask = (event->xclient.data.l[0] & 0xf00) >> 8;
5502
5503 if (gravity == 0)
5504 gravity = window->size_hints.win_gravity;
5505
5506 meta_window_move_resize_request(window,
5507 value_mask,
5508 gravity,
5509 event->xclient.data.l[1], /* x */
5510 event->xclient.data.l[2], /* y */
5511 event->xclient.data.l[3], /* width */
5512 event->xclient.data.l[4]); /* height */
5513 }
5514 else if (event->xclient.message_type ==
5515 display->atom__NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW)
5516 {
5517 MetaClientType source_indication;
5518 guint32 timestamp;
5519
5520 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("_NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW request for window '%s', activating\n",
5521 window->desc);
5522
5523 source_indication = event->xclient.data.l[0];
5524 timestamp = event->xclient.data.l[1];
5525
5526 if (source_indication > META_CLIENT_TYPE_MAX_RECOGNIZED)
5527 source_indication = META_CLIENT_TYPE_UNKNOWN;
5528
5529 if (timestamp == 0)
5530 {
5531 /* Client using older EWMH _NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW without a timestamp */
5532 meta_warning ("Buggy client sent a _NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW message with a "
5533 "timestamp of 0 for %s\n",
5534 window->desc);
5535 timestamp = meta_display_get_current_time (display);
5536 }
5537
5538 window_activate (window, timestamp, source_indication, NULL((void*)0));
5539 return TRUE(!(0));
5540 }
5541 else if (event->xclient.message_type ==
5542 display->atom__NET_WM_FULLSCREEN_MONITORS)
5543 {
5544 gulong top, bottom, left, right;
5545
5546 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("_NET_WM_FULLSCREEN_MONITORS request for window '%s'\n",
5547 window->desc);
5548
5549 top = event->xclient.data.l[0];
5550 bottom = event->xclient.data.l[1];
5551 left = event->xclient.data.l[2];
5552 right = event->xclient.data.l[3];
5553 /* source_indication = event->xclient.data.l[4]; */
5554
5555 meta_window_update_fullscreen_monitors (window, top, bottom, left, right);
5556 }
5557 else if (event->xclient.message_type ==
5558 display->atom__GTK_SHOW_WINDOW_MENU)
5559 {
5560 gulong x_root, y_root;
5561 guint32 timestamp;
5562 int button;
5563
5564 if (meta_prefs_get_raise_on_click ())
5565 meta_window_raise (window);
5566
5567 timestamp = meta_display_get_current_time_roundtrip (display);
5568 x_root = event->xclient.data.l[1];
5569 y_root = event->xclient.data.l[2];
5570 button = 3;
5571
5572 meta_window_show_menu (window,
5573 x_root,
5574 y_root,
5575 button,
5576 timestamp);
5577 }
5578
5579 return FALSE(0);
5580}
5581
5582static void
5583meta_window_appears_focused_changed (MetaWindow *window)
5584{
5585 set_net_wm_state (window);
5586
5587 if (window->frame)
5588 meta_frame_queue_draw (window->frame);
5589}
5590
5591static void
5592check_ancestor_focus_appearance (MetaWindow *window)
5593{
5594 MetaWindow *parent = meta_window_get_transient_for (window);
5595
5596 if (!meta_prefs_get_attach_modal_dialogs ())
5597 return;
5598
5599 if (window->type != META_WINDOW_MODAL_DIALOG || !parent || parent == window)
5600 return;
5601
5602 if (parent->frame)
5603 meta_frame_queue_draw (parent->frame);
5604
5605 check_ancestor_focus_appearance (parent);
5606}
5607
5608gboolean
5609meta_window_notify_focus (MetaWindow *window,
5610 XEvent *event)
5611{
5612 /* note the event can be on either the window or the frame,
5613 * we focus the frame for shaded windows
5614 */
5615
5616 /* The event can be FocusIn, FocusOut, or UnmapNotify.
5617 * On UnmapNotify we have to pretend it's focus out,
5618 * because we won't get a focus out if it occurs, apparently.
5619 */
5620
5621 /* We ignore grabs, though this is questionable.
5622 * It may be better to increase the intelligence of
5623 * the focus window tracking.
5624 *
5625 * The problem is that keybindings for windows are done with
5626 * XGrabKey, which means focus_window disappears and the front of
5627 * the MRU list gets confused from what the user expects once a
5628 * keybinding is used.
5629 */
5630 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
5631 "Focus %s event received on %s 0x%lx (%s) "
5632 "mode %s detail %s\n",
5633 event->type == FocusIn9 ? "in" :
5634 event->type == FocusOut10 ? "out" :
5635 event->type == UnmapNotify18 ? "unmap" :
5636 "???",
5637 window->desc, event->xany.window,
5638 event->xany.window == window->xwindow ?
5639 "client window" :
5640 (window->frame && event->xany.window == window->frame->xwindow) ?
5641 "frame window" :
5642 "unknown window",
5643 event->type != UnmapNotify18 ?
5644 meta_event_mode_to_string (event->xfocus.mode) : "n/a",
5645 event->type != UnmapNotify18 ?
5646 meta_event_detail_to_string (event->xfocus.detail) : "n/a");
5647
5648 /* FIXME our pointer tracking is broken; see how
5649 * gtk+/gdk/x11/gdkevents-x11.c or XFree86/xc/programs/xterm/misc.c
5650 * handle it for the correct way. In brief you need to track
5651 * pointer focus and regular focus, and handle EnterNotify in
5652 * PointerRoot mode with no window manager. However as noted above,
5653 * accurate focus tracking will break things because we want to keep
5654 * windows "focused" when using keybindings on them, and also we
5655 * sometimes "focus" a window by focusing its frame or
5656 * no_focus_window; so this all needs rethinking massively.
5657 *
5658 * My suggestion is to change it so that we clearly separate
5659 * actual keyboard focus tracking using the xterm algorithm,
5660 * and marco's "pretend" focus window, and go through all
5661 * the code and decide which one should be used in each place;
5662 * a hard bit is deciding on a policy for that.
5663 *
5664 * http://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=90382
5665 */
5666
5667 if ((event->type == FocusIn9 ||
5668 event->type == FocusOut10) &&
5669 (event->xfocus.mode == NotifyGrab1 ||
5670 event->xfocus.mode == NotifyUngrab2 ||
5671 /* From WindowMaker, ignore all funky pointer root events */
5672 event->xfocus.detail > NotifyNonlinearVirtual4))
5673 {
5674 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
5675 "Ignoring focus event generated by a grab or other weirdness\n");
5676 return TRUE(!(0));
5677 }
5678
5679 if (event->type == FocusIn9)
5680 {
5681 if (window != window->display->focus_window)
5682 {
5683 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
5684 "* Focus --> %s\n", window->desc);
5685 window->display->focus_window = window;
5686 window->has_focus = TRUE(!(0));
5687 meta_compositor_set_active_window (window->display->compositor,
5688 window->screen, window);
5689
5690 /* Move to the front of the focusing workspace's MRU list.
5691 * We should only be "removing" it from the MRU list if it's
5692 * not already there. Note that it's possible that we might
5693 * be processing this FocusIn after we've changed to a
5694 * different workspace; we should therefore update the MRU
5695 * list only if the window is actually on the active
5696 * workspace.
5697 */
5698 if (window->screen->active_workspace &&
5699 meta_window_located_on_workspace (window,
5700 window->screen->active_workspace))
5701 {
5702 GList* link;
5703 link = g_list_find (window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list,
5704 window);
5705 g_assert (link)do { if (link) ; else g_assertion_message_expr ("marco", "core/window.c"
, 5705, ((const char*) (__func__)), "link"); } while (0);
5706
5707 window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list =
5708 g_list_remove_link (window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list,
5709 link);
5710 g_list_free (link);
5711
5712 window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list =
5713 g_list_prepend (window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list,
5714 window);
5715 }
5716
5717 meta_window_appears_focused_changed (window);
5718
5719 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
5720 XInstallColormap (window->display->xdisplay,
5721 window->colormap);
5722 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, FALSE(0));
5723
5724 /* move into FOCUSED_WINDOW layer */
5725 meta_window_update_layer (window);
5726
5727 /* Ungrab click to focus button since the sync grab can interfere
5728 * with some things you might do inside the focused window, by
5729 * causing the client to get funky enter/leave events.
5730 *
5731 * The reason we usually have a passive grab on the window is
5732 * so that we can intercept clicks and raise the window in
5733 * response. For click-to-focus we don't need that since the
5734 * focused window is already raised. When raise_on_click is
5735 * FALSE we also don't need that since we don't do anything
5736 * when the window is clicked.
5737 *
5738 * There is dicussion in bugs 102209, 115072, and 461577
5739 */
5740 if (meta_prefs_get_focus_mode () == META_FOCUS_MODE_CLICK ||
5741 !meta_prefs_get_raise_on_click())
5742 meta_display_ungrab_focus_window_button (window->display, window);
5743
5744 /* parent window become active. */
5745 check_ancestor_focus_appearance (window);
5746 }
5747 }
5748 else if (event->type == FocusOut10 ||
5749 event->type == UnmapNotify18)
5750 {
5751 if (event->type == FocusOut10 &&
5752 event->xfocus.detail == NotifyInferior2)
5753 {
5754 /* This event means the client moved focus to a subwindow */
5755 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
5756 "Ignoring focus out on %s with NotifyInferior\n",
5757 window->desc);
5758 return TRUE(!(0));
5759 }
5760
5761 if (window == window->display->focus_window)
5762 {
5763 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
5764 "%s is now the previous focus window due to being focused out or unmapped\n",
5765 window->desc);
5766
5767 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_FOCUS,
5768 "* Focus --> NULL (was %s)\n", window->desc);
5769
5770 window->display->focus_window = NULL((void*)0);
5771 window->has_focus = FALSE(0);
5772
5773 /* parent window become active. */
5774 check_ancestor_focus_appearance (window);
5775
5776 meta_window_appears_focused_changed (window);
5777
5778 meta_compositor_set_active_window (window->display->compositor,
5779 window->screen, NULL((void*)0));
5780
5781 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
5782 XUninstallColormap (window->display->xdisplay,
5783 window->colormap);
5784 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, FALSE(0));
5785
5786 /* move out of FOCUSED_WINDOW layer */
5787 meta_window_update_layer (window);
5788
5789 /* Re-grab for click to focus and raise-on-click, if necessary */
5790 if (meta_prefs_get_focus_mode () == META_FOCUS_MODE_CLICK ||
5791 !meta_prefs_get_raise_on_click ())
5792 meta_display_grab_focus_window_button (window->display, window);
5793 }
5794 }
5795
5796 /* Now set _NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW hint */
5797 meta_display_update_active_window_hint (window->display);
5798
5799 return FALSE(0);
5800}
5801
5802static gboolean
5803process_property_notify (MetaWindow *window,
5804 XPropertyEvent *event)
5805{
5806 Window xid = window->xwindow;
5807
5808 if (meta_is_verbose ()) /* avoid looking up the name if we don't have to */
5809 {
5810 char *property_name = XGetAtomName (window->display->xdisplay,
5811 event->atom);
5812
5813 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Property notify on %s for %s\n",
5814 window->desc, property_name);
5815 XFree (property_name);
5816 }
5817
5818 if (event->atom == window->display->atom__NET_WM_USER_TIME &&
5819 window->user_time_window)
5820 {
5821 xid = window->user_time_window;
5822 }
5823
5824 meta_window_reload_property_from_xwindow (window, xid, event->atom, FALSE(0));
5825
5826 return TRUE(!(0));
5827}
5828
5829static void
5830send_configure_notify (MetaWindow *window)
5831{
5832 XEvent event;
5833
5834 /* from twm */
5835
5836 event.type = ConfigureNotify22;
5837 event.xconfigure.display = window->display->xdisplay;
5838 event.xconfigure.event = window->xwindow;
5839 event.xconfigure.window = window->xwindow;
5840 event.xconfigure.x = window->rect.x - window->border_width;
5841 event.xconfigure.y = window->rect.y - window->border_width;
5842 if (window->frame)
5843 {
5844 if (window->withdrawn)
5845 {
5846 MetaFrameBorders borders;
5847 /* We reparent the client window and put it to the position
5848 * where the visible top-left of the frame window currently is.
5849 */
5850
5851 meta_frame_calc_borders (window->frame, &borders);
5852
5853 event.xconfigure.x = window->frame->rect.x + borders.invisible.left;
5854 event.xconfigure.y = window->frame->rect.y + borders.invisible.top;
5855 }
5856 else
5857 {
5858 /* Need to be in root window coordinates */
5859 event.xconfigure.x += window->frame->rect.x;
5860 event.xconfigure.y += window->frame->rect.y;
5861 }
5862 }
5863 event.xconfigure.width = window->rect.width;
5864 event.xconfigure.height = window->rect.height;
5865 event.xconfigure.border_width = window->border_width; /* requested not actual */
5866 event.xconfigure.above = None0L; /* FIXME */
5867 event.xconfigure.override_redirect = False0;
5868
5869 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY,
5870 "Sending synthetic configure notify to %s with x: %d y: %d w: %d h: %d\n",
5871 window->desc,
5872 event.xconfigure.x, event.xconfigure.y,
5873 event.xconfigure.width, event.xconfigure.height);
5874
5875 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
5876 XSendEvent (window->display->xdisplay,
5877 window->xwindow,
5878 False0, StructureNotifyMask(1L<<17), &event);
5879 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, FALSE(0));
5880}
5881
5882gboolean
5883meta_window_get_icon_geometry (MetaWindow *window,
5884 MetaRectangle *rect)
5885{
5886 gulong *geometry = NULL((void*)0);
5887 int nitems;
5888
5889 if (meta_prop_get_cardinal_list (window->display,
5890 window->xwindow,
5891 window->display->atom__NET_WM_ICON_GEOMETRY,
5892 &geometry, &nitems))
5893 {
5894 if (nitems != 4)
5895 {
5896 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("_NET_WM_ICON_GEOMETRY on %s has %d values instead of 4\n",
5897 window->desc, nitems);
5898 meta_XFree (geometry)do { if ((geometry)) XFree ((geometry)); } while (0);
5899 return FALSE(0);
5900 }
5901
5902 if (rect)
5903 {
5904 rect->x = geometry[0];
5905 rect->y = geometry[1];
5906 rect->width = geometry[2];
5907 rect->height = geometry[3];
5908 }
5909
5910 meta_XFree (geometry)do { if ((geometry)) XFree ((geometry)); } while (0);
5911
5912 return TRUE(!(0));
5913 }
5914
5915 return FALSE(0);
5916}
5917
5918static Window
5919read_client_leader (MetaDisplay *display,
5920 Window xwindow)
5921{
5922 Window retval = None0L;
5923
5924 meta_prop_get_window (display, xwindow,
5925 display->atom_WM_CLIENT_LEADER,
5926 &retval);
5927
5928 return retval;
5929}
5930
5931typedef struct
5932{
5933 Window leader;
5934} ClientLeaderData;
5935
5936static gboolean
5937find_client_leader_func (MetaWindow *ancestor,
5938 void *data)
5939{
5940 ClientLeaderData *d;
5941
5942 d = data;
5943
5944 d->leader = read_client_leader (ancestor->display,
5945 ancestor->xwindow);
5946
5947 /* keep going if no client leader found */
5948 return d->leader == None0L;
5949}
5950
5951static void
5952update_sm_hints (MetaWindow *window)
5953{
5954 Window leader;
5955
5956 window->xclient_leader = None0L;
5957 window->sm_client_id = NULL((void*)0);
5958
5959 /* If not on the current window, we can get the client
5960 * leader from transient parents. If we find a client
5961 * leader, we read the SM_CLIENT_ID from it.
5962 */
5963 leader = read_client_leader (window->display, window->xwindow);
5964 if (leader == None0L)
5965 {
5966 ClientLeaderData d;
5967 d.leader = None0L;
5968 meta_window_foreach_ancestor (window, find_client_leader_func,
5969 &d);
5970 leader = d.leader;
5971 }
5972
5973 if (leader != None0L)
5974 {
5975 char *str;
5976
5977 window->xclient_leader = leader;
5978
5979 if (meta_prop_get_latin1_string (window->display, leader,
5980 window->display->atom_SM_CLIENT_ID,
5981 &str))
5982 {
5983 window->sm_client_id = g_strdup (str)g_strdup_inline (str);
5984 meta_XFree (str)do { if ((str)) XFree ((str)); } while (0);
5985 }
5986 }
5987 else
5988 {
5989 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Didn't find a client leader for %s\n", window->desc);
5990
5991 if (!meta_prefs_get_disable_workarounds ())
5992 {
5993 /* Some broken apps (kdelibs fault?) set SM_CLIENT_ID on the app
5994 * instead of the client leader
5995 */
5996 char *str;
5997
5998 str = NULL((void*)0);
5999 if (meta_prop_get_latin1_string (window->display, window->xwindow,
6000 window->display->atom_SM_CLIENT_ID,
6001 &str))
6002 {
6003 if (window->sm_client_id == NULL((void*)0)) /* first time through */
6004 meta_warning (_("Window %s sets SM_CLIENT_ID on itself, instead of on the WM_CLIENT_LEADER window as specified in the ICCCM.\n")((char *) g_dgettext ("marco", "Window %s sets SM_CLIENT_ID on itself, instead of on the WM_CLIENT_LEADER window as specified in the ICCCM.\n"
)),
6005 window->desc);
6006
6007 window->sm_client_id = g_strdup (str)g_strdup_inline (str);
6008 meta_XFree (str)do { if ((str)) XFree ((str)); } while (0);
6009 }
6010 }
6011 }
6012
6013 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Window %s client leader: 0x%lx SM_CLIENT_ID: '%s'\n",
6014 window->desc, window->xclient_leader,
6015 window->sm_client_id ? window->sm_client_id : "none");
6016}
6017
6018void
6019meta_window_update_role (MetaWindow *window)
6020{
6021 char *str;
6022
6023 if (window->role)
6024 g_free (window->role);
6025 window->role = NULL((void*)0);
6026
6027 if (meta_prop_get_latin1_string (window->display, window->xwindow,
6028 window->display->atom_WM_WINDOW_ROLE,
6029 &str))
6030 {
6031 window->role = g_strdup (str)g_strdup_inline (str);
6032 meta_XFree (str)do { if ((str)) XFree ((str)); } while (0);
6033 }
6034
6035 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Updated role of %s to '%s'\n",
6036 window->desc, window->role ? window->role : "null");
6037}
6038
6039void
6040meta_window_update_net_wm_type (MetaWindow *window)
6041{
6042 int n_atoms;
6043 Atom *atoms;
6044 int i;
6045
6046 window->type_atom = None0L;
6047 n_atoms = 0;
6048 atoms = NULL((void*)0);
6049
6050 meta_prop_get_atom_list (window->display, window->xwindow,
6051 window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE,
6052 &atoms, &n_atoms);
6053
6054 i = 0;
6055 while (i < n_atoms)
6056 {
6057 /* We break as soon as we find one we recognize,
6058 * supposed to prefer those near the front of the list
6059 */
6060 if (atoms[i] == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_DESKTOP ||
6061 atoms[i] == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_DOCK ||
6062 atoms[i] == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_TOOLBAR ||
6063 atoms[i] == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_MENU ||
6064 atoms[i] == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_DIALOG ||
6065 atoms[i] == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_NORMAL ||
6066 atoms[i] == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_UTILITY ||
6067 atoms[i] == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_SPLASH)
6068 {
6069 window->type_atom = atoms[i];
6070 break;
6071 }
6072
6073 ++i;
6074 }
6075
6076 meta_XFree (atoms)do { if ((atoms)) XFree ((atoms)); } while (0);
6077
6078 if (meta_is_verbose ())
6079 {
6080 char *str;
6081
6082 str = NULL((void*)0);
6083 if (window->type_atom != None0L)
6084 {
6085 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
6086 str = XGetAtomName (window->display->xdisplay, window->type_atom);
6087 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, TRUE(!(0)));
6088 }
6089
6090 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Window %s type atom %s\n", window->desc,
6091 str ? str : "(none)");
6092
6093 if (str)
6094 meta_XFree (str)do { if ((str)) XFree ((str)); } while (0);
6095 }
6096
6097 meta_window_recalc_window_type (window);
6098}
6099
6100static void
6101redraw_icon (MetaWindow *window)
6102{
6103 /* We could probably be smart and just redraw the icon here,
6104 * instead of the whole frame.
6105 */
6106 if (window->frame && (window->mapped || window->frame->mapped))
6107 meta_ui_queue_frame_draw (window->screen->ui, window->frame->xwindow);
6108}
6109
6110void
6111meta_window_update_icon_now (MetaWindow *window)
6112{
6113 GdkPixbuf *icon;
6114 GdkPixbuf *mini_icon;
6115
6116 icon = NULL((void*)0);
6117 mini_icon = NULL((void*)0);
6118
6119 int icon_size = meta_prefs_get_icon_size();
6120
6121 if (meta_read_icons (window->screen,
6122 window->xwindow,
6123 window->res_name,
6124 &window->icon_cache,
6125 window->wm_hints_pixmap,
6126 window->wm_hints_mask,
6127 &icon,
6128 icon_size, /* width */
6129 icon_size, /* height */
6130 &mini_icon,
6131 META_MINI_ICON_WIDTH16,
6132 META_MINI_ICON_HEIGHT16))
6133 {
6134 if (window->icon)
6135 g_object_unref (G_OBJECT (window->icon)((((GObject*) (void *) g_type_check_instance_cast ((GTypeInstance
*) ((window->icon)), (((GType) ((20) << (2)))))))));
6136
6137 if (window->mini_icon)
6138 g_object_unref (G_OBJECT (window->mini_icon)((((GObject*) (void *) g_type_check_instance_cast ((GTypeInstance
*) ((window->mini_icon)), (((GType) ((20) << (2)))))
))));
6139
6140 window->icon = icon;
6141 window->mini_icon = mini_icon;
6142
6143 redraw_icon (window);
6144 }
6145
6146 g_assert (window->icon)do { if (window->icon) ; else g_assertion_message_expr ("marco"
, "core/window.c", 6146, ((const char*) (__func__)), "window->icon"
); } while (0);
6147 g_assert (window->mini_icon)do { if (window->mini_icon) ; else g_assertion_message_expr
("marco", "core/window.c", 6147, ((const char*) (__func__)),
"window->mini_icon"); } while (0);
6148}
6149
6150static gboolean
6151idle_update_icon (gpointer data)
6152{
6153 GSList *tmp;
6154 GSList *copy;
6155 guint queue_index = GPOINTER_TO_INT (data)((gint) (glong) (data));
6156
6157 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_GEOMETRY, "Clearing the update_icon queue\n");
6158
6159 /* Work with a copy, for reentrancy. The allowed reentrancy isn't
6160 * complete; destroying a window while we're in here would result in
6161 * badness. But it's OK to queue/unqueue update_icons.
6162 */
6163 copy = g_slist_copy (queue_pending[queue_index]);
6164 g_slist_free (queue_pending[queue_index]);
6165 queue_pending[queue_index] = NULL((void*)0);
6166 queue_idle[queue_index] = 0;
6167
6168 destroying_windows_disallowed += 1;
6169
6170 tmp = copy;
6171 while (tmp != NULL((void*)0))
6172 {
6173 MetaWindow *window;
6174
6175 window = tmp->data;
6176
6177 meta_window_update_icon_now (window);
6178 window->is_in_queues &= ~META_QUEUE_UPDATE_ICON;
6179
6180 tmp = tmp->next;
6181 }
6182
6183 g_slist_free (copy);
6184
6185 destroying_windows_disallowed -= 1;
6186
6187 return FALSE(0);
6188}
6189
6190MetaWorkspace *
6191meta_window_get_workspace (MetaWindow *window)
6192{
6193 if (window->on_all_workspaces)
6194 return window->screen->active_workspace;
6195 else
6196 return window->workspace;
6197}
6198
6199GList*
6200meta_window_get_workspaces (MetaWindow *window)
6201{
6202 if (window->on_all_workspaces)
6203 return window->screen->workspaces;
6204 else
6205 return window->workspace->list_containing_self;
6206}
6207
6208static void
6209invalidate_work_areas (MetaWindow *window)
6210{
6211 GList *tmp;
6212
6213 tmp = meta_window_get_workspaces (window);
6214
6215 while (tmp != NULL((void*)0))
6216 {
6217 meta_workspace_invalidate_work_area (tmp->data);
6218 tmp = tmp->next;
6219 }
6220}
6221
6222void
6223meta_window_update_struts (MetaWindow *window)
6224{
6225 GSList *old_struts;
6226 GSList *new_struts;
6227 GSList *old_iter, *new_iter;
6228 gulong *struts = NULL((void*)0);
6229 int nitems;
6230 gboolean changed;
6231
6232 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Updating struts for %s\n", window->desc);
6233
6234 old_struts = window->struts;
6235 new_struts = NULL((void*)0);
6236
6237 if (meta_prop_get_cardinal_list (window->display,
6238 window->xwindow,
6239 window->display->atom__GNOME_WM_STRUT_AREA,
6240 &struts, &nitems))
6241 {
6242 if (nitems != 4)
6243 {
6244 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("_GNOME_WM_STRUT_AREA on %s has %d values instead of 4\n",
6245 window->desc, nitems);
6246 }
6247 else
6248 {
6249 MetaStrut *temp;
6250 MetaSide side;
6251 gboolean valid;
6252 int i;
6253
6254 temp = g_new (MetaStrut, 1)((MetaStrut *) g_malloc_n ((1), sizeof (MetaStrut)));
6255
6256 temp->rect.x = struts[0];
6257 temp->rect.y = struts[1];
6258 temp->rect.width = struts[2];
6259 temp->rect.height = struts[3];
6260
6261 side = META_SIDE_LEFT;
6262 valid = FALSE(0);
6263
6264 for (i = 0; i < window->screen->n_xinerama_infos; i++)
6265 {
6266 MetaRectangle monitor;
6267
6268 monitor = window->screen->xinerama_infos[i].rect;
6269 if (!meta_rectangle_contains_rect (&monitor, &temp->rect))
6270 continue;
6271
6272 if (temp->rect.height > temp->rect.width)
6273 {
6274 if (temp->rect.x == monitor.x)
6275 {
6276 side = META_SIDE_LEFT;
6277 valid = TRUE(!(0));
6278 }
6279 else if (temp->rect.x + temp->rect.width == monitor.x + monitor.width)
6280 {
6281 side = META_SIDE_RIGHT;
6282 valid = TRUE(!(0));
6283 }
6284 }
6285 else
6286 {
6287 if (temp->rect.y == monitor.y)
6288 {
6289 side = META_SIDE_TOP;
6290 valid = TRUE(!(0));
6291 }
6292 else if (temp->rect.y + temp->rect.height == monitor.y + monitor.height)
6293 {
6294 side = META_SIDE_BOTTOM;
6295 valid = TRUE(!(0));
6296 }
6297 }
6298 }
6299
6300 if (valid)
6301 {
6302 temp->side = side;
6303 temp->edge = META_EDGE_XINERAMA;
6304
6305 new_struts = g_slist_prepend (new_struts, temp);
6306 }
6307 else
6308 {
6309 g_free (temp);
6310 }
6311 }
6312
6313 meta_XFree (struts)do { if ((struts)) XFree ((struts)); } while (0);
6314 }
6315 else
6316 {
6317 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("No _GNOME_WM_STRUT_AREA property for %s\n",
6318 window->desc);
6319 }
6320
6321 if (!new_struts &&
6322 meta_prop_get_cardinal_list (window->display,
6323 window->xwindow,
6324 window->display->atom__NET_WM_STRUT_PARTIAL,
6325 &struts, &nitems))
6326 {
6327 if (nitems != 12)
6328 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("_NET_WM_STRUT_PARTIAL on %s has %d values instead "
6329 "of 12\n",
6330 window->desc, nitems);
6331 else
6332 {
6333 /* Pull out the strut info for each side in the hint */
6334 int i;
6335 for (i=0; i<4; i++)
6336 {
6337 MetaStrut *temp;
6338 int thickness, strut_begin, strut_end;
6339
6340 thickness = struts[i];
6341 if (thickness == 0)
6342 continue;
6343 strut_begin = struts[4+(i*2)];
6344 strut_end = struts[4+(i*2)+1];
6345
6346 temp = g_new (MetaStrut, 1)((MetaStrut *) g_malloc_n ((1), sizeof (MetaStrut)));
6347 temp->side = 1 << i; /* See MetaSide def. Matches nicely, eh? */
6348 temp->edge = META_EDGE_SCREEN;
6349 temp->rect = window->screen->rect;
6350 switch (temp->side)
6351 {
6352 case META_SIDE_RIGHT:
6353 temp->rect.x = BOX_RIGHT(temp->rect)((temp->rect).x + (temp->rect).width) - thickness;
6354 /* Intentionally fall through without breaking */
6355 case META_SIDE_LEFT:
6356 temp->rect.width = thickness;
6357 temp->rect.y = strut_begin;
6358 temp->rect.height = strut_end - strut_begin + 1;
6359 break;
6360 case META_SIDE_BOTTOM:
6361 temp->rect.y = BOX_BOTTOM(temp->rect)((temp->rect).y + (temp->rect).height) - thickness;
6362 /* Intentionally fall through without breaking */
6363 case META_SIDE_TOP:
6364 temp->rect.height = thickness;
6365 temp->rect.x = strut_begin;
6366 temp->rect.width = strut_end - strut_begin + 1;
6367 break;
6368 default:
6369 g_assert_not_reached ()do { g_assertion_message_expr ("marco", "core/window.c", 6369
, ((const char*) (__func__)), ((void*)0)); } while (0);
6370 }
6371
6372 new_struts = g_slist_prepend (new_struts, temp);
6373 }
6374
6375 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("_NET_WM_STRUT_PARTIAL struts %lu %lu %lu %lu for "
6376 "window %s\n",
6377 struts[0], struts[1], struts[2], struts[3],
6378 window->desc);
6379 }
6380 meta_XFree (struts)do { if ((struts)) XFree ((struts)); } while (0);
6381 }
6382 else
6383 {
6384 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("No _NET_WM_STRUT property for %s\n",
6385 window->desc);
6386 }
6387
6388 if (!new_struts &&
6389 meta_prop_get_cardinal_list (window->display,
6390 window->xwindow,
6391 window->display->atom__NET_WM_STRUT,
6392 &struts, &nitems))
6393 {
6394 if (nitems != 4)
6395 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("_NET_WM_STRUT on %s has %d values instead of 4\n",
6396 window->desc, nitems);
6397 else
6398 {
6399 /* Pull out the strut info for each side in the hint */
6400 int i;
6401 for (i=0; i<4; i++)
6402 {
6403 MetaStrut *temp;
6404 int thickness;
6405
6406 thickness = struts[i];
6407 if (thickness == 0)
6408 continue;
6409
6410 temp = g_new (MetaStrut, 1)((MetaStrut *) g_malloc_n ((1), sizeof (MetaStrut)));
6411 temp->side = 1 << i;
6412 temp->edge = META_EDGE_SCREEN;
6413 temp->rect = window->screen->rect;
6414 switch (temp->side)
6415 {
6416 case META_SIDE_RIGHT:
6417 temp->rect.x = BOX_RIGHT(temp->rect)((temp->rect).x + (temp->rect).width) - thickness;
6418 /* Intentionally fall through without breaking */
6419 case META_SIDE_LEFT:
6420 temp->rect.width = thickness;
6421 break;
6422 case META_SIDE_BOTTOM:
6423 temp->rect.y = BOX_BOTTOM(temp->rect)((temp->rect).y + (temp->rect).height) - thickness;
6424 /* Intentionally fall through without breaking */
6425 case META_SIDE_TOP:
6426 temp->rect.height = thickness;
6427 break;
6428 default:
6429 g_assert_not_reached ()do { g_assertion_message_expr ("marco", "core/window.c", 6429
, ((const char*) (__func__)), ((void*)0)); } while (0);
6430 }
6431
6432 new_struts = g_slist_prepend (new_struts, temp);
6433 }
6434
6435 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("_NET_WM_STRUT struts %lu %lu %lu %lu for window %s\n",
6436 struts[0], struts[1], struts[2], struts[3],
6437 window->desc);
6438 }
6439 meta_XFree (struts)do { if ((struts)) XFree ((struts)); } while (0);
6440 }
6441 else if (!new_struts)
6442 {
6443 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("No _NET_WM_STRUT property for %s\n",
6444 window->desc);
6445 }
6446
6447 /* Determine whether old_struts and new_struts are the same */
6448 old_iter = old_struts;
6449 new_iter = new_struts;
6450 while (old_iter && new_iter)
6451 {
6452 MetaStrut *old_strut = (MetaStrut*) old_iter->data;
6453 MetaStrut *new_strut = (MetaStrut*) new_iter->data;
6454
6455 if (old_strut->side != new_strut->side ||
6456 old_strut->edge != new_strut->edge ||
6457 !meta_rectangle_equal (&old_strut->rect, &new_strut->rect))
6458 break;
6459
6460 old_iter = old_iter->next;
6461 new_iter = new_iter->next;
6462 }
6463 changed = (old_iter != NULL((void*)0) || new_iter != NULL((void*)0));
6464
6465 /* Update appropriately */
6466 g_slist_free_full (old_struts, g_free);
6467 window->struts = new_struts;
6468 if (changed)
6469 {
6470 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WORKAREA,
6471 "Invalidating work areas of window %s due to struts update\n",
6472 window->desc);
6473 invalidate_work_areas (window);
6474 }
6475 else
6476 {
6477 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WORKAREA,
6478 "Struts on %s were unchanged\n", window->desc);
6479 }
6480}
6481
6482void
6483meta_window_recalc_window_type (MetaWindow *window)
6484{
6485 recalc_window_type (window);
6486}
6487
6488static void
6489recalc_window_type (MetaWindow *window)
6490{
6491 MetaWindowType old_type;
6492
6493 old_type = window->type;
6494
6495 if (window->type_atom != None0L)
6496 {
6497 if (window->type_atom == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_DESKTOP)
6498 window->type = META_WINDOW_DESKTOP;
6499 else if (window->type_atom == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_DOCK)
6500 window->type = META_WINDOW_DOCK;
6501 else if (window->type_atom == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_TOOLBAR)
6502 window->type = META_WINDOW_TOOLBAR;
6503 else if (window->type_atom == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_MENU)
6504 window->type = META_WINDOW_MENU;
6505 else if (window->type_atom == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_DIALOG)
6506 window->type = META_WINDOW_DIALOG;
6507 else if (window->type_atom == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_NORMAL)
6508 window->type = META_WINDOW_NORMAL;
6509 else if (window->type_atom == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_UTILITY)
6510 window->type = META_WINDOW_UTILITY;
6511 else if (window->type_atom == window->display->atom__NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_SPLASH)
6512 window->type = META_WINDOW_SPLASHSCREEN;
6513 else
6514 meta_bug ("Set a type atom for %s that wasn't handled in recalc_window_type\n",
6515 window->desc);
6516 }
6517 else if (window->xtransient_for != None0L)
6518 {
6519 window->type = META_WINDOW_DIALOG;
6520 }
6521 else
6522 {
6523 window->type = META_WINDOW_NORMAL;
6524 }
6525
6526 if (window->type == META_WINDOW_DIALOG &&
6527 window->wm_state_modal)
6528 window->type = META_WINDOW_MODAL_DIALOG;
6529
6530 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Calculated type %u for %s, old type %u\n",
6531 window->type, window->desc, old_type);
6532
6533 if (old_type != window->type)
6534 {
6535 recalc_window_features (window);
6536
6537 set_net_wm_state (window);
6538
6539 /* Update frame */
6540 if (window->decorated)
6541 meta_window_ensure_frame (window);
6542 else
6543 meta_window_destroy_frame (window);
6544
6545 /* update stacking constraints */
6546 meta_window_update_layer (window);
6547
6548 meta_window_grab_keys (window);
6549 }
6550}
6551
6552static void
6553set_allowed_actions_hint (MetaWindow *window)
6554{
6555#define MAX_N_ACTIONS 12
6556 unsigned long data[MAX_N_ACTIONS];
6557 int i;
6558
6559 i = 0;
6560 if (window->has_move_func &&
6561 !window->minimized)
6562 {
6563 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_MOVE;
6564 ++i;
6565 }
6566 if (window->has_resize_func &&
6567 !window->minimized &&
6568 !window->shaded &&
6569 !window->tiled &&
6570 !(window->maximized_horizontally && window->maximized_vertically))
6571 {
6572 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_RESIZE;
6573 ++i;
6574 }
6575 if (window->has_fullscreen_func &&
6576 !window->minimized &&
6577 !window->shaded)
6578 {
6579 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_FULLSCREEN;
6580 ++i;
6581 }
6582 if (window->has_minimize_func)
6583 {
6584 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_MINIMIZE;
6585 ++i;
6586 }
6587 if (window->has_shade_func &&
6588 !window->minimized)
6589 {
6590 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_SHADE;
6591 ++i;
6592 }
6593 /* sticky according to EWMH is different from marco's sticky;
6594 * marco doesn't support EWMH sticky
6595 */
6596 if (window->has_maximize_func &&
6597 !window->minimized &&
6598 !window->shaded)
6599 {
6600 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_MAXIMIZE_HORZ;
6601 ++i;
6602 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_MAXIMIZE_VERT;
6603 ++i;
6604 }
6605 /* We always allow this */
6606 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_CHANGE_DESKTOP;
6607 ++i;
6608 if (window->has_close_func)
6609 {
6610 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_CLOSE;
6611 ++i;
6612 }
6613
6614 /* I guess we always allow above/below operations */
6615 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_ABOVE;
6616 ++i;
6617 data[i] = window->display->atom__NET_WM_ACTION_BELOW;
6618 ++i;
6619
6620 g_assert (i <= MAX_N_ACTIONS)do { if (i <= MAX_N_ACTIONS) ; else g_assertion_message_expr
("marco", "core/window.c", 6620, ((const char*) (__func__)),
"i <= MAX_N_ACTIONS"); } while (0);
6621
6622 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Setting _NET_WM_ALLOWED_ACTIONS with %d atoms\n", i);
6623
6624 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
6625 XChangeProperty (window->display->xdisplay, window->xwindow,
6626 window->display->atom__NET_WM_ALLOWED_ACTIONS,
6627 XA_ATOM((Atom) 4),
6628 32, PropModeReplace0, (guchar*) data, i);
6629 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, FALSE(0));
6630#undef MAX_N_ACTIONS
6631}
6632
6633void
6634meta_window_recalc_features (MetaWindow *window)
6635{
6636 recalc_window_features (window);
6637}
6638
6639static void
6640recalc_window_features (MetaWindow *window)
6641{
6642 gboolean old_has_close_func;
6643 gboolean old_has_minimize_func;
6644 gboolean old_has_move_func;
6645 gboolean old_has_resize_func;
6646 gboolean old_has_shade_func;
6647 gboolean old_always_sticky;
6648
6649 old_has_close_func = window->has_close_func;
6650 old_has_minimize_func = window->has_minimize_func;
6651 old_has_move_func = window->has_move_func;
6652 old_has_resize_func = window->has_resize_func;
6653 old_has_shade_func = window->has_shade_func;
6654 old_always_sticky = window->always_sticky;
6655
6656 /* Use MWM hints initially */
6657 window->decorated = window->mwm_decorated;
6658 window->border_only = window->mwm_border_only;
6659 window->has_close_func = window->mwm_has_close_func;
6660 window->has_minimize_func = window->mwm_has_minimize_func;
6661 window->has_maximize_func = window->mwm_has_maximize_func;
6662 window->has_move_func = window->mwm_has_move_func;
6663
6664 window->has_resize_func = TRUE(!(0));
6665
6666 /* If min_size == max_size, then don't allow resize */
6667 if (window->size_hints.min_width == window->size_hints.max_width &&
6668 window->size_hints.min_height == window->size_hints.max_height)
6669 window->has_resize_func = FALSE(0);
6670 else if (!window->mwm_has_resize_func)
6671 {
6672 /* We ignore mwm_has_resize_func because WM_NORMAL_HINTS is the
6673 * authoritative source for that info. Some apps such as mplayer or
6674 * xine disable resize via MWM but not WM_NORMAL_HINTS, but that
6675 * leads to e.g. us not fullscreening their windows. Apps that set
6676 * MWM but not WM_NORMAL_HINTS are basically broken. We complain
6677 * about these apps but make them work.
6678 */
6679
6680 meta_warning (_("Window %s sets an MWM hint indicating it isn't resizable, but sets min size %d x %d and max size %d x %d; this doesn't make much sense.\n")((char *) g_dgettext ("marco", "Window %s sets an MWM hint indicating it isn't resizable, but sets min size %d x %d and max size %d x %d; this doesn't make much sense.\n"
)),
6681 window->desc,
6682 window->size_hints.min_width,
6683 window->size_hints.min_height,
6684 window->size_hints.max_width,
6685 window->size_hints.max_height);
6686 }
6687
6688 window->has_shade_func = TRUE(!(0));
6689 window->has_fullscreen_func = TRUE(!(0));
6690
6691 window->always_sticky = FALSE(0);
6692
6693 /* Semantic category overrides the MWM hints */
6694 if (window->type == META_WINDOW_TOOLBAR)
6695 window->decorated = FALSE(0);
6696
6697 if (window->type == META_WINDOW_MODAL_DIALOG && meta_prefs_get_attach_modal_dialogs ())
6698 {
6699 MetaWindow *parent = meta_window_get_transient_for (window);
6700 if (parent)
6701 {
6702 window->has_resize_func = FALSE(0);
6703 window->border_only = TRUE(!(0));
6704 }
6705 }
6706
6707 if (window->type == META_WINDOW_DESKTOP ||
6708 window->type == META_WINDOW_DOCK)
6709 window->always_sticky = TRUE(!(0));
6710
6711 if (window->type == META_WINDOW_DESKTOP ||
6712 window->type == META_WINDOW_DOCK ||
6713 window->type == META_WINDOW_SPLASHSCREEN)
6714 {
6715 window->decorated = FALSE(0);
6716 window->has_close_func = FALSE(0);
6717 window->has_shade_func = FALSE(0);
6718
6719 /* FIXME this keeps panels and things from using
6720 * NET_WM_MOVERESIZE; the problem is that some
6721 * panels (edge panels) have fixed possible locations,
6722 * and others ("floating panels") do not.
6723 *
6724 * Perhaps we should require edge panels to explicitly
6725 * disable movement?
6726 */
6727 window->has_move_func = FALSE(0);
6728 window->has_resize_func = FALSE(0);
6729 }
6730
6731 if (window->type != META_WINDOW_NORMAL &&
6732 window->type != META_WINDOW_DIALOG)
6733 {
6734 window->has_minimize_func = FALSE(0);
6735 window->has_maximize_func = FALSE(0);
6736 window->has_fullscreen_func = FALSE(0);
6737 }
6738
6739 if (!window->has_resize_func)
6740 {
6741 window->has_maximize_func = FALSE(0);
6742
6743 /* don't allow fullscreen if we can't resize, unless the size
6744 * is entire screen size (kind of broken, because we
6745 * actually fullscreen to xinerama head size not screen size)
6746 */
6747 if (window->size_hints.min_width == window->screen->rect.width &&
6748 window->size_hints.min_height == window->screen->rect.height)
6749 ; /* leave fullscreen available */
6750 else
6751 window->has_fullscreen_func = FALSE(0);
6752 }
6753
6754 /* We leave fullscreen windows decorated, just push the frame outside
6755 * the screen. This avoids flickering to unparent them.
6756 *
6757 * Note that setting has_resize_func = FALSE here must come after the
6758 * above code that may disable fullscreen, because if the window
6759 * is not resizable purely due to fullscreen, we don't want to
6760 * disable fullscreen mode.
6761 */
6762 if (window->fullscreen)
6763 {
6764 window->has_shade_func = FALSE(0);
6765 window->has_move_func = FALSE(0);
6766 window->has_resize_func = FALSE(0);
6767 window->has_maximize_func = FALSE(0);
6768 }
6769
6770 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
6771 "Window %s fullscreen = %d not resizable, maximizable = %d fullscreenable = %d min size %dx%d max size %dx%d\n",
6772 window->desc,
6773 window->fullscreen,
6774 window->has_maximize_func, window->has_fullscreen_func,
6775 window->size_hints.min_width,
6776 window->size_hints.min_height,
6777 window->size_hints.max_width,
6778 window->size_hints.max_height);
6779
6780 /* no shading if not decorated */
6781 if (!window->decorated || window->border_only)
6782 window->has_shade_func = FALSE(0);
6783
6784 window->skip_taskbar = FALSE(0);
6785 window->skip_pager = FALSE(0);
6786
6787 if (window->wm_state_skip_taskbar)
6788 window->skip_taskbar = TRUE(!(0));
6789
6790 if (window->wm_state_skip_pager)
6791 window->skip_pager = TRUE(!(0));
6792
6793 switch (window->type)
6794 {
6795 /* Force skip taskbar/pager on these window types */
6796 case META_WINDOW_DESKTOP:
6797 case META_WINDOW_DOCK:
6798 case META_WINDOW_TOOLBAR:
6799 case META_WINDOW_MENU:
6800 case META_WINDOW_UTILITY:
6801 case META_WINDOW_SPLASHSCREEN:
6802 window->skip_taskbar = TRUE(!(0));
6803 window->skip_pager = TRUE(!(0));
6804 break;
6805
6806 case META_WINDOW_DIALOG:
6807 case META_WINDOW_MODAL_DIALOG:
6808 /* only skip taskbar if we have a real transient parent */
6809 if (window->xtransient_for != None0L &&
6810 window->xtransient_for != window->screen->xroot)
6811 window->skip_taskbar = TRUE(!(0));
6812 break;
6813
6814 case META_WINDOW_NORMAL:
6815 break;
6816 }
6817
6818 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
6819 "Window %s decorated = %d border_only = %d has_close = %d has_minimize = %d has_maximize = %d has_move = %d has_shade = %d skip_taskbar = %d skip_pager = %d\n",
6820 window->desc,
6821 window->decorated,
6822 window->border_only,
6823 window->has_close_func,
6824 window->has_minimize_func,
6825 window->has_maximize_func,
6826 window->has_move_func,
6827 window->has_shade_func,
6828 window->skip_taskbar,
6829 window->skip_pager);
6830
6831 /* FIXME:
6832 * Lame workaround for recalc_window_features
6833 * being used overzealously. The fix is to
6834 * only recalc_window_features when something
6835 * has actually changed.
6836 */
6837 if (window->constructing ||
6838 old_has_close_func != window->has_close_func ||
6839 old_has_minimize_func != window->has_minimize_func ||
6840 old_has_move_func != window->has_move_func ||
6841 old_has_resize_func != window->has_resize_func ||
6842 old_has_shade_func != window->has_shade_func ||
6843 old_always_sticky != window->always_sticky)
6844 set_allowed_actions_hint (window);
6845
6846 /* FIXME perhaps should ensure if we don't have a shade func,
6847 * we aren't shaded, etc.
6848 */
6849}
6850
6851static void
6852menu_callback (MetaWindowMenu *menu,
6853 Display *xdisplay,
6854 Window client_xwindow,
6855 guint32 timestamp,
6856 MetaMenuOp op,
6857 int workspace_index,
6858 gpointer data)
6859{
6860 MetaDisplay *display;
6861 MetaWindow *window;
6862 MetaWorkspace *workspace;
6863
6864 display = meta_display_for_x_display (xdisplay);
6865 window = meta_display_lookup_x_window (display, client_xwindow);
6866 workspace = NULL((void*)0);
6867
6868 if (window != NULL((void*)0)) /* window can be NULL */
6869 {
6870 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Menu op %u on %s\n", op, window->desc);
6871
6872 switch (op)
6873 {
6874 case META_MENU_OP_NONE:
6875 /* nothing */
6876 break;
6877
6878 case META_MENU_OP_DELETE:
6879 meta_window_delete (window, timestamp);
6880 break;
6881
6882 case META_MENU_OP_MINIMIZE:
6883 meta_window_minimize (window);
6884 break;
6885
6886 case META_MENU_OP_UNMAXIMIZE:
6887 meta_window_unmaximize (window,
6888 META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL |
6889 META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL);
6890 break;
6891
6892 case META_MENU_OP_MAXIMIZE:
6893 meta_window_maximize (window,
6894 META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL |
6895 META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL);
6896 break;
6897
6898 case META_MENU_OP_UNSHADE:
6899 meta_window_unshade (window, timestamp);
6900 break;
6901
6902 case META_MENU_OP_SHADE:
6903 meta_window_shade (window, timestamp);
6904 break;
6905
6906 case META_MENU_OP_MOVE_LEFT:
6907 workspace = meta_workspace_get_neighbor (window->screen->active_workspace,
6908 META_MOTION_LEFT);
6909 break;
6910
6911 case META_MENU_OP_MOVE_RIGHT:
6912 workspace = meta_workspace_get_neighbor (window->screen->active_workspace,
6913 META_MOTION_RIGHT);
6914 break;
6915
6916 case META_MENU_OP_MOVE_UP:
6917 workspace = meta_workspace_get_neighbor (window->screen->active_workspace,
6918 META_MOTION_UP);
6919 break;
6920
6921 case META_MENU_OP_MOVE_DOWN:
6922 workspace = meta_workspace_get_neighbor (window->screen->active_workspace,
6923 META_MOTION_DOWN);
6924 break;
6925
6926 case META_MENU_OP_WORKSPACES:
6927 workspace = meta_screen_get_workspace_by_index (window->screen,
6928 workspace_index);
6929 break;
6930
6931 case META_MENU_OP_STICK:
6932 meta_window_stick (window);
6933 break;
6934
6935 case META_MENU_OP_UNSTICK:
6936 meta_window_unstick (window);
6937 break;
6938
6939 case META_MENU_OP_ABOVE:
6940 case META_MENU_OP_UNABOVE:
6941 if (!window->wm_state_above)
6942 meta_window_make_above (window);
6943 else
6944 meta_window_unmake_above (window);
6945 break;
6946
6947 case META_MENU_OP_MOVE:
6948 meta_window_begin_grab_op (window,
6949 META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_MOVING,
6950 TRUE(!(0)),
6951 timestamp);
6952 break;
6953
6954 case META_MENU_OP_RESIZE:
6955 meta_window_begin_grab_op (window,
6956 META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_UNKNOWN,
6957 TRUE(!(0)),
6958 timestamp);
6959 break;
6960
6961 case META_MENU_OP_RECOVER:
6962 meta_window_shove_titlebar_onscreen (window);
6963 break;
6964
6965 default:
6966 meta_warning (G_STRLOC"core/window.c" ":" "6966"": Unknown window op\n");
6967 break;
6968 }
6969
6970 if (workspace)
6971 {
6972 meta_window_change_workspace (window,
6973 workspace);
6974#if 0
6975 meta_workspace_activate (workspace);
6976 meta_window_raise (window);
6977#endif
6978 }
6979 }
6980 else
6981 {
6982 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Menu callback on nonexistent window\n");
6983 }
6984
6985 if (display->window_menu == menu)
6986 {
6987 display->window_menu = NULL((void*)0);
6988 display->window_with_menu = NULL((void*)0);
6989 }
6990
6991 meta_ui_window_menu_free (menu);
6992}
6993
6994void
6995meta_window_show_menu (MetaWindow *window,
6996 int root_x,
6997 int root_y,
6998 int button,
6999 guint32 timestamp)
7000{
7001 MetaMenuOp ops;
7002 MetaMenuOp insensitive;
7003 MetaWindowMenu *menu;
7004 MetaWorkspaceLayout layout;
7005 int n_workspaces;
7006 gboolean ltr;
7007
7008 if (window->display->window_menu)
7009 {
7010 meta_ui_window_menu_free (window->display->window_menu);
7011 window->display->window_menu = NULL((void*)0);
7012 window->display->window_with_menu = NULL((void*)0);
7013 }
7014
7015 ops = META_MENU_OP_NONE;
7016 insensitive = META_MENU_OP_NONE;
7017
7018 ops |= (META_MENU_OP_DELETE | META_MENU_OP_MINIMIZE | META_MENU_OP_MOVE | META_MENU_OP_RESIZE);
7019
7020 if (!meta_window_titlebar_is_onscreen (window) &&
7021 window->type != META_WINDOW_DOCK &&
7022 window->type != META_WINDOW_DESKTOP)
7023 ops |= META_MENU_OP_RECOVER;
7024
7025 n_workspaces = meta_screen_get_n_workspaces (window->screen);
7026
7027 if (n_workspaces > 1)
7028 ops |= META_MENU_OP_WORKSPACES;
7029
7030 meta_screen_calc_workspace_layout (window->screen,
7031 n_workspaces,
7032 meta_workspace_index ( window->screen->active_workspace),
7033 &layout);
7034
7035 if (!window->on_all_workspaces)
7036 {
7037 ltr = meta_ui_get_direction() == META_UI_DIRECTION_LTR;
7038
7039 if (layout.current_col > 0)
7040 ops |= ltr ? META_MENU_OP_MOVE_LEFT : META_MENU_OP_MOVE_RIGHT;
7041 if ((layout.current_col < layout.cols - 1) &&
7042 (layout.current_row * layout.cols + (layout.current_col + 1) < n_workspaces))
7043 ops |= ltr ? META_MENU_OP_MOVE_RIGHT : META_MENU_OP_MOVE_LEFT;
7044 if (layout.current_row > 0)
7045 ops |= META_MENU_OP_MOVE_UP;
7046 if ((layout.current_row < layout.rows - 1) &&
7047 ((layout.current_row + 1) * layout.cols + layout.current_col < n_workspaces))
7048 ops |= META_MENU_OP_MOVE_DOWN;
7049 }
7050
7051 meta_screen_free_workspace_layout (&layout);
7052
7053 if (META_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED (window)((window)->maximized_horizontally && (window)->
maximized_vertically))
7054 ops |= META_MENU_OP_UNMAXIMIZE;
7055 else
7056 ops |= META_MENU_OP_MAXIMIZE;
7057
7058#if 0
7059 if (window->shaded)
7060 ops |= META_MENU_OP_UNSHADE;
7061 else
7062 ops |= META_MENU_OP_SHADE;
7063#endif
7064
7065 ops |= META_MENU_OP_UNSTICK;
7066 ops |= META_MENU_OP_STICK;
7067
7068 if (window->wm_state_above)
7069 ops |= META_MENU_OP_UNABOVE;
7070 else
7071 ops |= META_MENU_OP_ABOVE;
7072
7073 if (!window->has_maximize_func)
7074 insensitive |= META_MENU_OP_UNMAXIMIZE | META_MENU_OP_MAXIMIZE;
7075
7076 if (!window->has_minimize_func)
7077 insensitive |= META_MENU_OP_MINIMIZE;
7078
7079 /*if (!window->has_close_func)
7080 insensitive |= META_MENU_OP_DELETE;*/
7081
7082 if (!window->has_shade_func)
7083 insensitive |= META_MENU_OP_SHADE | META_MENU_OP_UNSHADE;
7084
7085 if (!META_WINDOW_ALLOWS_MOVE (window)((window)->has_move_func && !(window)->fullscreen
))
7086 insensitive |= META_MENU_OP_MOVE;
7087
7088 if (!META_WINDOW_ALLOWS_RESIZE (window)(((window)->has_resize_func && !((window)->maximized_horizontally
&& (window)->maximized_vertically) && !(window
)->fullscreen && !(window)->shaded) && (
((window)->size_hints.min_width < (window)->size_hints
.max_width) || ((window)->size_hints.min_height < (window
)->size_hints.max_height))))
7089 insensitive |= META_MENU_OP_RESIZE;
7090
7091 if (window->always_sticky)
7092 insensitive |= META_MENU_OP_STICK | META_MENU_OP_UNSTICK | META_MENU_OP_WORKSPACES;
7093
7094 if ((window->type == META_WINDOW_DESKTOP) ||
7095 (window->type == META_WINDOW_DOCK) ||
7096 (window->type == META_WINDOW_SPLASHSCREEN))
7097 insensitive |= META_MENU_OP_ABOVE | META_MENU_OP_UNABOVE;
7098
7099 /* If all operations are disabled, just quit without showing the menu.
7100 * This is the case, for example, with META_WINDOW_DESKTOP windows.
7101 */
7102 if ((ops & ~insensitive) == 0)
7103 return;
7104
7105 menu =
7106 meta_ui_window_menu_new (window->screen->ui,
7107 window->xwindow,
7108 ops,
7109 insensitive,
7110 meta_window_get_net_wm_desktop (window),
7111 meta_screen_get_n_workspaces (window->screen),
7112 menu_callback,
7113 NULL((void*)0));
7114
7115 window->display->window_menu = menu;
7116 window->display->window_with_menu = window;
7117
7118 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Popping up window menu for %s\n", window->desc);
7119
7120 meta_ui_window_menu_popup (menu, root_x, root_y, button, timestamp);
7121}
7122
7123void
7124meta_window_shove_titlebar_onscreen (MetaWindow *window)
7125{
7126 MetaRectangle outer_rect;
7127 GList *onscreen_region;
7128 int horiz_amount, vert_amount;
7129 int newx, newy;
7130
7131 /* If there's no titlebar, don't bother */
7132 if (!window->frame)
7133 return;
7134
7135 /* Get the basic info we need */
7136 meta_window_get_outer_rect (window, &outer_rect);
7137 onscreen_region = window->screen->active_workspace->screen_region;
7138
7139 /* Extend the region (just in case the window is too big to fit on the
7140 * screen), then shove the window on screen, then return the region to
7141 * normal.
7142 */
7143 horiz_amount = outer_rect.width;
7144 vert_amount = outer_rect.height;
7145 meta_rectangle_expand_region (onscreen_region,
7146 horiz_amount,
7147 horiz_amount,
7148 0,
7149 vert_amount);
7150 meta_rectangle_shove_into_region(onscreen_region,
7151 FIXED_DIRECTION_X,
7152 &outer_rect);
7153 meta_rectangle_expand_region (onscreen_region,
7154 -horiz_amount,
7155 -horiz_amount,
7156 0,
7157 -vert_amount);
7158
7159 newx = outer_rect.x + window->frame->child_x;
7160 newy = outer_rect.y + window->frame->child_y;
7161 meta_window_move_resize (window,
7162 FALSE(0),
7163 newx,
7164 newy,
7165 window->rect.width,
7166 window->rect.height);
7167}
7168
7169gboolean
7170meta_window_titlebar_is_onscreen (MetaWindow *window)
7171{
7172 MetaRectangle titlebar_rect;
7173 GList *onscreen_region;
7174 gboolean is_onscreen;
7175
7176 const int min_height_needed = 8;
7177 const double min_width_percent = 0.5;
7178 const int min_width_absolute = 50;
7179
7180 /* Titlebar can't be offscreen if there is no titlebar... */
7181 if (!window->frame)
7182 return TRUE(!(0));
7183
7184 /* Get the rectangle corresponding to the titlebar */
7185 meta_window_get_outer_rect (window, &titlebar_rect);
7186 titlebar_rect.height = window->frame->child_y;
7187
7188 /* Run through the spanning rectangles for the screen and see if one of
7189 * them overlaps with the titlebar sufficiently to consider it onscreen.
7190 */
7191 is_onscreen = FALSE(0);
7192 onscreen_region = window->screen->active_workspace->screen_region;
7193 while (onscreen_region)
7194 {
7195 MetaRectangle *spanning_rect = onscreen_region->data;
7196 MetaRectangle overlap;
7197
7198 meta_rectangle_intersect (&titlebar_rect, spanning_rect, &overlap);
7199 if (overlap.height > MIN (titlebar_rect.height, min_height_needed)(((titlebar_rect.height) < (min_height_needed)) ? (titlebar_rect
.height) : (min_height_needed)) &&
7200 overlap.width > MIN ((int) (min_width_percent * (double) titlebar_rect.width),((((int) (min_width_percent * (double) titlebar_rect.width)) <
(min_width_absolute)) ? ((int) (min_width_percent * (double)
titlebar_rect.width)) : (min_width_absolute))
7201 min_width_absolute)((((int) (min_width_percent * (double) titlebar_rect.width)) <
(min_width_absolute)) ? ((int) (min_width_percent * (double)
titlebar_rect.width)) : (min_width_absolute)))
7202 {
7203 is_onscreen = TRUE(!(0));
7204 break;
7205 }
7206
7207 onscreen_region = onscreen_region->next;
7208 }
7209
7210 return is_onscreen;
7211}
7212
7213static double
7214time_diff (const gint64 first,
7215 const gint64 second)
7216{
7217 return (first - second) / 1000.0;
7218}
7219
7220static gboolean
7221check_moveresize_frequency (MetaWindow *window,
7222 gdouble *remaining)
7223{
7224 gint64 current_time;
7225 current_time = g_get_real_time ();
7226
7227#ifdef HAVE_XSYNC
7228 if (!window->disable_sync &&
7229 window->display->grab_sync_request_alarm != None0L)
7230 {
7231 if (window->sync_request_time != 0)
7232 {
7233 double elapsed =
7234 time_diff (current_time, window->sync_request_time);
7235
7236 if (elapsed < 1000.0)
7237 {
7238 /* We want to be sure that the timeout happens at
7239 * a time where elapsed will definitely be
7240 * greater than 1000, so we can disable sync
7241 */
7242 if (remaining)
7243 *remaining = 1000.0 - elapsed + 100;
7244
7245 return FALSE(0);
7246 }
7247 else
7248 {
7249 /* We have now waited for more than a second for the
7250 * application to respond to the sync request
7251 */
7252 window->disable_sync = TRUE(!(0));
7253 return TRUE(!(0));
7254 }
7255 }
7256 else
7257 {
7258 /* No outstanding sync requests. Go ahead and resize
7259 */
7260 return TRUE(!(0));
7261 }
7262 }
7263 else
7264#endif /* HAVE_XSYNC */
7265 {
7266 const double max_resizes_per_second = 25.0;
7267 const double ms_between_resizes = 1000.0 / max_resizes_per_second;
7268 double elapsed;
7269
7270 elapsed = time_diff (current_time, window->display->grab_last_moveresize_time);
7271
7272 if (elapsed >= 0.0 && elapsed < ms_between_resizes)
7273 {
7274 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_RESIZING,
7275 "Delaying move/resize as only %g of %g ms elapsed\n",
7276 elapsed, ms_between_resizes);
7277
7278 if (remaining)
7279 *remaining = (ms_between_resizes - elapsed);
7280
7281 return FALSE(0);
7282 }
7283
7284 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_RESIZING,
7285 " Checked moveresize freq, allowing move/resize now (%g of %g seconds elapsed)\n",
7286 elapsed / 1000.0, 1.0 / max_resizes_per_second);
7287
7288 return TRUE(!(0));
7289 }
7290}
7291
7292static gboolean
7293update_move_timeout (gpointer data)
7294{
7295 MetaWindow *window = data;
7296
7297 update_move (window,
7298 window->display->grab_last_user_action_was_snap != FALSE(0),
7299 window->display->grab_latest_motion_x,
7300 window->display->grab_latest_motion_y);
7301
7302 return FALSE(0);
7303}
7304
7305static void
7306update_move (MetaWindow *window,
7307 gboolean snap,
7308 int x,
7309 int y)
7310{
7311 int dx, dy;
7312 int new_x, new_y;
7313 MetaRectangle old;
7314 int shake_threshold;
7315 MetaDisplay *display = window->display;
7316
7317 display->grab_latest_motion_x = x;
7318 display->grab_latest_motion_y = y;
7319
7320 dx = x - display->grab_anchor_root_x;
7321 dy = y - display->grab_anchor_root_y;
7322
7323 new_x = display->grab_anchor_window_pos.x + dx;
7324 new_y = display->grab_anchor_window_pos.y + dy;
7325
7326 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("x,y = %d,%d anchor ptr %d,%d anchor pos %d,%d dx,dy %d,%d\n",
7327 x, y,
7328 display->grab_anchor_root_x,
7329 display->grab_anchor_root_y,
7330 display->grab_anchor_window_pos.x,
7331 display->grab_anchor_window_pos.y,
7332 dx, dy);
7333
7334 /* Don't bother doing anything if no move has been specified. (This
7335 * happens often, even in keyboard moving, due to the warping of the
7336 * pointer.
7337 */
7338 if (dx == 0 && dy == 0)
7339 return;
7340
7341 /* Originally for detaching maximized windows, but we use this
7342 * for the zones at the sides of the monitor where trigger tiling
7343 * because it's about the right size
7344 */
7345
7346#define DRAG_THRESHOLD_TO_SHAKE_THRESHOLD_FACTOR2 2
7347 shake_threshold = meta_ui_get_drag_threshold (window->screen->ui) *
7348 DRAG_THRESHOLD_TO_SHAKE_THRESHOLD_FACTOR2;
7349
7350 if (snap)
7351 {
7352 /* We don't want to tile while snapping. Also, clear any previous tile
7353 request. */
7354 window->tile_mode = META_TILE_NONE;
7355 window->tile_monitor_number = -1;
7356 window->tile_cycle = META_TILE_CYCLE_NONE;
7357 }
7358 else if (meta_prefs_get_allow_tiling () &&
7359 !META_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED (window)((window)->maximized_horizontally && (window)->
maximized_vertically) &&
7360 !META_WINDOW_TILED (window)(((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)) || ((window)->
tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT || (window
)->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT || (window)->tile_mode
== META_TILE_TOP_LEFT))))
7361 {
7362 const MetaXineramaScreenInfo *monitor;
7363 MetaRectangle work_area;
7364
7365 /* For side-by-side tiling we are interested in the inside vertical
7366 * edges of the work area of the monitor where the pointer is located,
7367 * and in the outside top edge for maximized tiling.
7368 *
7369 * For maximized tiling we use the outside edge instead of the
7370 * inside edge, because we don't want to force users to maximize
7371 * windows they are placing near the top of their screens.
7372 *
7373 * The "current" idea of meta_window_get_work_area_for_xinerama() and
7374 * meta_screen_get_current_xinerama() is slightly different: the former
7375 * refers to the monitor which contains the largest part of the window,
7376 * the latter to the one where the pointer is located.
7377 */
7378 monitor = meta_screen_get_current_xinerama (window->screen);
7379 meta_window_get_work_area_for_xinerama (window,
7380 monitor->number,
7381 &work_area);
7382
7383 /* Check if the cursor is in a position which triggers tiling
7384 * and set tile_mode accordingly.
7385 */
7386 MetaTileMode old_tile_mode = window->tile_mode;
7387 window->tile_mode = calculate_tiling_mode(x, y, window, monitor,
7388 work_area, shake_threshold);
7389
7390 if (window->tile_mode != META_TILE_NONE)
7391 window->tile_monitor_number = monitor->number;
7392
7393 /* Reset resized and cycle flags when changing tile mode */
7394 if (old_tile_mode != window->tile_mode)
7395 {
7396 window->tile_resized = FALSE(0);
7397 window->tile_cycle = META_TILE_CYCLE_NONE;
7398 }
7399 }
7400
7401 /* shake loose (unmaximize) maximized or tiled window if dragged beyond
7402 * the threshold in the Y direction. Tiled windows can also be pulled
7403 * loose via X motion.
7404 */
7405
7406 if ((META_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED (window)((window)->maximized_horizontally && (window)->
maximized_vertically) && ABS (dy)(((dy) < 0) ? -(dy) : (dy)) >= shake_threshold) ||
7407 (META_WINDOW_TILED (window)(((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)) || ((window)->
tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT || (window
)->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT || (window)->tile_mode
== META_TILE_TOP_LEFT))) && (MAX (ABS (dx), ABS (dy))((((((dx) < 0) ? -(dx) : (dx))) > ((((dy) < 0) ? -(dy
) : (dy)))) ? ((((dx) < 0) ? -(dx) : (dx))) : ((((dy) <
0) ? -(dy) : (dy)))) >= shake_threshold)))
7408 {
7409 double prop;
7410
7411 /* Shake loose, so that the window snaps back to maximized
7412 * when dragged near the top; do not snap back if the window
7413 * was tiled.
7414 */
7415 window->shaken_loose = META_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED (window)((window)->maximized_horizontally && (window)->
maximized_vertically);
7416 window->tile_mode = META_TILE_NONE;
7417 window->tile_cycle = META_TILE_CYCLE_NONE;
7418 window->tiled = FALSE(0);
7419
7420 /* move the unmaximized window to the cursor */
7421 prop =
7422 ((double)(x - display->grab_initial_window_pos.x)) /
7423 ((double)display->grab_initial_window_pos.width);
7424
7425 display->grab_initial_window_pos.x =
7426 x - (int) (prop * (double) window->saved_rect.width);
7427 display->grab_initial_window_pos.y = y;
7428
7429 if (window->frame)
7430 {
7431 display->grab_initial_window_pos.y += window->frame->child_y / 2;
7432 }
7433
7434 window->saved_rect.x = display->grab_initial_window_pos.x;
7435 window->saved_rect.y = display->grab_initial_window_pos.y;
7436 display->grab_anchor_root_x = x;
7437 display->grab_anchor_root_y = y;
7438
7439 meta_window_unmaximize (window,
7440 META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL |
7441 META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL);
7442
7443 return;
7444 }
7445 /* remaximize window on an other xinerama monitor if window has
7446 * been shaken loose or it is still maximized (then move straight)
7447 */
7448 else if (window->shaken_loose || META_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED (window)((window)->maximized_horizontally && (window)->
maximized_vertically))
7449 {
7450 const MetaXineramaScreenInfo *wxinerama;
7451 MetaRectangle work_area;
7452 int monitor;
7453
7454 wxinerama = meta_screen_get_xinerama_for_window (window->screen, window);
7455
7456 for (monitor = 0; monitor < window->screen->n_xinerama_infos; monitor++)
7457 {
7458 meta_window_get_work_area_for_xinerama (window, monitor, &work_area);
7459
7460 /* check if cursor is near the top of a xinerama work area */
7461 if (x >= work_area.x + shake_threshold &&
7462 x < (work_area.x + work_area.width - shake_threshold) &&
7463 y >= work_area.y &&
7464 y < (work_area.y + shake_threshold))
7465 {
7466 /* move the saved rect if window will become maximized on an
7467 * other monitor so user isn't surprised on a later unmaximize
7468 */
7469 if (wxinerama->number != monitor)
7470 {
7471 window->saved_rect.x = work_area.x;
7472 window->saved_rect.y = work_area.y;
7473
7474 if (window->frame)
7475 {
7476 window->saved_rect.x += window->frame->child_x;
7477 window->saved_rect.y += window->frame->child_y;
7478 }
7479
7480 window->user_rect.x = window->saved_rect.x;
7481 window->user_rect.y = window->saved_rect.y;
7482
7483 meta_window_unmaximize (window,
7484 META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL |
7485 META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL);
7486 }
7487
7488 display->grab_initial_window_pos = work_area;
7489 display->grab_anchor_root_x = x;
7490 display->grab_anchor_root_y = y;
7491 window->shaken_loose = FALSE(0);
7492
7493 window->tile_mode = META_TILE_NONE;
7494 window->tile_cycle = META_TILE_CYCLE_NONE;
7495
7496 meta_window_maximize (window,
7497 META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL |
7498 META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL);
7499
7500 return;
7501 }
7502 }
7503 }
7504
7505 /* Delay showing the tile preview slightly to make it more unlikely to
7506 * trigger it unwittingly, e.g. when shaking loose the window or moving
7507 * it to another monitor.
7508 */
7509
7510 meta_screen_tile_preview_update (window->screen,
7511 window->tile_mode != META_TILE_NONE);
7512
7513 if (display->grab_wireframe_active)
7514 old = display->grab_wireframe_rect;
7515 else
7516 meta_window_get_client_root_coords (window, &old);
7517
7518 /* Don't allow movement in the maximized directions or while tiled */
7519
7520 if (window->maximized_horizontally || META_WINDOW_TILED (window)(((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)) || ((window)->
tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT || (window
)->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT || (window)->tile_mode
== META_TILE_TOP_LEFT))))
7521 {
7522 new_x = old.x;
7523 }
7524
7525 if (window->maximized_vertically || META_WINDOW_CORNER_TILED(window)((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT || (window
)->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT || (window)->tile_mode
== META_TILE_TOP_LEFT)))
7526 {
7527 new_y = old.y;
7528 }
7529
7530 /* Do any edge resistance/snapping */
7531 meta_window_edge_resistance_for_move (window,
7532 old.x,
7533 old.y,
7534 &new_x,
7535 &new_y,
7536 update_move_timeout,
7537 snap,
