7538 FALSE(0));
7539
7540 if (display->compositor)
7541 {
7542 int root_x = new_x - display->grab_anchor_window_pos.x + display->grab_anchor_root_x;
7543 int root_y = new_y - display->grab_anchor_window_pos.y + display->grab_anchor_root_y;
7544
7545 meta_compositor_update_move (display->compositor,
7546 window, root_x, root_y);
7547 }
7548
7549 if (display->grab_wireframe_active)
7550 meta_window_update_wireframe (window, new_x, new_y,
7551 display->grab_wireframe_rect.width,
7552 display->grab_wireframe_rect.height);
7553 else
7554 meta_window_move (window, TRUE(!(0)), new_x, new_y);
7555}
7556
7557static MetaTileMode calculate_tiling_mode(int x,
7558 int y,
7559 MetaWindow *window,
7560 const MetaXineramaScreenInfo *monitor,
7561 MetaRectangle work_area,
7562 int shake_threshold)
7563{
7564 if (meta_window_can_tile (window) &&
7565 x >= monitor->rect.x
7566 && x < (work_area.x + shake_threshold))
7567 {
7568 if(y >= monitor->rect.y && y < work_area.y + shake_threshold)
7569 return META_TILE_TOP_LEFT;
7570 else if(y < monitor->rect.y + monitor->rect.height
7571 && y > work_area.y + work_area.height - shake_threshold)
7572 return META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT;
7573 else
7574 return META_TILE_LEFT;
7575 }
7576
7577 else if (meta_window_can_tile (window) &&
7578 x >= work_area.x + work_area.width - shake_threshold &&
7579 x < (monitor->rect.x + monitor->rect.width))
7580 {
7581 if(y >= monitor->rect.y && y < work_area.y + shake_threshold)
7582 return META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT;
7583 else if(y < monitor->rect.y + monitor->rect.height
7584 && y > work_area.y + work_area.height - shake_threshold)
7585 return META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT;
7586 else
7587 return META_TILE_RIGHT;
7588 }
7589 else if (meta_window_can_tile_maximized (window) &&
7590 y >= monitor->rect.y && y <= work_area.y &&
7591 meta_prefs_get_allow_top_tiling ())
7592 return META_TILE_MAXIMIZED;
7593 else
7594 return META_TILE_NONE;
7595
7596}
7597
7598static gboolean
7599update_resize_timeout (gpointer data)
7600{
7601 MetaWindow *window = data;
7602
7603 update_resize (window,
7604 window->display->grab_last_user_action_was_snap != FALSE(0),
7605 window->display->grab_latest_motion_x,
7606 window->display->grab_latest_motion_y,
7607 TRUE(!(0)));
7608 return FALSE(0);
7609}
7610
7611static void
7612update_resize (MetaWindow *window,
7613 gboolean snap,
7614 int x, int y,
7615 gboolean force)
7616{
7617 int dx, dy;
7618 int new_w, new_h;
7619 int gravity;
7620 MetaRectangle old;
7621 int new_x, new_y;
7622 double remaining;
7623
7624 window->display->grab_latest_motion_x = x;
7625 window->display->grab_latest_motion_y = y;
7626
7627 dx = x - window->display->grab_anchor_root_x;
7628 dy = y - window->display->grab_anchor_root_y;
7629
7630 new_w = window->display->grab_anchor_window_pos.width;
7631 new_h = window->display->grab_anchor_window_pos.height;
7632
7633 /* Don't bother doing anything if no move has been specified. (This
7634 * happens often, even in keyboard resizing, due to the warping of the
7635 * pointer.
7636 */
7637 if (dx == 0 && dy == 0)
7638 return;
7639
7640 /* FIXME this is only used in wireframe mode */
7641 new_x = window->display->grab_anchor_window_pos.x;
7642 new_y = window->display->grab_anchor_window_pos.y;
7643
7644 if (window->display->grab_op == META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_UNKNOWN)
7645 {
7646 if ((dx > 0) && (dy > 0))
7647 {
7648 window->display->grab_op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SE;
7649 meta_window_update_keyboard_resize (window, TRUE(!(0)));
7650 }
7651 else if ((dx < 0) && (dy > 0))
7652 {
7653 window->display->grab_op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SW;
7654 meta_window_update_keyboard_resize (window, TRUE(!(0)));
7655 }
7656 else if ((dx > 0) && (dy < 0))
7657 {
7658 window->display->grab_op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NE;
7659 meta_window_update_keyboard_resize (window, TRUE(!(0)));
7660 }
7661 else if ((dx < 0) && (dy < 0))
7662 {
7663 window->display->grab_op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NW;
7664 meta_window_update_keyboard_resize (window, TRUE(!(0)));
7665 }
7666 else if (dx < 0)
7667 {
7668 window->display->grab_op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_W;
7669 meta_window_update_keyboard_resize (window, TRUE(!(0)));
7670 }
7671 else if (dx > 0)
7672 {
7673 window->display->grab_op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_E;
7674 meta_window_update_keyboard_resize (window, TRUE(!(0)));
7675 }
7676 else if (dy > 0)
7677 {
7678 window->display->grab_op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_S;
7679 meta_window_update_keyboard_resize (window, TRUE(!(0)));
7680 }
7681 else if (dy < 0)
7682 {
7683 window->display->grab_op = META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_N;
7684 meta_window_update_keyboard_resize (window, TRUE(!(0)));
7685 }
7686 }
7687
7688 /* FIXME: This stupidity only needed because of wireframe mode and
7689 * the fact that wireframe isn't making use of
7690 * meta_rectangle_resize_with_gravity(). If we were to use that, we
7691 * could just increment new_w and new_h by dx and dy in all cases.
7692 */
7693 switch (window->display->grab_op)
7694 {
7695 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SE:
7696 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NE:
7697 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_E:
7698 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SE:
7699 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NE:
7700 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_E:
7701 new_w += dx;
7702 break;
7703
7704 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NW:
7705 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SW:
7706 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_W:
7707 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NW:
7708 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SW:
7709 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_W:
7710 new_w -= dx;
7711 new_x += dx;
7712 break;
7713
7714 default:
7715 break;
7716 }
7717
7718 switch (window->display->grab_op)
7719 {
7720 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SE:
7721 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_S:
7722 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SW:
7723 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SE:
7724 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_S:
7725 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SW:
7726 new_h += dy;
7727 break;
7728
7729 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_N:
7730 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NE:
7731 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NW:
7732 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_N:
7733 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NE:
7734 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NW:
7735 new_h -= dy;
7736 new_y += dy;
7737 break;
7738 default:
7739 break;
7740 }
7741
7742 if (!check_moveresize_frequency (window, &remaining) && !force)
7743 {
7744 /* we are ignoring an event here, so we schedule a
7745 * compensation event when we would otherwise not ignore
7746 * an event. Otherwise we can become stuck if the user never
7747 * generates another event.
7748 */
7749 if (!window->display->grab_resize_timeout_id)
7750 {
7751 window->display->grab_resize_timeout_id =
7752 g_timeout_add ((int)remaining, update_resize_timeout, window);
7753 }
7754
7755 return;
7756 }
7757
7758 /* If we get here, it means the client should have redrawn itself */
7759 if (window->display->compositor)
7760 meta_compositor_set_updates (window->display->compositor, window, TRUE(!(0)));
7761
7762 /* Remove any scheduled compensation events */
7763 if (window->display->grab_resize_timeout_id)
7764 {
7765 g_source_remove (window->display->grab_resize_timeout_id);
7766 window->display->grab_resize_timeout_id = 0;
7767 }
7768
7769 if (window->display->grab_wireframe_active)
7770 old = window->display->grab_wireframe_rect;
7771 else
7772 old = window->rect; /* Don't actually care about x,y */
7773
7774 /* One sided resizing ought to actually be one-sided, despite the fact that
7775 * aspect ratio windows don't interact nicely with the above stuff. So,
7776 * to avoid some nasty flicker, we enforce that.
7777 */
7778 switch (window->display->grab_op)
7779 {
7780 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_S:
7781 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_N:
7782 new_w = old.width;
7783 break;
7784
7785 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_E:
7786 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_W:
7787 new_h = old.height;
7788 break;
7789
7790 default:
7791 break;
7792 }
7793
7794 /* compute gravity of client during operation */
7795 gravity = meta_resize_gravity_from_grab_op (window->display->grab_op);
7796 g_assert (gravity >= 0)do { if (gravity >= 0) ; else g_assertion_message_expr ("marco"
, "core/window.c", 7796, ((const char*) (__func__)), "gravity >= 0"
); } while (0);
7797
7798 /* Do any edge resistance/snapping */
7799 meta_window_edge_resistance_for_resize (window,
7800 old.width,
7801 old.height,
7802 &new_w,
7803 &new_h,
7804 gravity,
7805 update_resize_timeout,
7806 snap,
7807 FALSE(0));
7808
7809 if (window->display->grab_wireframe_active)
7810 {
7811 if ((new_x + new_w <= new_x) || (new_y + new_h <= new_y))
7812 return;
7813
7814 /* FIXME This is crap. For example, the wireframe isn't
7815 * constrained in the way that a real resize would be. An
7816 * obvious elegant solution is to unmap the window during
7817 * wireframe, but still resize it; however, that probably
7818 * confuses broken clients that have problems with opaque
7819 * resize, they probably don't track their visibility.
7820 */
7821 meta_window_update_wireframe (window, new_x, new_y, new_w, new_h);
7822 }
7823 else
7824 {
7825 /* We don't need to update unless the specified width and height
7826 * are actually different from what we had before.
7827 */
7828 if (old.width != new_w || old.height != new_h)
7829 meta_window_resize_with_gravity (window, TRUE(!(0)), new_w, new_h, gravity);
7830 }
7831
7832 /* Store the latest resize time, if we actually resized. */
7833 if (window->rect.width != old.width || window->rect.height != old.height)
7834 window->display->grab_last_moveresize_time = g_get_real_time ();
7835}
7836
7837typedef struct
7838{
7839 const XEvent *current_event;
7840 int count;
7841 guint32 last_time;
7842} EventScannerData;
7843
7844static Boolint
7845find_last_time_predicate (Display *display,
7846 XEvent *xevent,
7847 XPointer arg)
7848{
7849 EventScannerData *esd = (void*) arg;
7850
7851 if (esd->current_event->type == xevent->type &&
7852 esd->current_event->xany.window == xevent->xany.window)
7853 {
7854 esd->count += 1;
7855 esd->last_time = xevent->xmotion.time;
7856 }
7857
7858 return False0;
7859}
7860
7861static gboolean
7862check_use_this_motion_notify (MetaWindow *window,
7863 XEvent *event)
7864{
7865 EventScannerData esd;
7866 XEvent useless;
7867
7868 /* This code is copied from Owen's GDK code. */
7869
7870 if (window->display->grab_motion_notify_time != 0)
7871 {
7872 /* == is really the right test, but I'm all for paranoia */
7873 if (window->display->grab_motion_notify_time <=
7874 event->xmotion.time)
7875 {
7876 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_RESIZING,
7877 "Arrived at event with time %u (waiting for %u), using it\n",
7878 (unsigned int)event->xmotion.time,
7879 window->display->grab_motion_notify_time);
7880
7881 window->display->grab_motion_notify_time = 0;
7882 return TRUE(!(0));
7883 }
7884 else
7885 return FALSE(0); /* haven't reached the saved timestamp yet */
7886 }
7887
7888 esd.current_event = event;
7889 esd.count = 0;
7890 esd.last_time = 0;
7891
7892 /* "useless" isn't filled in because the predicate never returns True */
7893 XCheckIfEvent (window->display->xdisplay,
7894 &useless,
7895 find_last_time_predicate,
7896 (XPointer) &esd);
7897
7898 if (esd.count > 0)
7899 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_RESIZING,
7900 "Will skip %d motion events and use the event with time %u\n",
7901 esd.count, (unsigned int) esd.last_time);
7902
7903 if (esd.last_time == 0)
7904 return TRUE(!(0));
7905 else
7906 {
7907 /* Save this timestamp, and ignore all motion notify
7908 * until we get to the one with this stamp.
7909 */
7910 window->display->grab_motion_notify_time = esd.last_time;
7911 return FALSE(0);
7912 }
7913}
7914
7915static void
7916update_tile_mode (MetaWindow *window)
7917{
7918 switch (window->tile_mode)
7919 {
7920 case META_TILE_LEFT:
7921 case META_TILE_RIGHT:
7922 if (!META_WINDOW_SIDE_TILED (window)((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)))
7923 window->tile_mode = META_TILE_NONE;
7924 break;
7925 }
7926}
7927
7928void
7929meta_window_handle_mouse_grab_op_event (MetaWindow *window,
7930 XEvent *event)
7931{
7932#ifdef HAVE_XSYNC
7933 if (event->type == (window->display->xsync_event_base + XSyncAlarmNotify1))
7934 {
7935 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_RESIZING,
7936 "Alarm event received last motion x = %d y = %d\n",
7937 window->display->grab_latest_motion_x,
7938 window->display->grab_latest_motion_y);
7939
7940 /* If sync was previously disabled, turn it back on and hope
7941 * the application has come to its senses (maybe it was just
7942 * busy with a pagefault or a long computation).
7943 */
7944 window->disable_sync = FALSE(0);
7945 window->sync_request_time = 0;
7946
7947 /* This means we are ready for another configure. */
7948 switch (window->display->grab_op)
7949 {
7950 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_E:
7951 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_W:
7952 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_S:
7953 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_N:
7954 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SE:
7955 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SW:
7956 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NE:
7957 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NW:
7958 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_S:
7959 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_N:
7960 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_W:
7961 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_E:
7962 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SE:
7963 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NE:
7964 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SW:
7965 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NW:
7966 /* no pointer round trip here, to keep in sync */
7967 update_resize (window,
7968 window->display->grab_last_user_action_was_snap != FALSE(0),
7969 window->display->grab_latest_motion_x,
7970 window->display->grab_latest_motion_y,
7971 TRUE(!(0)));
7972 break;
7973
7974 default:
7975 break;
7976 }
7977 }
7978#endif /* HAVE_XSYNC */
7979
7980 switch (event->type)
7981 {
7982 case ButtonRelease5:
7983 meta_display_check_threshold_reached (window->display,
7984 event->xbutton.x_root,
7985 event->xbutton.y_root);
7986 /* If the user was snap moving then ignore the button release
7987 * because they may have let go of shift before releasing the
7988 * mouse button and they almost certainly do not want a
7989 * non-snapped movement to occur from the button release.
7990 */
7991 if (!window->display->grab_last_user_action_was_snap)
7992 {
7993 if (meta_grab_op_is_moving (window->display->grab_op))
7994 {
7995 if (window->tile_mode == META_TILE_MAXIMIZED)
7996 {
7997 meta_window_maximize (window, META_MAXIMIZE_VERTICAL |
7998 META_MAXIMIZE_HORIZONTAL);
7999 window->tile_mode = META_TILE_NONE;
8000 }
8001 else if (window->tile_mode != META_TILE_NONE)
8002 {
8003 meta_window_tile (window);
8004 }
8005 else if (event->xbutton.root == window->screen->xroot)
8006 update_move (window, event->xbutton.state & ShiftMask(1<<0),
8007 event->xbutton.x_root, event->xbutton.y_root);
8008 }
8009 else if (meta_grab_op_is_resizing (window->display->grab_op))
8010 {
8011 if (event->xbutton.root == window->screen->xroot)
8012 update_resize (window,
8013 event->xbutton.state & ShiftMask(1<<0),
8014 event->xbutton.x_root,
8015 event->xbutton.y_root,
8016 TRUE(!(0)));
8017 if (window->display->compositor)
8018 meta_compositor_set_updates (window->display->compositor, window, TRUE(!(0)));
8019
8020 /* If a tiled window has been dragged free with a
8021 * mouse resize without snapping back to the tiled
8022 * state, it will end up with an inconsistent tile
8023 * mode on mouse release; cleaning the mode earlier
8024 * would break the ability to snap back to the tiled
8025 * state, so we wait until mouse release.
8026 */
8027 update_tile_mode (window);
8028 }
8029 }
8030
8031 meta_display_end_grab_op (window->display, event->xbutton.time);
8032 break;
8033
8034 case MotionNotify6:
8035 meta_display_check_threshold_reached (window->display,
8036 event->xmotion.x_root,
8037 event->xmotion.y_root);
8038 if (meta_grab_op_is_moving (window->display->grab_op))
8039 {
8040 if (event->xmotion.root == window->screen->xroot)
8041 {
8042 if (check_use_this_motion_notify (window,
8043 event))
8044 update_move (window,
8045 event->xmotion.state & ShiftMask(1<<0),
8046 event->xmotion.x_root,
8047 event->xmotion.y_root);
8048 }
8049 }
8050 else if (meta_grab_op_is_resizing (window->display->grab_op))
8051 {
8052 if (event->xmotion.root == window->screen->xroot)
8053 {
8054 if (check_use_this_motion_notify (window,
8055 event))
8056 update_resize (window,
8057 event->xmotion.state & ShiftMask(1<<0),
8058 event->xmotion.x_root,
8059 event->xmotion.y_root,
8060 FALSE(0));
8061 }
8062 }
8063 break;
8064
8065 default:
8066 break;
8067 }
8068}
8069
8070void
8071meta_window_set_gravity (MetaWindow *window,
8072 int gravity)
8073{
8074 XSetWindowAttributes attrs;
8075
8076 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Setting gravity of %s to %d\n", window->desc, gravity);
8077
8078 attrs.win_gravity = gravity;
8079
8080 meta_error_trap_push (window->display);
8081
8082 XChangeWindowAttributes (window->display->xdisplay,
8083 window->xwindow,
8084 CWWinGravity(1L<<5),
8085 &attrs);
8086
8087 meta_error_trap_pop (window->display, FALSE(0));
8088}
8089
8090static void
8091get_work_area_xinerama (MetaWindow *window,
8092 MetaRectangle *area,
8093 int which_xinerama)
8094{
8095 GList *tmp;
8096
8097 g_assert (which_xinerama >= 0)do { if (which_xinerama >= 0) ; else g_assertion_message_expr
("marco", "core/window.c", 8097, ((const char*) (__func__)),
"which_xinerama >= 0"); } while (0);
8098
8099 /* Initialize to the whole xinerama */
8100 *area = window->screen->xinerama_infos[which_xinerama].rect;
8101
8102 tmp = meta_window_get_workspaces (window);
8103 while (tmp != NULL((void*)0))
8104 {
8105 MetaRectangle workspace_work_area;
8106 meta_workspace_get_work_area_for_xinerama (tmp->data,
8107 which_xinerama,
8108 &workspace_work_area);
8109 meta_rectangle_intersect (area,
8110 &workspace_work_area,
8111 area);
8112 tmp = tmp->next;
8113 }
8114
8115 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WORKAREA,
8116 "Window %s xinerama %d has work area %d,%d %d x %d\n",
8117 window->desc, which_xinerama,
8118 area->x, area->y, area->width, area->height);
8119}
8120
8121void
8122meta_window_get_work_area_current_xinerama (MetaWindow *window,
8123 MetaRectangle *area)
8124{
8125 const MetaXineramaScreenInfo *xinerama = NULL((void*)0);
8126 xinerama = meta_screen_get_xinerama_for_window (window->screen,
8127 window);
8128
8129 meta_window_get_work_area_for_xinerama (window,
8130 xinerama->number,
8131 area);
8132}
8133
8134void
8135meta_window_get_work_area_for_xinerama (MetaWindow *window,
8136 int which_xinerama,
8137 MetaRectangle *area)
8138{
8139 g_return_if_fail (which_xinerama >= 0)do { if ((which_xinerama >= 0)) { } else { g_return_if_fail_warning
("marco", ((const char*) (__func__)), "which_xinerama >= 0"
); return; } } while (0);
8140
8141 get_work_area_xinerama (window,
8142 area,
8143 which_xinerama);
8144}
8145
8146void
8147meta_window_get_work_area_all_xineramas (MetaWindow *window,
8148 MetaRectangle *area)
8149{
8150 GList *tmp;
8151
8152 /* Initialize to the whole screen */
8153 *area = window->screen->rect;
8154
8155 tmp = meta_window_get_workspaces (window);
8156 while (tmp != NULL((void*)0))
8157 {
8158 MetaRectangle workspace_work_area;
8159 meta_workspace_get_work_area_all_xineramas (tmp->data,
8160 &workspace_work_area);
8161 meta_rectangle_intersect (area,
8162 &workspace_work_area,
8163 area);
8164 tmp = tmp->next;
8165 }
8166
8167 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WORKAREA,
8168 "Window %s has whole-screen work area %d,%d %d x %d\n",
8169 window->desc, area->x, area->y, area->width, area->height);
8170}
8171
8172void
8173meta_window_get_current_tile_area (MetaWindow *window,
8174 MetaRectangle *tile_area)
8175{
8176 int tile_monitor_number;
8177 int width;
8178 double tile_ratio;
8179
8180 g_return_if_fail (window->tile_mode != META_TILE_NONE)do { if ((window->tile_mode != META_TILE_NONE)) { } else {
g_return_if_fail_warning ("marco", ((const char*) (__func__)
), "window->tile_mode != META_TILE_NONE"); return; } } while
(0);
8181
8182 /* I don't know how to detect monitor configuration changes, so I have to take into account that
8183 * tile_monitor_number might be invalid. If this happens, I replace it with whatever monitor
8184 * the window is currently on. This is usually the correct monitor anyway, only in some special
8185 * cases is the real monitor number actually required (e.g. the window is being moved with the mouse but
8186 * is still mostly on the wrong monitor).
8187 */
8188 if (window->tile_monitor_number >= window->screen->n_xinerama_infos)
8189 {
8190 window->tile_monitor_number = meta_screen_get_xinerama_for_window (window->screen, window)->number;
8191 }
8192
8193 tile_monitor_number = window->tile_monitor_number;
8194 if (tile_monitor_number < 0)
8195 {
8196 meta_warning ("%s called with an invalid monitor number; using 0 instead\n", G_STRFUNC((const char*) (__func__)));
8197 tile_monitor_number = 0;
8198 }
8199
8200 meta_window_get_work_area_for_xinerama (window, tile_monitor_number, tile_area);
8201
8202 width = tile_area->width;
8203
8204 switch (window->tile_cycle)
8205 {
8206 case META_TILE_CYCLE_33:
8207 tile_ratio = 1 / 3.0;
8208 break;
8209 case META_TILE_CYCLE_25:
8210 tile_ratio = 1 / 4.0;
8211 break;
8212 case META_TILE_CYCLE_100:
8213 tile_ratio = 1 / 1.0;
8214 break;
8215 case META_TILE_CYCLE_75:
8216 tile_ratio = 3 / 4.0;
8217 break;
8218 case META_TILE_CYCLE_66:
8219 tile_ratio = 2 / 3.0;
8220 break;
8221 case META_TILE_CYCLE_50:
8222 case META_TILE_CYCLE_NONE:
8223 default:
8224 tile_ratio = 1 / 2.0;
8225 break;
8226 }
8227
8228 if (window->tile_mode != META_TILE_NONE &&
8229 window->tile_mode != META_TILE_MAXIMIZED)
8230 width = (int)(tile_area->width * tile_ratio);
8231
8232 if(window->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT ||
8233 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT ||
8234 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_LEFT ||
8235 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT)
8236 tile_area->height /= 2;
8237
8238 if (window->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT ||
8239 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_TOP_RIGHT ||
8240 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT)
8241 tile_area->x += tile_area->width - width;
8242
8243 if(window->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_LEFT ||
8244 window->tile_mode == META_TILE_BOTTOM_RIGHT)
8245 tile_area->y += tile_area->height;
8246
8247 tile_area->width = width;
8248}
8249
8250gboolean
8251meta_window_same_application (MetaWindow *window,
8252 MetaWindow *other_window)
8253{
8254 MetaGroup *group = meta_window_get_group (window);
8255 MetaGroup *other_group = meta_window_get_group (other_window);
8256
8257 return
8258 group!=NULL((void*)0) &&
8259 other_group!=NULL((void*)0) &&
8260 group==other_group;
8261}
8262
8263/* Generally meta_window_same_application() is a better idea
8264 * of "sameness", since it handles the case where multiple apps
8265 * want to look like the same app or the same app wants to look
8266 * like multiple apps, but in the case of workarounds for legacy
8267 * applications (which likely aren't setting the group properly
8268 * anyways), it may be desirable to check this as well.
8269 */
8270static gboolean
8271meta_window_same_client (MetaWindow *window,
8272 MetaWindow *other_window)
8273{
8274 int resource_mask = window->display->xdisplay->resource_mask;
8275
8276 return ((window->xwindow & ~resource_mask) ==
8277 (other_window->xwindow & ~resource_mask));
8278}
8279
8280void
8281meta_window_refresh_resize_popup (MetaWindow *window)
8282{
8283 if (window->display->grab_op == META_GRAB_OP_NONE)
8284 return;
8285
8286 if (window->display->grab_window != window)
8287 return;
8288
8289 /* We shouldn't ever get called when the wireframe is active
8290 * because that's handled by a different code path in effects.c
8291 */
8292 if (window->display->grab_wireframe_active)
8293 {
8294 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
8295 "refresh_resize_popup called when wireframe active\n");
8296 return;
8297 }
8298
8299 switch (window->display->grab_op)
8300 {
8301 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SE:
8302 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_S:
8303 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_SW:
8304 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_N:
8305 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NE:
8306 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_NW:
8307 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_W:
8308 case META_GRAB_OP_RESIZING_E:
8309 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_UNKNOWN:
8310 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_S:
8311 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_N:
8312 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_W:
8313 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_E:
8314 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SE:
8315 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NE:
8316 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SW:
8317 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NW:
8318 break;
8319
8320 default:
8321 /* Not resizing */
8322 return;
8323 }
8324
8325 if (window->display->grab_resize_popup == NULL((void*)0))
8326 {
8327 gint scale = gdk_window_get_scale_factor (gdk_get_default_root_window ());
8328 /* Display the resize popup only for windows that report an
8329 * increment hint that's larger than the scale factor. */
8330 if (window->size_hints.width_inc > scale ||
8331 window->size_hints.height_inc > scale)
8332 window->display->grab_resize_popup =
8333 meta_ui_resize_popup_new (window->display->xdisplay,
8334 window->screen->number);
8335 }
8336
8337 if (window->display->grab_resize_popup != NULL((void*)0))
8338 {
8339 MetaRectangle rect;
8340
8341 if (window->display->grab_wireframe_active)
8342 rect = window->display->grab_wireframe_rect;
8343 else
8344 meta_window_get_client_root_coords (window, &rect);
8345
8346 meta_ui_resize_popup_set (window->display->grab_resize_popup,
8347 rect,
8348 window->size_hints.base_width,
8349 window->size_hints.base_height,
8350 window->size_hints.width_inc,
8351 window->size_hints.height_inc);
8352
8353 meta_ui_resize_popup_set_showing (window->display->grab_resize_popup,
8354 TRUE(!(0)));
8355 }
8356}
8357
8358void
8359meta_window_foreach_transient (MetaWindow *window,
8360 MetaWindowForeachFunc func,
8361 void *data)
8362{
8363 GSList *windows;
8364 GSList *tmp;
8365
8366 windows = meta_display_list_windows (window->display);
8367
8368 tmp = windows;
8369 while (tmp != NULL((void*)0))
8370 {
8371 MetaWindow *transient = tmp->data;
8372
8373 if (meta_window_is_ancestor_of_transient (window, transient))
8374 {
8375 if (!(* func) (transient, data))
8376 break;
8377 }
8378
8379 tmp = tmp->next;
8380 }
8381
8382 g_slist_free (windows);
8383}
8384
8385void
8386meta_window_foreach_ancestor (MetaWindow *window,
8387 MetaWindowForeachFunc func,
8388 void *data)
8389{
8390 MetaWindow *w;
8391 MetaWindow *tortoise;
8392
8393 w = window;
8394 tortoise = window;
8395 while (TRUE(!(0)))
8396 {
8397 if (w->xtransient_for == None0L ||
8398 w->transient_parent_is_root_window)
8399 break;
8400
8401 w = meta_display_lookup_x_window (w->display, w->xtransient_for);
8402
8403 if (w == NULL((void*)0) || w == tortoise)
8404 break;
8405
8406 if (!(* func) (w, data))
8407 break;
8408
8409 if (w->xtransient_for == None0L ||
8410 w->transient_parent_is_root_window)
8411 break;
8412
8413 w = meta_display_lookup_x_window (w->display, w->xtransient_for);
8414
8415 if (w == NULL((void*)0) || w == tortoise)
8416 break;
8417
8418 if (!(* func) (w, data))
8419 break;
8420
8421 tortoise = meta_display_lookup_x_window (tortoise->display,
8422 tortoise->xtransient_for);
8423
8424 /* "w" should have already covered all ground covered by the
8425 * tortoise, so the following must hold.
8426 */
8427 g_assert (tortoise != NULL)do { if (tortoise != ((void*)0)) ; else g_assertion_message_expr
("marco", "core/window.c", 8427, ((const char*) (__func__)),
"tortoise != NULL"); } while (0);
8428 g_assert (tortoise->xtransient_for != None)do { if (tortoise->xtransient_for != 0L) ; else g_assertion_message_expr
("marco", "core/window.c", 8428, ((const char*) (__func__)),
"tortoise->xtransient_for != None"); } while (0);
8429 g_assert (!tortoise->transient_parent_is_root_window)do { if (!tortoise->transient_parent_is_root_window) ; else
g_assertion_message_expr ("marco", "core/window.c", 8429, ((
const char*) (__func__)), "!tortoise->transient_parent_is_root_window"
); } while (0);
8430 }
8431}
8432
8433typedef struct
8434{
8435 MetaWindow *ancestor;
8436 gboolean found;
8437} FindAncestorData;
8438
8439static gboolean
8440find_ancestor_func (MetaWindow *window,
8441 void *data)
8442{
8443 FindAncestorData *d = data;
8444
8445 if (window == d->ancestor)
8446 {
8447 d->found = TRUE(!(0));
8448 return FALSE(0);
8449 }
8450
8451 return TRUE(!(0));
8452}
8453
8454gboolean
8455meta_window_is_ancestor_of_transient (MetaWindow *window,
8456 MetaWindow *transient)
8457{
8458 FindAncestorData d;
8459
8460 d.ancestor = window;
8461 d.found = FALSE(0);
8462
8463 meta_window_foreach_ancestor (transient, find_ancestor_func, &d);
8464
8465 return d.found;
8466}
8467
8468/* Warp pointer to location appropriate for grab,
8469 * return root coordinates where pointer ended up.
8470 */
8471static gboolean
8472warp_grab_pointer (MetaWindow *window,
8473 MetaGrabOp grab_op,
8474 int *x,
8475 int *y)
8476{
8477 MetaRectangle rect;
8478 MetaDisplay *display;
8479
8480 display = window->display;
8481
8482 /* We may not have done begin_grab_op yet, i.e. may not be in a grab
8483 */
8484
8485 if (window == display->grab_window && display->grab_wireframe_active)
8486 {
8487 meta_window_get_xor_rect (window, &display->grab_wireframe_rect, &rect);
8488 }
8489 else
8490 {
8491 meta_window_get_outer_rect (window, &rect);
8492 }
8493
8494 switch (grab_op)
8495 {
8496 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_MOVING:
8497 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_UNKNOWN:
8498 *x = rect.width / 2;
8499 *y = rect.height / 2;
8500 break;
8501
8502 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_S:
8503 *x = rect.width / 2;
8504 *y = rect.height - 1;
8505 break;
8506
8507 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_N:
8508 *x = rect.width / 2;
8509 *y = 0;
8510 break;
8511
8512 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_W:
8513 *x = 0;
8514 *y = rect.height / 2;
8515 break;
8516
8517 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_E:
8518 *x = rect.width - 1;
8519 *y = rect.height / 2;
8520 break;
8521
8522 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SE:
8523 *x = rect.width - 1;
8524 *y = rect.height - 1;
8525 break;
8526
8527 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NE:
8528 *x = rect.width - 1;
8529 *y = 0;
8530 break;
8531
8532 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_SW:
8533 *x = 0;
8534 *y = rect.height - 1;
8535 break;
8536
8537 case META_GRAB_OP_KEYBOARD_RESIZING_NW:
8538 *x = 0;
8539 *y = 0;
8540 break;
8541
8542 default:
8543 return FALSE(0);
8544 }
8545
8546 *x += rect.x;
8547 *y += rect.y;
8548
8549 /* Avoid weird bouncing at the screen edge; see bug 154706 */
8550 *x = CLAMP (*x, 0, window->screen->rect.width-1)(((*x) > (window->screen->rect.width-1)) ? (window->
screen->rect.width-1) : (((*x) < (0)) ? (0) : (*x)));
8551 *y = CLAMP (*y, 0, window->screen->rect.height-1)(((*y) > (window->screen->rect.height-1)) ? (window->
screen->rect.height-1) : (((*y) < (0)) ? (0) : (*y)));
8552
8553 meta_error_trap_push (display);
8554
8555 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
8556 "Warping pointer to %d,%d with window at %d,%d\n",
8557 *x, *y, rect.x, rect.y);
8558
8559 /* Need to update the grab positions so that the MotionNotify and other
8560 * events generated by the XWarpPointer() call below don't cause complete
8561 * funkiness. See bug 124582 and bug 122670.
8562 */
8563 display->grab_anchor_root_x = *x;
8564 display->grab_anchor_root_y = *y;
8565 display->grab_latest_motion_x = *x;
8566 display->grab_latest_motion_y = *y;
8567 if (display->grab_wireframe_active)
8568 display->grab_anchor_window_pos = display->grab_wireframe_rect;
8569 else
8570 meta_window_get_client_root_coords (window,
8571 &display->grab_anchor_window_pos);
8572
8573 XWarpPointer (display->xdisplay,
8574 None0L,
8575 window->screen->xroot,
8576 0, 0, 0, 0,
8577 *x, *y);
8578
8579 if (meta_error_trap_pop_with_return (display, FALSE(0)) != Success0)
8580 {
8581 meta_verbosemeta_verbose_real ("Failed to warp pointer for window %s\n",
8582 window->desc);
8583 return FALSE(0);
8584 }
8585
8586 return TRUE(!(0));
8587}
8588
8589void
8590meta_window_begin_grab_op (MetaWindow *window,
8591 MetaGrabOp op,
8592 gboolean frame_action,
8593 guint32 timestamp)
8594{
8595 int x, y;
8596
8597 warp_grab_pointer (window,
8598 op, &x, &y);
8599
8600 meta_display_begin_grab_op (window->display,
8601 window->screen,
8602 window,
8603 op,
8604 FALSE(0),
8605 frame_action,
8606 0 /* button */,
8607 0,
8608 timestamp,
8609 x, y);
8610}
8611
8612void
8613meta_window_update_keyboard_resize (MetaWindow *window,
8614 gboolean update_cursor)
8615{
8616 int x, y;
8617
8618 warp_grab_pointer (window,
8619 window->display->grab_op,
8620 &x, &y);
8621
8622 if (update_cursor)
8623 {
8624 guint32 timestamp;
8625 /* FIXME: Using CurrentTime is really bad mojo */
8626 timestamp = CurrentTime0L;
8627 meta_display_set_grab_op_cursor (window->display,
8628 NULL((void*)0),
8629 window->display->grab_op,
8630 TRUE(!(0)),
8631 window->display->grab_xwindow,
8632 timestamp);
8633 }
8634}
8635
8636void
8637meta_window_update_keyboard_move (MetaWindow *window)
8638{
8639 int x, y;
8640
8641 warp_grab_pointer (window,
8642 window->display->grab_op,
8643 &x, &y);
8644}
8645
8646void
8647meta_window_update_layer (MetaWindow *window)
8648{
8649 MetaGroup *group;
8650
8651 meta_stack_freeze (window->screen->stack);
8652 group = meta_window_get_group (window);
8653 if (group)
8654 meta_group_update_layers (group);
8655 else
8656 meta_stack_update_layer (window->screen->stack, window);
8657 meta_stack_thaw (window->screen->stack);
8658}
8659
8660/* ensure_mru_position_after ensures that window appears after
8661 * below_this_one in the active_workspace's mru_list (i.e. it treats
8662 * window as having been less recently used than below_this_one)
8663 */
8664static void
8665ensure_mru_position_after (MetaWindow *window,
8666 MetaWindow *after_this_one)
8667{
8668 /* This is sort of slow since it runs through the entire list more
8669 * than once (especially considering the fact that we expect the
8670 * windows of interest to be the first two elements in the list),
8671 * but it doesn't matter while we're only using it on new window
8672 * map.
8673 */
8674
8675 GList* active_mru_list;
8676 GList* window_position;
8677 GList* after_this_one_position;
8678
8679 active_mru_list = window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list;
8680 window_position = g_list_find (active_mru_list, window);
8681 after_this_one_position = g_list_find (active_mru_list, after_this_one);
8682
8683 /* after_this_one_position is NULL when we switch workspaces, but in
8684 * that case we don't need to do any MRU shuffling so we can simply
8685 * return.
8686 */
8687 if (after_this_one_position == NULL((void*)0))
8688 return;
8689
8690 if (g_list_length (window_position) > g_list_length (after_this_one_position))
8691 {
8692 window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list =
8693 g_list_delete_link (window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list,
8694 window_position);
8695
8696 window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list =
8697 g_list_insert_before (window->screen->active_workspace->mru_list,
8698 after_this_one_position->next,
8699 window);
8700 }
8701}
8702
8703void
8704meta_window_stack_just_below (MetaWindow *window,
8705 MetaWindow *below_this_one)
8706{
8707 g_return_if_fail (window != NULL)do { if ((window != ((void*)0))) { } else { g_return_if_fail_warning
("marco", ((const char*) (__func__)), "window != NULL"); return
; } } while (0);
8708 g_return_if_fail (below_this_one != NULL)do { if ((below_this_one != ((void*)0))) { } else { g_return_if_fail_warning
("marco", ((const char*) (__func__)), "below_this_one != NULL"
); return; } } while (0);
8709
8710 if (window->stack_position > below_this_one->stack_position)
8711 {
8712 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_STACK,
8713 "Setting stack position of window %s to %d (making it below window %s).\n",
8714 window->desc,
8715 below_this_one->stack_position,
8716 below_this_one->desc);
8717 meta_window_set_stack_position (window, below_this_one->stack_position);
8718 }
8719 else
8720 {
8721 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_STACK,
8722 "Window %s was already below window %s.\n",
8723 window->desc, below_this_one->desc);
8724 }
8725}
8726
8727void
8728meta_window_set_user_time (MetaWindow *window,
8729 guint32 timestamp)
8730{
8731 /* FIXME: If Soeren's suggestion in bug 151984 is implemented, it will allow
8732 * us to sanity check the timestamp here and ensure it doesn't correspond to
8733 * a future time.
8734 */
8735
8736 /* Only update the time if this timestamp is newer... */
8737 if (window->net_wm_user_time_set &&
8738 XSERVER_TIME_IS_BEFORE (timestamp, window->net_wm_user_time)( (timestamp) == 0 || (( (( (timestamp) < (window->net_wm_user_time
) ) && ( (window->net_wm_user_time) - (timestamp) <
((guint32)-1)/2 )) || (( (timestamp) > (window->net_wm_user_time
) ) && ( (timestamp) - (window->net_wm_user_time) >
((guint32)-1)/2 )) ) && (window->net_wm_user_time
) != 0) ))
8739 {
8740 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_STARTUP,
8741 "Window %s _NET_WM_USER_TIME not updated to %u, because it "
8742 "is less than %u\n",
8743 window->desc, timestamp, window->net_wm_user_time);
8744 }
8745 else
8746 {
8747 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_STARTUP,
8748 "Window %s has _NET_WM_USER_TIME of %u\n",
8749 window->desc, timestamp);
8750 window->net_wm_user_time_set = TRUE(!(0));
8751 window->net_wm_user_time = timestamp;
8752 if (XSERVER_TIME_IS_BEFORE (window->display->last_user_time, timestamp)( (window->display->last_user_time) == 0 || (( (( (window
->display->last_user_time) < (timestamp) ) &&
( (timestamp) - (window->display->last_user_time) <
((guint32)-1)/2 )) || (( (window->display->last_user_time
) > (timestamp) ) && ( (window->display->last_user_time
) - (timestamp) > ((guint32)-1)/2 )) ) && (timestamp
) != 0) ))
8753 window->display->last_user_time = timestamp;
8754
8755 /* If this is a terminal, user interaction with it means the user likely
8756 * doesn't want to have focus transferred for now due to new windows.
8757 */
8758 if (meta_prefs_get_focus_new_windows () ==
8759 META_FOCUS_NEW_WINDOWS_STRICT &&
8760 __window_is_terminal (window))
8761 window->display->allow_terminal_deactivation = FALSE(0);
8762 }
8763}
8764
8765/* Sets the demands_attention hint on a window, but only
8766 * if it's at least partially obscured (see #305882).
8767 */
8768void
8769meta_window_set_demands_attention (MetaWindow *window)
8770{
8771 MetaRectangle candidate_rect, other_rect;
8772 GList *stack = window->screen->stack->sorted;
8773 MetaWindow *other_window;
8774 gboolean obscured = FALSE(0);
8775
8776 MetaWorkspace *workspace = window->screen->active_workspace;
8777 if (workspace!=window->workspace)
8778 {
8779 /* windows on other workspaces are necessarily obscured */
8780 obscured = TRUE(!(0));
8781 }
8782 else if (window->minimized)
8783 {
8784 obscured = TRUE(!(0));
8785 }
8786 else
8787 {
8788 meta_window_get_outer_rect (window, &candidate_rect);
8789
8790 /* The stack is sorted with the top windows first. */
8791
8792 while (stack != NULL((void*)0) && stack->data != window)
8793 {
8794 other_window = stack->data;
8795 stack = stack->next;
8796
8797 if (other_window->on_all_workspaces ||
8798 window->on_all_workspaces ||
8799 other_window->workspace == window->workspace)
8800 {
8801 meta_window_get_outer_rect (other_window, &other_rect);
8802
8803 if (meta_rectangle_overlap (&candidate_rect, &other_rect))
8804 {
8805 obscured = TRUE(!(0));
8806 break;
8807 }
8808 }
8809 }
8810 }
8811
8812 if (obscured)
8813 {
8814 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
8815 "Marking %s as needing attention\n",
8816 window->desc);
8817
8818 window->wm_state_demands_attention = TRUE(!(0));
8819 set_net_wm_state (window);
8820 }
8821 else
8822 {
8823 /* If the window's in full view, there's no point setting the flag. */
8824
8825 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
8826 "Not marking %s as needing attention because "
8827 "it's in full view\n",
8828 window->desc);
8829 }
8830}
8831
8832void
8833meta_window_unset_demands_attention (MetaWindow *window)
8834{
8835 meta_topicmeta_topic_real (META_DEBUG_WINDOW_OPS,
8836 "Marking %s as not needing attention\n", window->desc);
8837
8838 window->wm_state_demands_attention = FALSE(0);
8839 set_net_wm_state (window);
8840}
8841
8842MetaFrame *
8843meta_window_get_frame (MetaWindow *window)
8844{
8845 return window->frame;
8846}
8847
8848static gboolean
8849transient_has_focus (MetaWindow *window,
8850 void *data)
8851{
8852 if (window->type == META_WINDOW_MODAL_DIALOG && meta_window_appears_focused (window))
8853 *((gboolean *)data) = TRUE(!(0));
8854
8855 return FALSE(0);
8856}
8857
8858gboolean
8859meta_window_appears_focused (MetaWindow *window)
8860{
8861 if (!window->has_focus && meta_prefs_get_attach_modal_dialogs ())
8862 {
8863 gboolean focus = FALSE(0);
8864 meta_window_foreach_transient (window, transient_has_focus, &focus);
8865 return focus;
8866 }
8867
8868 if (window->has_focus)
8869 return TRUE(!(0));
8870
8871 if (window->type == META_WINDOW_DOCK ||
8872 window->type == META_WINDOW_SPLASHSCREEN)
8873 return TRUE(!(0));
8874
8875 return FALSE(0);
8876}
8877
8878gboolean
8879meta_window_has_focus (MetaWindow *window)
8880{
8881 return window->has_focus;
8882}
8883
8884gboolean
8885meta_window_is_shaded (MetaWindow *window)
8886{
8887 return window->shaded;
8888}
8889
8890MetaRectangle *
8891meta_window_get_rect (MetaWindow *window)
8892{
8893 return &window->rect;
8894}
8895
8896MetaScreen *
8897meta_window_get_screen (MetaWindow *window)
8898{
8899 return window->screen;
8900}
8901
8902MetaDisplay *
8903meta_window_get_display (MetaWindow *window)
8904{
8905 return window->display;
8906}
8907
8908Window
8909meta_window_get_xwindow (MetaWindow *window)
8910{
8911 return window->xwindow;
8912}
8913
8914/**
8915 * meta_window_get_transient_for:
8916 * @window: a #MetaWindow
8917 *
8918 * Returns the #MetaWindow for the window that is pointed to by the
8919 * WM_TRANSIENT_FOR hint on this window (see XGetTransientForHint()
8920 * or XSetTransientForHint()). Marco keeps transient windows above their
8921 * parents. A typical usage of this hint is for a dialog that wants to stay
8922 * above its associated window.
8923 *
8924 * Return value: (transfer none): the window this window is transient for, or
8925 * %NULL if the WM_TRANSIENT_FOR hint is unset or does not point to a toplevel
8926 * window that Marco knows about.
8927 */
8928MetaWindow *
8929meta_window_get_transient_for (MetaWindow *window)
8930{
8931 if (window->xtransient_for)
8932 return meta_display_lookup_x_window (window->display, window->xtransient_for);
8933 else
8934 return NULL((void*)0);
8935}
8936
8937gboolean
8938meta_window_is_maximized (MetaWindow *window)
8939{
8940 return META_WINDOW_MAXIMIZED (window)((window)->maximized_horizontally && (window)->
maximized_vertically);
8941}
8942
8943gboolean
8944meta_window_is_tiled_left (MetaWindow *window)
8945{
8946 return META_WINDOW_TILED_LEFT (window)(((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)) && (window
)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT);
8947}
8948
8949gboolean
8950meta_window_is_tiled_right (MetaWindow *window)
8951{
8952 return META_WINDOW_TILED_RIGHT (window)(((window)->tiled && ((window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_LEFT
|| (window)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT)) && (window
)->tile_mode == META_TILE_RIGHT);
8953}
8954
8955/**
8956 * meta_window_is_client_decorated:
8957 *
8958 * Check if if the window has decorations drawn by the client.
8959 * (window->decorated refers only to whether we should add decorations)
8960 */
8961gboolean
8962meta_window_is_client_decorated (MetaWindow *window)
8963{
8964 /* Currently the implementation here is hackish -
8965 * has_custom_frame_extents() is set if _GTK_FRAME_EXTENTS is set
8966 * to any value even 0. GTK+ always sets _GTK_FRAME_EXTENTS for
8967 * client-side-decorated window, even if the value is 0 because
8968 * the window is maxized and has no invisible borders or shadows.
8969 */
8970 return window->has_custom_frame_extents;
8971}
8972
8973/**
8974 * meta_window_get_frame_bounds:
8975 *
8976 * Gets a region representing the outer bounds of the window's frame.
8977 *
8978 * Return value: (transfer none) (allow-none): a #cairo_region_t
8979 * holding the outer bounds of the window, or %NULL if the window
8980 * doesn't have a frame.
8981 */
8982cairo_region_t *
8983meta_window_get_frame_bounds (MetaWindow *window)
8984{
8985 if (!window->frame_bounds)
8986 {
8987 if (window->frame)
8988 window->frame_bounds = meta_frame_get_frame_bounds (window->frame);
8989 }
8990
8991 return window->frame_bounds;
8992}
8993
8994static void
8995meta_window_finalize (GObject *object)
8996{
8997 MetaWindow *window;
8998
8999 window = META_WINDOW (object);
9000
9001 g_clear_object (&window->icon)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *((&window->icon)) == sizeof
(gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__ (((
&window->icon))) _pp = ((&window->icon)); __typeof__
(*((&window->icon))) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)0); if
(_ptr) (g_object_unref) (_ptr); } while (0);
9002 g_clear_object (&window->mini_icon)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *((&window->mini_icon)) ==
sizeof (gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__
(((&window->mini_icon))) _pp = ((&window->mini_icon
)); __typeof__ (*((&window->mini_icon))) _ptr = *_pp; *
_pp = ((void*)0); if (_ptr) (g_object_unref) (_ptr); } while (
0);
9003
9004 g_clear_pointer (&window->frame_bounds, cairo_region_destroy)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->frame_bounds) ==
sizeof (gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__
((&window->frame_bounds)) _pp = (&window->frame_bounds
); __typeof__ (*(&window->frame_bounds)) _ptr = *_pp; *
_pp = ((void*)0); if (_ptr) (cairo_region_destroy) (_ptr); } while
(0);
9005
9006 meta_icon_cache_free (&window->icon_cache);
9007
9008 g_clear_pointer (&window->sm_client_id, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->sm_client_id) ==
sizeof (gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__
((&window->sm_client_id)) _pp = (&window->sm_client_id
); __typeof__ (*(&window->sm_client_id)) _ptr = *_pp; *
_pp = ((void*)0); if (_ptr) (g_free) (_ptr); } while (0);
9009 g_clear_pointer (&window->wm_client_machine, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->wm_client_machine
) == sizeof (gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__
((&window->wm_client_machine)) _pp = (&window->
wm_client_machine); __typeof__ (*(&window->wm_client_machine
)) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)0); if (_ptr) (g_free) (_ptr);
} while (0);
9010 g_clear_pointer (&window->startup_id, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->startup_id) == sizeof
(gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__ ((&
window->startup_id)) _pp = (&window->startup_id); __typeof__
(*(&window->startup_id)) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)
0); if (_ptr) (g_free) (_ptr); } while (0);
9011 g_clear_pointer (&window->role, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->role) == sizeof
(gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__ ((&
window->role)) _pp = (&window->role); __typeof__ (*
(&window->role)) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)0); if (_ptr
) (g_free) (_ptr); } while (0);
9012 g_clear_pointer (&window->res_class, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->res_class) == sizeof
(gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__ ((&
window->res_class)) _pp = (&window->res_class); __typeof__
(*(&window->res_class)) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)0
); if (_ptr) (g_free) (_ptr); } while (0);
9013 g_clear_pointer (&window->res_name, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->res_name) == sizeof
(gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__ ((&
window->res_name)) _pp = (&window->res_name); __typeof__
(*(&window->res_name)) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)0)
; if (_ptr) (g_free) (_ptr); } while (0);
9014 g_clear_pointer (&window->title, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->title) == sizeof
(gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__ ((&
window->title)) _pp = (&window->title); __typeof__ (
*(&window->title)) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)0); if (
_ptr) (g_free) (_ptr); } while (0);
9015 g_clear_pointer (&window->icon_name, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->icon_name) == sizeof
(gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__ ((&
window->icon_name)) _pp = (&window->icon_name); __typeof__
(*(&window->icon_name)) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)0
); if (_ptr) (g_free) (_ptr); } while (0);
9016 g_clear_pointer (&window->desc, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->desc) == sizeof
(gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__ ((&
window->desc)) _pp = (&window->desc); __typeof__ (*
(&window->desc)) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)0); if (_ptr
) (g_free) (_ptr); } while (0);
9017 g_clear_pointer (&window->gtk_theme_variant, g_free)do { _Static_assert (sizeof *(&window->gtk_theme_variant
) == sizeof (gpointer), "Expression evaluates to false"); __typeof__

gtk_theme_variant); __typeof__ (*(&window->gtk_theme_variant
)) _ptr = *_pp; *_pp = ((void*)0); if (_ptr) (g_free) (_ptr);
} while (0);
9018
9019 G_OBJECT_CLASS (meta_window_parent_class)((((GObjectClass*) (void *) g_type_check_class_cast ((GTypeClass
*) ((meta_window_parent_class)), (((GType) ((20) << (2)
)))))))->finalize (object);
9020}
9021
9022static void
9023meta_window_class_init (MetaWindowClass *window_class)
9024{
9025 GObjectClass *object_class;
9026
9027 object_class = G_OBJECT_CLASS (window_class)((((GObjectClass*) (void *) g_type_check_class_cast ((GTypeClass
*) ((window_class)), (((GType) ((20) << (2))))))));
9028
9029 object_class->finalize = meta_window_finalize;
9030}
9031
9032static void
9033meta_window_init (MetaWindow *window)
9034{
9035}
